loans.name: 030714-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bích works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

Bích is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 030714-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Bích joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bích has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bích has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Bích faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Bích hopes to travel for vacation within the country, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a baker she bakes bread for sale.She sells the bread at Abura in Cape Coast.She has been in this business for some time now. She is a middle school leaver. Margaret is married to an electronics  and together they have five children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children school fees and  utility bill. She will use the loan to purchase flour and other ingredients to bake her bread in large quantity to meet customer demands.She will use the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase flour and other ingredients to bake her bread in large quantity to meet customer demands.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is 37 years old; she lives with her husband and her four children in Gaza, her husband work in a public institution which familiar with low salaries, especially when they are big family and need to ensure their kids.
So in 2011 She has started working in her  poultry farm ,now she needs this loan to buy poultry feeds , Cage for Producing Eggs and build Drinking System for the chickens, , which will help him to improve the financial conditions and will lead to support the needs of her family, and reinvest in her business.
Her dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life. Rana is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds , Cage for Producing Eggs and build Drinking System for the chickens, , which will help him to improve the financial conditions and will lead to support the needs of her family, and reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair dressing equipment and materials for her hair saloon business.

loans.name: Enok

texts.en:
Enok is 43 years old. Enok has a Duck and Goat farming business. She only has 2 Goats and 2 Ducks, and has requested a loan of $50 from MBK to buy more goats and ducks. At this moment Enok is waiting for her farm animals to grow larger, so that they will be ready for sale.

Translated from Indonesian by Ang, Gwan-Liong, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Expand Duck Farming business

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni is married with one child. She runs a retail shop near her residence selling different consumable items, food in particular. Since she started this shop three years ago, she noticed only minimal improvements until she attended “Business and Entrepreneurship Training”, from YOSEFO. She is very delighted with the recent improvements. What draws her back is lack of enough working capital. Due to her weak capital base she is likely to lose some customers as she is usually faced with being out of stock. To sustain her stock level she is in need of $550 to strengthen her working capital. The amount will be used to add stock of some items, especially those with high turnover.

loans.use: Zaituni would like to add stock of items with high turnover

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Business Description

Ricardo has a small store where he sells sandwiches, colas, empanadas, lunches, etc. His store is located in a school where he sells his products from the very early morning hours, from 7am and during recess, to the students and teachers who work there. Because he has not mechanized his land, he has dedicated himself totally to his store, as it is another source of income for his family. [Translator's note: the wording suggests that Ricardo owns a plot of land, which he chooses not to cultivate, or which simply may not be an important source of income.]

Use of the Loan

Ricardo will use this loan to further improve his small store with the purchase of more products and a greater variety of offerings, so that his clients with have more options when they buy from him. Thanks to his humble and responsible nature he has been able to maintain his store inside the school.

Personal Information

Ricardo is 40 years old. With his wife's support, he has been able to keep his 5 children healthy and in school. His house is made of cement and it is very cozy and organized. Ricardo dreams of having his own store in a much more commercial area. Thanks to the work and unconditional support of his family, he has been able to provide for them.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Ricardo tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de sanduiches, colas, empanadas, almuerzos, etc... Que se encuentra ubicada dentro de una escuela, donde provee sus productos muy temprano en la mañana, desde las 7 am y durante la hora del recreo, a los estudiantes y maestros que laboran ahí. Por no tener mecanizadas sus tierras se a dedicado netamente a esta actividad ya que es otra fuente de ingresos para el y su familia.

Uso del Préstamo

En lo que tiene fijado el préstamo solicitado, Ricardo lo utilizará para adecuar aun mas su pequeña tienda, como en la compra de mayores productos y variados, para que así su clientela tenga otras opciones de escoger a la hora de comprar. Ya que gracias a su humildad y responsabilidad a podido mantener el local dentro de la escuela.

Información Personal

Ricardo tiene 40 anos de edad, que gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado su esposa en el negocio, ha llegado a mantener sus ingresos de tal manera que tienen a sus 5 saludables hijos estudiando. La estructura de su vivienda es de cemento muy acogedora y ordenada. Los sueños de Ricardo es tener su propia tienda fuera de la escuela en un lugar mucho mas comercial, que gracias al esfuerzo y al apoyo incondicional de su familia se a mantenido económicamente

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Apulu

texts.en:
Apulu F. is not a strong mother, she can barely walk or hear, but has got a very sharp mind in dealing with money. She’s a very bright lady running a pig raising business, with support from her sons. Apulu has 6 children and all are boys, four of them have migrated overseas and the other two are staying with her helping out with the business.

Apulu explains that all the work is being done by her sons. She only deals with the money of the business, and sometimes checks on counting her pigs to make sure that her sons are not selling them behind her back. Her business is now running smoothly, generating good income and making her earn good profit. She has successfully paid off her US$300 loan and now requests another loan to build a proper kitchen for her family.

loans.use: Loan will be used for home improvement.

loans.name: Khodr

texts.en: Khodr is 27 years old and lives in Nabatieh, south of Lebanon. Khodr earns a living driving a mini-van. He transports people from Nabatieh to Saida or Beirut every day. This is the second time Khodr has requested a loan from The Lebanese Association for Development - Al Majmoua. He needs this loan in order to buy furniture for his home. This young man is determined to make it on his own and to make his parents proud of him being a self made man. Khodr doesn't only think of himself but is very determined to assist his parents in any way he can.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his home

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso (Peace And Progress)– Group #2

texts.en:
Oferlina, pictured first from left, is 29 years old and has a middle school education. She is not married and raises her three children by herself - two girls (ages 8 and 6) and a one-year old boy (pictured with her).

Her business is selling fishing supplies to fishermen at the nearby beach, El Valle. She sells nets, lines and bait, which she buys at the nearby city of Samana. Oferlina speaks of wanting to provide a better life for her children. She uses the profits from her small business to buy food for her family, and to keep reinvesting in her business. She will use the next loan from Esperanza to invest in more fishing supplies.

The other businesses in her group include gasoline sales and a small convenience store. Oferlina lives in a very rural community, and her group meets in an open area next to her house (where they are pictured). Their loan officer’s name is Yacueline Jones, a kindhearted young woman who has been working with Esperanza ever since the Samana branch opened five years ago. Members of his group have been Esperanza loan associates for 2 years, and they have collectively paid back 3 previous group loans.

NOTE: This is a group loan. Oferlina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of the loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: She will use the next loan from Esperanza to invest in more fishing supplies

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemí is a young girl who recently got married. She sells vegetables close to her home at a small stand which she sets up efficiently every morning. She has no children yet as she wants to get properly started with her business in order to offer comfort and safety to the little ones that will brighten up her home in the future. She wants to increase sales by purchasing potatoes but she needs the support coming from your noble heart in order to reach her goal. Noemí thanks you in advance for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Noemí, es una joven muchacha que ha contraído matrimonio hace poco, se dedica a la venta de verduras en un pequeño espacio cerca de su domicilio en un stand que ella acondiciona eficientemente todas las mañanas. Aún no tiene hijos porque desea establecerse en este negocio a fin de poder otorgarles con su desempeño bienestar y seguridad a los pequeños que vendrán pronto a alegrar su hogar.Desea incrementar sus ventas con la compra de papa y con este propósito en mente solicita la ayuda de vuestro noble corazón a fin de cristalizar su propósito. Noemí agradece por anticipado tu disposición de apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes to increase sales.

loans.name: Djuwariah

texts.id:
Djuwariah has lived in Bali since 1999. At that time she sold traditional medicinal herbs from a pushcart. Because there was little business, she decided to switch to selling beaded sandals. She purchased unbeaded sandals in Garmen. Afterwards, employees decorated the sandals with beads. Every week she travels to to Monang-Maning in Garmen, Bali. She makes 250,000 Rupiah per week from her sandal business. From the profits she receives she invests in her business and covers her living expenses of 20,000 Rupiah per day and the cost of her children's education at 70,000 Rupiah per month.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Djuwariah tinggal di Bali sejak tahun 1999. Pada waktu itu dia berjualan jamu dengan menggunakan rombong. Karena sepi akhirnya ia beralih menjadi pengepul sandal mote. Ia mengambil di Garmen sandal – sandal yang belum dimote. Kemudian pegawainya akan menghiasinya dengan mote. Seminggu sekali ia pergi ke Garmen di kawasan Monang- Maning. Pendapatan dari pengepul sandal Rp 250.000,00 setiap minggu. Dari keuntungan yang diperoleh selain untuk menunjang usahanya juga dipakai untuk biaya hidup Rp 20.000,00/hari dan biaya pendidikan anak Rp 70.000,00/bulan.

loans.use: to increase the capitol in her business

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en:
Rocio, Delia, and Alejandra are all members of the community bank Juanito. From their involvement in the community bank they have learned to be responsible and punctual, and how to avoid getting sick.

Rocio is 24 years old. She lives with her partner and four year old daughter. She is studying social work at the local university. Rocio sells cosmetics from a catalogue to her friends and family in order to help pay for school. Rocio also has a car, which she uses as a taxi to bring in extra income.

Delia is 28 years old. She makes and sells handicrafts, such as small rag dolls. She buys materials from the city of Lima where prices are lower, and sells her products in bulk to stores. In addition, Delia owns a motorcycle taxi.

Alejandra is 28 years old. She is married and has three children. Alejandra embroiders weavings; she buys weavings, embroiders them, and does other finishing work. She sells her work to established clients in Lima.

Rocio, Delia, and Alejandra need loans of $1,050, which they will use to buy perfumes, creams, fabrics, wool, weavings, and repairing their motorcycle taxi.

Rocio, Delia, and Alejandra dream of finishing school, having a stable business, improving their children’s lives, and owning a home.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, fabrics, wool, weavings, and repair their motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa is a woman who, with great tenacity and effort, is succeeding in improving her standard of living. Financial and family problems prevented Luisa from completing her high school education but she found ways of improving her family situation. She is a dedicated woman and from early in the morning she is busy preparing delicious stews to sell as a street vendor in one of the busiest streets in the city of Juliaca. As soon as this finishes, she heads for one of the passenger terminals in her city to sell bus tickets to Arequipa and Cuzco. She earns a commission for every ticket she sells. Both activities provide indispensable income for her family.

Luisa plans to purchase the basic ingredients for her stews in larger quantities and at wholesale prices as this would increase her profit margin. With your generous heart she can succeed in her plan.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Luisa, es una mujer que con mucho tesón y esfuerzo está logrando mejorar su condición de vida, por problemas familiares y económicos no logró concluir sus estudios superiores pero si encontró la manera de mejorar su situación familiar.Esta empeñosa mujer desde tempranas horas de la mañana se dedica a preparar deliciosos potajes para venderlos en forma ambulatoria en una de las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad de Juliaca, luego de concluir con este negocio inmediatamente se dirige a uno de los terminales ínterdepartamentales de su ciudad para ofrecer boletos hacia los departamentos de Arequipa y Cuzco, por cada boleto vendido logra obtener un determinado porcentaje de ganancias, ambas actividades le otorgan ingresos indispensables para sus gastos familiares.El deseo de Raquel es comprar insumos de primera necesidad, considera que adquiriendo estos productos al por mayor la preparación de sus potajes le resultará mucho más económico.Con tu generoso corazón podrá concretar sus proyectos.

loans.use: Purchase of non-perishable items in larger quantities to continue preparing her delicious stews.

loans.name: Firida

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Firida S.. She is married and has 1 child aged 4. In 2004, Firida established her genge business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Her bar is a good place to chill with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. It’s the kind of place where you kick back on a plastic chair under a tree with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’ (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to anyone and everyone who happens to wander by.

loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk.

loans.name: Gun Keshari

texts.en: Gun Keshari M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Thecho village. She opened her grocery shop 5 years ago to improve the living standard of her family.  She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses, biscuits, and noodles in her shop. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in that area so she is requesting a loan of 30,000 Rupees to buy grocery items to meet the demand.  Mrs. M. lives with her mother-in-law, husband and one son. Her husband is Shiva Das M. and is a farmer. Her son is studying in grade 7.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Block C Nime A 2037-3 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Cicilia L.. She is currently sells cosmetics at the market and is requesting a loan to construct houses for rent. Cicilia is 35 years old and married to a peasant. She has six children, ranging from age 5 to 18, all of whom go to school. Each week, Cicilia makes approximately 100 sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to construct houses for rent.

Cicilia is joined in her small group by Karkic J., Karla A., Paida M., and Loice B.. Karkic sells beer and wants to open up a shop. Karla sells bread and wants a loan to construct an oven. Paida sells beans at the market and wants to expand the business. Loice sells sugar and beans and is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To construct houses to rent.

loans.name: Sada's Kambaya Group

texts.en:
Sada is a 26-year-old, married woman with 2 children who are 8 and 6 years old. She began selling clothes in 2008. Every day, she works extremely hard from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $30 from her sales.

Sada now seeks a loan in order to buy more clothes for her business. Importantly, she will share the loan proceeds with her subgroup member, Rose, who has her own business selling groceries.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina is 31 years old and has two children, aged 13 and 15.  Her husband has a full time job and Jasmina works as a bakery assistant.  She earns about 150 KM monthly, which is not enough for the needs of her household.

Jasmina now has one cow and a calf.  She intends to use the loan of 600 KM, along with some money she has saved, to buy another cow. She can earn more money by selling milk and milk products, and a calf for Ramadan (Muslim holiday) than she can by working at her current job.

loans.use: To buy another cow.

loans.name: Esmelda

texts.es: Junto con su nieta inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante en Tola, actualmente ella vende en una caseta ubicada en el mercado donde ofrece sus productos, también vende sus productos de forma ambulante. Con el financiamiento de ADIM ella ofrece gaseosas y una variedad de comidas como tacos, atol, etc. Ella piensa seguir creciendo con los créditos que ADIM le pueda dar y un día vender comidas: como almuerzos, desayunos, también contratar a una persona que cocine los alimentos y ella atender más la venta. Vive sola con una hija, pero ella tiene su negocio independiente, le apoya con algunos gastos de la casa y le da ayuda a la nieta con algunas cosas personales.
texts.en:
Along with her granddaughter, Esmelda began her small business selling in Tola on foot. Currently, she sells from a small stand located in the market where she offers her products. She also sells her products on foot. With the financing from ADIM, she offers sodas and a variety of food like tacos, atol (a Central American drink), etc. She is thinking of continuing to grow with the loans that ADIM can give her and, one day, sell food such as lunches, breakfasts, and also hire a person to cook the dishes so that she may attend more to selling. She lives alone with her daughter, but she owns her business independently. She helps her with some of the bills and gives her granddaughter help with personal things.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora inicio hace 5 años con el negocio ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del papa de sus hijos para salir adelante con los gastos, y necesitaba dinero para la manutención de sus 2 hijos, así que decidió vender productos cosméticos por catalogo además hace manualidades en navidad, día de amor y la amistad, y otras fechas importantes, que también le ayudan con los ingresos familiares, como en esta compañía le dan oportunidad de pagar en un mes vende y luego recoge el dinero y paga las factura.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para hacer una inversión fuerte para comprar productos y hacer unas canastas con diversos productos para vender en navidad.
texts.en:
Dora started her business 5 years ago because she does not count on the support of her children’s father to pay for the household expenses. She needed money to support her 2 children, so she decided to sell cosmetics by catalogue. She also makes handicrafts, which further increase her income, for Christmas, Valentine’s Day, and other important holidays. Since this company gives her the chance to pay in one month, she sells products, then collects the money and pays for the orders.

She needs a loan of $400.00 USD, which will be repaid in 6 months, in order to invest in the purchase of products and make assorted gift baskets to sell during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Muharram

texts.en: Muharram R. is 49 years old, married, and has three children.  As a dynamic and caring mother, Muharrram works hard as a market vendor to provide for her family.  She sells many kinds of hair accessories for girls and women and earns enough profit to cover the expenses of schooling and university for her children.  In order to guarantee that they have access to education, Muharram wants to wants to increase the variety of products in her store and bolster the inventory of these goods.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase these goods.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantitiy of hair products for resale.

loans.name: Dok's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for three borrowers. They all live in Ratanak Commune in Battambang Province.

The leader, Mrs. Dok S. O. is 37, married, and has five children. Four of her children are students, and one son is an English Teacher. Her husband, Keo Van Own, 44, is in the Cambodia Military and receives a salary of $35 a month. Mrs. Dok S. O. owns and runs a small store where she sells various kinds of groceries, like cooking ingredients and cakes for kids that live in her village. S. O. is requesting a loan to purchase additional groceries for sale in hopes of expanding her business.

The two other borrowers are Mrs. Meak S., 26, and Mrs. Kim Y., 57, who is a widow. Mrs. Meak S. makes a living selling grilled bananas. She is requesting a loan to pay for house repairs. Mrs. Kim Y. sells fish in the market. To earn extra income, Y. is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks to resell.

loans.use: Buy additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya has two grown daughters. They live in Belaya Tserkov. Nataliya is a small market entrepreneur and sells women’s clothing and footwear in a marketplace located in Levanevskogo district of her home town. Nataliya has been in this business for 10 years. She has already invested about 30,000 Grivnas in this business.

Nataliya is hoping to use the loan of 5,000 Grivnas to increase assorted inventory for sale in her kiosk which would help her increase her proceeds and net profit as a result. She is planning to invest a portion of the income generated from the sales into completion of reconstruction project of her apartment.

Nataliya is very hard-working. She is a true fighter – she never gives up and keeps moving on no matter what. Nataliya is willing to take on financial burdens of her family and her daughters’, too, and wants to make sure they have all they need.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jovielyn

texts.en:
Jovielyn B. is a farmer and a store owner. She is 31 years old and has two children. Her husband is a rice grower. Sometimes, her husband drives a passenger motorcycle to add to their limited income. Her children are still young; one is in elementary grade while the other is still at home. Because life is never easy, she and her husband work together to sustain their family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 13,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed and farm inputs. She will also buy additional merchandise for her store. In this way, she will be able to contribute to the family income.

CEVI helps Jovielyn succeed in her business. Credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage are what the clients receive by joining the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her store and farm inputs for her farm

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 40-year-old married man with three children, living in Harouf, southern Lebanon. He has been in the floor tile business for the past 20 years, which he learned from his father who used to take Samir with him to work during holidays. Today, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 in order to buy scaffolding.

loans.use: Buy scaffolding

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa S. est une jeune femme qui a pour l’activité la vente de draps, sacs, parfum, tissus et divers en couture.  Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis deux ans, et elle sollicite ce premier crédit au près de IMCEC pour renforcer ses activités.  Cette femme dynamique et travailleuse est mariée et elle habite à Thiès.  Avec les profits de son entreprise, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Awa S. is a young woman who sells sheets, bags, perfume, cloth and a variety of sewn items. She has been in business for two years and is requesting this first loan from IMCEC in order to bolster her business. This energetic and hard-working woman is married and lives in Thiès. With the profits from her business she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets, bags, perfume, cloth and a variety of sewn items

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Carlota es conviviente, 27 años y estudia contabilidad, Carlota tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, carnes, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su pareja.
Carlota necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar.
Los sueños de carlota son ampliar su negocio, ser mayorista y culminar sus estudios de contabilidad.
texts.en:
Carlota is a member of the Manantial Communal Bank. She is 27 years old and studies accounting. Carlota runs a store out of her house selling groceries, meats and vegetables. With the help of her partner she keeps the store open seven days a week. Carlota needs a loan of $300 to buy rice, pasta, and sugar. Her dreams are to see her business grow, become a wholesaler and complete her accounting studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, fideos, azúcar.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en:
Rocio is the secretary of the Virgen Asunta Village Bank, a group from the town of Urco, located just outside the city of Calca and about an hour from the city of Cusco. Rocio is 48 years old and is married. She used to work in education as an administrator, but didn’t like the work very much. She quit her job when she was invited to travel to England to work on a cruise ship teaching Spanish to children, but before she left she met her husband, a schoolteacher who lived next door to her, and decided to stay in Peru. They eventually married, and she now has her own small business selling clothing and makeup by catalog.

Rocio is requesting a loan of 1000 soles. She will lend half of the money to her husband so that he can pay for some paperwork he needs in order to receive his master’s degree, and will use the other half of the money to buy clothing and makeup. The couple will repay the loan together. Rocio has pledged to repay her loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Pay for husband's master's degree, buy clothing and makeup

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Калонов Нурулло житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 47 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Нурулло занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота уже 20 лет. Основной источник дохода его семьи является этот бизнес. Нурулло планирует увеличить поголовье скота и развивать бизнес. Для этого он обратился к нам за кредитом. Это поможет ему наладить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Nurullo K. as a resident of the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 47 years old, is married and has three children. Nurullo has been fattening and selling livestock for 20 years now. His main source of income is this business. Nurullo plans to increase his livestock count and grow his business. Because of this he has turned to us for credit. This will help him to improve his family’s financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Janett Del Socorro

texts.es: Jannett del Socorro Ramírez García tiene 44 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Tiene cinco hijos y tres están a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos, y estos no pasaran por circunstancias tan difíciles en la vida. Los financiamientos le han ayudado a crecer. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, calzado, ropa para caballeros y ropa para niños. Su deseo es de brindar a sus hijos el apoyo necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jannett del Socorro Ramírez García is a forty-four-year-old single mother. Of her five children, three are in her care. Her job for more than 20 years has been the sale of general merchandise. She began this business because she had to support her children and desired that the circumstances of their lives would not be so difficult. Loans have helped her grow. This loan will be used for the purchase of inventory: clothing, footwear, and clothes for men and children. Her desire is to give her children the support necessary to raise their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 38 años es un padre muy amoroso y cuidadoso, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su hijo menor Cristhian de 13 años. Él desea sobresalir en la vida y darle una buena educación a su hijo. Entre fierros y viejas carrocerías pasa sus días, su trabajo es el planchado y reparación de carros, actividad que ha sabido explotar muy bien y que actualmente le da los ingresos económicos necesarios para velar por la salud, educación y alimentación de su hijo. José es un buen mecánico y siempre tiene trabajos que realizar, debido al gran número de clientes que tiene, le gusta mucho reparar los carros y dejarlos como nuevos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y siente que lo más difícil de su trabajo es conseguir los repuestos necesarios para el arreglo de los autos, espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca más y pueda incrementar la cantidad de clientes que tiene y de esta manera llevar una mejor vida. Este es el primer préstamo de José con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesto a realizarlas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es uno de los socios más participativos y solidarios. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos repuestos para la reparación de carros, y así podrá brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and is a very loving and caring father, he lives in a rented house with his youngest son, 13 year old Cristhian. He wants to excel in life and provide a good education for his son. He spends his days between irons and old coaches, his job is ironing and repairing cars, an activity that has gone very well and now gives him the necessary income to ensure health, education and food for his son. José is a good mechanic and he always has work to do, due to the large number of customers he has. He really likes to repair cars and restore them as new. He has been doing this for 15 years, and he feels that the most difficult thing about his job is finding spare parts to fix the cars. He hopes his business will grow more in the future and that he can increase the number of customers he has, thus leading a better life. This is José's first loan with MFP, he knows he has to make his payments and is ready to make them on time, in his village bank he is one of the most participatory members who shows his solidarity. With the one thousand soles requested he will buy new spare parts to repair cars, this way he can provide better service to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel B. is from the village of Yumbing, Camiguin. She is 35 years old, single, and has one infant child. Rachel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rachel is just starting this business. In 2009, Rachel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rachel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph Y. is married and has two children. He has received schooling through middle school and has earned his Middle School Leaving certificate (MSLC). Joseph has been selling used electrical appliances, such as TV sets, in Kotokoraba in Cape Coast since 1994. His wife is a secretary. Joseph uses his income to pay for school fees. Joseph will use the loan to purchase used electrical appliances to resell. He plans to reinvest the new profits in his business.

loans.use: Joseph will use the loan to purchase used electrical appliances to resell

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: Don José Dolores de 42 años, casado, comerciante desde muy joven  ha trabajado para ayudar a sus padres y luego a su propia familia, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 2 y 11 años de edad,  su negocio es la venta de plásticos y electrodomésticos. Sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa para darle una mejor seguridad a su familia. Con este crédito es su sexto préstamo el cual espera invertir en comprar productos plásticos, ropa, y electrodoméstico con esto espera incrementar el volumen de ventas y generar mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los préstamos ya que es de muco beneficios.
texts.en:
José Dolores is 42 and married. He has been a merchant since he was very young. He has worked to help his parents, and later his own family. He and his wife have two children ages 2 and 11. He sells plastics and domestic appliances. His plan is to be able to finish building his house to give his family more security. This is his sixth loan. He will buy plastic products, clothes, and household appliances with the loan. He thanks the institution for the support of the loans because they are very helpful.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, plastics, and household appliances

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa est une dame qui habite le quartier Sagbado à Lomé. C’est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de différentes qualités. Elle est mariée et ce commerce lui permet d’apporter son aide financière à son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2001 ; elle dispose d’une clientèle qui lui est fidèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 pagnes Super Wax, 05 pagnes Hitarget, 03 pagnes Soso. Depuis 3 mois déjà, elle  s’est lancée dans la vente d’articles scolaires. Ce prêt lui servira de plus à acheter 20 pièces de cahier de 100 pages, 15 pièces de cahiers de 200 pages ainsi que des bics et crayons.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a woman who lives in the neighborhood of Sagbado in Lomé. She is a traveling saleswoman, selling "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) of differing qualities. She is married and this business enables her to help her husband pay for the needs of their 2 children. She has been in business since 2001; her clients are faithful to her. She is requesting a loan from WAGES (a micro-finance group) to pay for 5 "Super Wax" brand "pagnes", 5 "Hitarget" brand "pagnes" and 3 "Soso" brand "pagnes". For the past 3 months, she has also been selling school supplies. She will also use this loan to purchase 20 one-hundred page notebooks, 15 two-hundred page notebooks, in addition to pens and pencils.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase "pagnes" (colored wax cloths) and school supplies

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther es una emprendedora mujer de 37 años, vive con sus hijos: Nilton, Josep y Luisa de 17 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica a brindar el servicio de llamadas telefónicas por celular en los alrededores de uno de los centros comerciales más conocidos de su localidad. Además de trabajar en un pequeño puesto, tiene tres jóvenes muchachas que trabajan para ella en otros puestos del mismo centro comercial. Esther está muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que le permite sentirse independiente, y con las ganancias puede brindarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. Para el futuro tiene pensado comprar más puestos (módulos móviles) para obtener mayores ingresos, pues sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá lograr todos sus objetivos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más equipos celulares de mejor calidad para que sean más durables y así podrá contratar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Esther is an enterprising woman who is 37 years old, and lives in her own home with her children: Nilton, Josep and Luisa, who is 17 years old. For a year she has had a call center business, where she provides her customers with the ability to make telephone calls from a cellular phone in the outskirts of a commercial center that is very well known in her locality. In addition to working a small stand, she has three young women who work for her in other stands in the same commercial center. Esther is very happy with her work, since it makes her feel independent and provides her children with a good quality of life. For the future, she intends to buy more stands (movable modules) in order to obtain an increased income. She knows that with a lot of effort and dedication she can achieve all of her goals. This is her third loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual in all of her payments. With the money she is requesting now she will buy more cellular equipment of better quality so it will be more durable, and this way she can hire additional people.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cellular telephones

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine M. is 23 years old,married with one child of six month of age .
she has an experince of three years in sewing .she starts everyday her business from 6hoo AM to 7h00 PM .
Before doing this business of sewing clothes,she could not get all needs for her family.
Francine is requesting her loan from vision finance company witch will hel her to expand her business in order to get more profits.

loans.use: for expanding her workshop of sewing clothes

loans.name: Aramata

texts.fr: Aramata G., 45 ans, mariée avec 2 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de NIAFOR depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle a reçu 11 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans problème. Avec son crédit elle développe un commerce de d'arachide. Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la maison, à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et à assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Aramata G. is 45 years old, married and responsible for two children. She has been a member of the Niafor Village Bank for the last 5 and a half years. She has taken out eleven loans and has duly repaid each without difficulty. With these loans she has built a peanut business. The profits earned through this business has allowed her to help with the household expenses, improve the family's living conditions and provided for the education of her children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her  small business activities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell gasoline and motor oil

loans.name: Kyakuwa Group Of Kayunga

texts.en:
M. Grace is married with four children aged 5, 14, 16 and 18 years old. She also takes care of three dependents, all of whom are in secondary or primary school. Grace is a friendly lady who has run a retail shop in Kangulumira trading centre for 13 years. She sells general merchandise and says that, so far, she has faced no major challenges in her business. Being friendly has attracted more people to her business hence she has made more sales. She is able to make 70,000 UGX profit a week.

In the future, Grace would like to sell her merchandise wholesale in order to make more profit, educate her children, and be healthy. Grace is requesting a loan to add more stock to her shop and boost her business.

loans.use: To add more stock to her shop

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Charito, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia Picota, Departamento San Martín. Es casada, tiene 28 años y 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Charito, mujer trabajadora y luchadora, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de leña, con la seguridad y optimismo que siempre le ha caracterizado, por iniciativa propia implemento su propio negocio de venta de golosinas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Lleva poco tiempo en el negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado, ya que le va muy bien.

En la actualidad, cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes moradores y amigos conocidos, que ya conocen el tipo de actividad que realiza,  que a diario acuden a su puesto, donde ella los atiende con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará: paquetes de galletas en diferentes sabores, chifles en docenas, chocolates como: cañonazos, sublimes,  para aumentar sus productos y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Charito, esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Charito is a member of the El Triunfo Communal Bank in the San Hilarion district of the Picota province, department of San Martin. She is a 28-year-old married mother with 1 dependent child.

A hardworking woman, Charito used to sell firewood with the optimism and self-confidence that she is noted for. She then took the initiative and started her own candy business, which she set up in a well-equipped area of her house, where she attends to her customers. She has only been in business for a short time, but she is very satisfied with her accomplishments as her business is prospering.

She currently has faithful customers, her main ones being her friends and local residents, since they visit her stand on a daily basis, and she attends to them with the charm and politeness for which she is noted.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase packages of cookies (assorted flavors), chifles (fried plantain chips) by the dozen, and chocolate (Cañonazo and Sublime brand) to increase her inventory and satisfy her customers. Charito is prepared for everything, and she feels that she still has the strength to continue working to get ahead in life. She gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her reach her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets

loans.name: Sapah Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Sapah' group in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown. This group of entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of SLL 2,900,000 to enable them to expand their businesses.

The leader of this group of borrowers is Hawanatu T. on the right. Hawanatu was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. She is twenty-four years of age, single, with one child who is in class one.

Hawanatu sells cottons, lace, and school uniforms. She has been doing this business for over four years now. With this loan, Hawanatu will buy five packets of lace and six lengths of cotton cloth. A packet of lace costs something between SLL 80,000 – 100,000 and a length of cotton costs something between SLL 50,000 – 60,000.

loans.use: Buy five packets of lace and six lengths of cotton cloth

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal Gaviotas pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, están juntas por primera vez, agrupándose para acceder al préstamo y los demás servicios que oferta Pro Mujer, todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de polleras (faldas), verduras, zapatos.
Una de las integrantes es María C. de 20 años se dedica a vender ropa variada en diferentes ferias ofreciendo persona a persona, otra integrante es Patricia M. de 24 años vende celulares en la Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto en un lugar fijo.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para fortalecer sus negocios y así generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos de comida, vivienda, ropa y educación de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Gaviotas Communal Association is part of the German Busch Community Center. The members of this group have joined together for the first time to access a loan and take advantage of other services offered by Pro Mujer. They all have different retail businesses such as selling skirts, vegetables, and shoes.

One of the members is María C., who is 20 years old and sells different types of clothing at the various fairs. She offers her products on an individual basis, one customer at a time. Another member is Patricia M., who is 24 years old. She has an established vending location on the outskirts of El Alto where she sells mobile phones.

All of the members are in need of loans so that they can strengthen their businesses and generate enough income to cover expenses such as food, housing, clothing, and education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math A. S., 39 years old, is a vegetable seller from Phnom Penh City. She has been operating her business in the Toulsong Kei Market and sells different kinds of vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. 

Math is married to Mr. Teur As Math who is a motorcycle and a boat driver. He also works with her in selling vegetables. Math A. S. cares for four children, all of whom are single; one of her sons is also employed as a vegetable seller. 

Math A. S. is taking out her second loan to buy materials in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia, es casada, vive en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 65 años. Ignacia alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo de venta de comida. Ignacia nos cuenta que esta encargada del comedor de trabajadores de la empresa “Backus”, ella prepara almuerzo para 150 empleados. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. Ignacia forma parte del banco Comunal “Yanapakuy” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo de los 700 dólares, que invertirá en comprar arroz, aceite y azúcar. Ya son varios  años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su negocio. Ignacia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
 
(Yanapakuy es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa “ayudemos”).
texts.en:
65 year-old Ignacia is married and lived in the city of Cusco. She alternates her household tasks with her work selling meals. She is in charge of the workers’ dining area of the ‘Backus’ business where she makes lunch for 150 employees. She’s had the business for two years, and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Ignacia is a member of the Arariwa Association’s ‘Yanapakuy’ community bank. She needs a loan of $700 which will be used to buy rice, oil, and sugar. Ignacia is grateful for the opportunity to get a loan in this way and promises to repay the money according to the schedule. (‘Yanapakuy’ is a Quechua word meaning ‘Let us help’.)

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Asejere

texts.en:
N. is 35 years old, is married with three children, and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is hardworking and believes that women are helpmates and need to support their men in keeping the home.

N. operates a restaurant and bar, selling drinks and cooked foods in order to make a living. With the profit from the business she is able to save a little money and assist her husband in running the home.

N. hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks and foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Leonora's Group

texts.en:
Leonora M. is from the village of Sebasi Clarin. She is 39 years old. Leonora is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members.

Leonora is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, sugar, salt, candies, soap, and toothpaste to the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Leonora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan A. is currently in the business of selling ice cream and groundnut paste at home and is requesting a loan to purchase onions and cooking oil to sell.  Juan is 32 years old and is married to a soldier. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Usmonbek

texts.en:
C. Usmonbek is a 37-year-old businessman. He is married and together with his wife they have 4 children. Usmonbek is a farmer, like his wife. They started their work 15 years ago. The beginning was very difficult, because they needed to invest a lot of working capital. With much effort and the help of his wife, he was able to move forward and today has a large plot of land. 

His vegetables are very good quality which he says is due to the constant irrigation they receive since the business has a complete underground irrigation system. Usmonbek requests the loan for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds. This will allow him to better provide for his family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Concepcion Primitiva

texts.es: La Sra. Concepción trabaja con Emprender desde al año 2001, en un grupo llamado Elección, grupo bueno ubicado en el Mercado Los Pinos, la Sra. Se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, ella trabaja en ese mercado hace mas de 20 años, ella tiene hijos ya profesionales y estudiantes universitarios, el esposo es empleado de la Policia, con muchos años de servicio, la Sra. solicita este crédito para compra de mercaderia y en parte para cubrir gastos de estudios de tesis de su hija menor, es una persona muy buena y responsable, ambos esposos compraron un terreno hace pocos años por la zona de Reyes Carvajal, camino a la Florida e hicieron construir su casita con los ahorros que tenian y los prestamos que sacaron, en fin es una persona muy trabajadora y puntual en sus pagos. Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Concepción has been working with Emprender since 2001, in a group called Elección, a fine group located in Mercado Los Pinos. She sells seasonal fruit and has been working in this market for more than 20 years. Some of her children have already a job, and others are university students, and her husband is a policeman with many years in the line of duty. The loan she is requesting will be used partly to buy products, and partly to cover the expenses for the university graduation of her youngest daughter. Concepción is a very good and responsible person; a few years ago she and her husband bought some land in the Reyes Carvajal area, on the way to La Florida, and had their house built there with their savings and the loans they obtained; she is a very hard-working woman, always very accurate with her payments. They are really grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Gustavo Hidalgo

texts.es:
Gustavo Hidalgo M. B. tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, y vive con su esposa e hijos, Gustavo (24) y Diego (18), en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Gustavo es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura. 
Gustavo es agricultor y los productos que cultiva son maíz, trigo, habas y arbeja.  Hace las compras y las ventas cada mes en el mercado de San Miguel, cuando se necesita. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos para invertir en la agricultura. Piense que va a ser más fácil con el crédito. Su sueño seria de poder hacer una casita para su familia y crecer más el negocio. 
Le gusta hacer deportes en su tiempo libre: jugar volley y también pasar tiempo con sus hijos
texts.en:
Gustavo Hidalgo M. B. is 50 years old and married. He and his wife have two children, Gustavo (age 24) and Diego (age 18), and live in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar Province.

Gustavo is a member of the Communal Bank “Lotan Bajo”, which is 30 minutes away from the town of San Miguel. The group has a total of 13 members, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Gustavo is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and peas. He buys and sells each month at the market in San Miguel as needed. Gustavo is requesting a loan to buy compost for his farming activities. He believes the loan will making things easier for him. His dreams include building a house and expanding his business. He enjoys sports in his free time, such as volleyball, and spending time with his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Richard Eduardo

texts.es: Richard tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente tine una hija de 6 meses de edad, el y su familia viven en la casa de su suegra, vivienda que esta ubicada en AA.HH Tarapaca en casa de adobe de un piso. Richar se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte urbano por la ciudad, en una moto taxi alquilada. Se inicio desde muy joven a esta actividad. Su sueño y objetivo es poder tener su vehiculo propio, con el dinero que solicita sera para gastos personales, construira una parte del terreno que le dio su suegra.
texts.en:
Richard is 24 years old year old, in a common marriage, and has a six month old daughter. He and his family live in the adobe house of his mother-in-law which is located in the settlement of Tarapaca. Richard provides urban transportation services throughout the city using a rented motorcycle taxi. He started this business at a very young age. His dream and goal is to have his own vehicle. The money he requested will be used for personal expenses, specifically to start building on part of the land given to him by his mother-in-law.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin building on the land given to him by his mother-in-law

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es: La señora Juana Julia V. O. tiene 28 años de edad, Casada, se dedica a la Artesanía “elaboración de delantales Típicas”, también cuenta con una tienda de consumo diario, su tienda se encuentra en un sitio muy reconocido, por la misma razón es que necesita más capital para poder ampliar su tienda y tener todos los artículos que sus clientes demandan, se decidió efectuar un préstamo para poder comprar más productos para la tienda, esto con el proposito de contribuir con sus vecinos al ofecerles diferentes articulos  de consumo diario al alcance de su hogar y tambien mejorar sus ganacias, como también mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Julia is 28 years old, married, and presently dedicated to artisan crafts, making traditional aprons. She also has a store that sells all types of snacks. She has approached the ASDIR association for a small loan to be able to purchase more products for her store. Juana notes that the store is situated in a very recognized location. And she also needs more capital to be able to expand the store. With this small assistance, she could improve its utility, as well as bettering the condition of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mas producto para su tienda

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou C., 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer and grows rice for an income of $1 per day. Her husband is a teacher at a public school, earning an income of $2.10 per day. 

C. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a computer for one of the children to operate a business of transferring data into mobiles. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Koboyodou

texts.fr: S. est une femme  célibataire, pour subvenir à ses propres charges, elle s'est lancée en  2000 dans la vente de boissons alcoolisées appelé tchoucoutou faite à base de sorgho. le stock de sorgho dont elle dispose est épuisé, elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner avec 4 sacs de sorgho au nord du togo dans la ville de ketao et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Koboyodou S. is an unmarried woman. In 2000, she began selling alcoholic beverages made from sorghum called tchoucoutou to support herself. As she has run out of her stock of sorghum, she is requesting a loan to re-stock with 4 bags of sorghum from the north of Togo in the town of Ketao and to provide for the transport of the merchandise.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of sorghum

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Lluvia lo conforman Lorena del Socorro Calderón de 37 años, Flor de María U. y Martha Lorena M. Sáenz. Lorena del Socorro, es la coordinadora de este grupo, en su casa tiene una tortillería, es ahí que vende también frijoles cocidos, cuajadas y otros rubros. Flor, vende hielo, chocobananos y frijoles cocidos, ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de materia prima y desea añadir en su negocio la venta de leña. Martha Lorena es dueña de un cafetín en el cual tiene muchos productos como chiverías y golosinas y con el crédito desea mejorarlo invirtiendo más en gaseosas y refrescos.
texts.en:
The members that make up the Lluvia Solidarity Group are Lorena del Socorro Calderón (37 years old), Flor de María U. and Martha Lorena M. Sáenz. Lorena del Socorro is the group leader. In her home she has a tortilla restaurant where she also sells cooked beans, curds, and other items. Flora sells ice, chocolate-covered bananas and cooked beans. She will use the loan to buy ingredients and also wants to start selling firewood. Martha Lorena is the owner of a small café in which she sells many products like snack foods and candy. With this loan she will improve her business by investing in more sodas and other drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Adolfo De Trinidad

texts.es: Adolfo C. V. labora para UNICA como guarda de seguridad resguardando el local de la Universidad, es casado tiene un hijo de edad escolar dos personas dependen de el, su esposa y el hijo .Este es el primer desembolso que CEPRODEL le otorga por lo que lo implementara en mejorar el techo de su casa compra de zinc y perlín.
texts.en:
Adolfo C. V. works for UNICA as a security guard, protecting the premises of the University. He is married and has a school-aged son. Two people are dependent upon him: his wife and his son. This is the first disbursement that CEPRODEL has granted him. He will use the loan to improve the roof of his house by buying corrugated metal roof sheeting and structural beams.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing sheets to repair his roof

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes G., 60, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Widowed and left to support her child, Lourdes works hard to be able to do so. By the grace of God, Lourdes has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide for her family. A dream for most Filipino parents like Lourdes, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lourdes operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lourdes dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.

loans.name: Cepriana

texts.en:
Cepriana R. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 52 years old. Cepriana is married and has 7 children. Her eldest child is 29 years old and the youngest is 12. To make a living, Cepriana owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cepriana wishes for her children to finish college someday and have a bright future.

Cepriana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cepriana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Loeb

texts.en:
Loeb M. is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She stays at home to care for three school-aged children and cooks for her family. Besides her housework, she is also a clothes seller around her community. The family income is contributed to by her husband who works in construction building. Her husband appears in the photo. 

Presently, Loeb M. has been planning to expand her business because she thinks that it is a profitable one for her family. That is why she requested a loan that will enable her business to purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
El señor Jose Maria B. C. es trabajador de la Alcaldia de Chinandega con quienes se firmo convenio para deducciones de salario quincenalmente, el señor habita carretera a Leon, se desempeña como Vigilante y tiene 11 años de laborar, es casado con 01 hijo y su esposa trabaja lavando y planchando.

El Señor B. C. solicito credito para  compra de una motocicleta de segunda para transportarse de su casa a su trabajo, pues le queda bastante retirado, lleva ya 04 creditos con CEPRODEL y ha demostrado ser muy responsable.
texts.en:
Jose Maria B. C. works at the Mayor's Office in Chinandega.  He has an arrangement with them whereby they deduct his repayments from his salary every two weeks.  He lives on the road to León.  He works as a watchman and has been working for 11 years.  He is married with one child and his wife works washing and ironing.

Mr B. C. is requesting this loan to buy a second-hand motorbike so that he can get to and from work since he is quite far away.  He has already had 4 loans with CEPRODEL and has shown himself to be very responsible.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Lisseth

texts.es: Sra. Lisseth tiene 21 años de edad  oriunda de Santa Cruz el Torno  actualmente vive en la zona de Puerto Rico hace  12 años. Su Actividad es la venta de productos medicinales en la zona del torno y nueva terminal hace 3 años normalmente vende sus productos medicinales antes que salgan los buses, también ofrece sus productos en los buses, su estado civil separado hace 2 años y cuenta con 2 hijos a cargo,  El Destino del crédito es para la compra de productos medicinales por cantidad, es una persona joven pero muy  trabajadora que sola tiene que velar por la salud y educación de sus pequeños.   La Sra. se siente muy agradecida con emprender por la confianza depositada
texts.en: Mrs. Lisseth is 21 years old, she hails from Santa Cruz el Torno and at present she lives in the Puerto Rico area where she has lived for 12 years. She has sold medicinal products for some 3 years in the el Torno area and in a new bus terminal. She usually sells her medicinal products before the buses leave; she also offers her products on the buses. Mrs. Lisseth has been separated for 2 years and she has 2 children under her care. The loan will be used to buy medicinal products; she is young but she is a very hardworking person since she is alone and has to watch over the wellbeing and education of her children. She is very grateful to Emprender (Kiva’s field partner) for the trust given to her.

loans.use: To buy merchandize wholesale.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan K. is a 35-year-old man who lives and works in Sabirabad. He is married and has 2 young sons. Rovshan runs his own general store with the help of  his brother. He started his business in 2005. This is Rovshan's first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. He used this loan of 1000 AZN to buy more goods to sell in his store. His business is the only source of income for his family. Rovshan plans to open another store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Susana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Susana vive en casa de alquiler  con sus dos hijos. Ella quedo muy joven viuda cuenta que fue un golpe duro para ella, pero tenia que salir adelante, y tubo que buscar a que dedicarse ya que antes solo su esposo se dedicaba a la mantener el hogar,  ahora se dedica a la venta de pescado y  mariscos, lo hizo con el poco capital que tenia, poco a poco fue siendo conocida por restaurantes famosos. Ahora ella entrega al por mayor y menor, le va muy bien en esta actividad, pero no tiene suficiente espacio para poner los mariscos ya que estos le mandan desde Perú o Ecuador y es por ese motivo que solicito el crédito para comprar dos nuevas heladeras y así se mantengan frescos sus productos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Susana lives in a rental house with her two children.  She was left a widow at a very early age.  She tells us that it was a very hard blow for her but that she had to get ahead and had to look for a business activity to make money since, up until that point, her husband had been the only one who supported their household financially.

Susana now she sells fish and seafood.  She set herself up with a bit of capital that she had and gradually became known by some famous restaurants.  Now she delivers her products wholesale and retail.  She is doing very well in this business but she doesn't have enough space for her seafood  since they send them from Peru or Ecuador.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy two new fridges to keep her products fresh.  She is grateful to the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy two fridges

loans.name: Los Solares 1 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is one of the members of Los Solares 1 (her community is called Plot 1). They are micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes, education, etc. in the city of San Pedro D. Macoris, which is famous for its athletes and its sugar industry. At present, its economy depends on the duty-free industrial zones, the cement industry and other minor activities like tourism. Sonia is the mother of three children and, together with her husband, she has been able to proviD. the necessities for her family. 

Sonia is receiving her ninth loan. For each loan, she has maD. her payments on time and has maD. good investments. She is planning to invest her new loan to purchase new clothes for men, women and children. She is going to use her earnings to save and continue providing the necessities for her home. By saving regularly, she will be able to build a new home - this is her more difficult challenge. Her favorite activity is reading.

loans.use: To buy clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Kyosimba Onanya Kibuga-Mpigi Group

texts.en: 34 year old S. Jalia is affiliated to Kyosimba onanya Kibuga group-Mpigi.  She has been running her retail shop in Mpigi town for ten years. At her shop she sells a variety of general merchandise retail commodities which are mostly of high preference to families around her operating area. Monthly this business generates her shillings 800,000. Jalia who is happily married with six kids has side coffee and ginger sells businesses. With this loan, Jalia says she is going to purchase more general merchandise retail commodities to resell at her shop.

loans.use: The purchase of more general merchandise retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana Virginia P. Martínez de 29 años es propietaria de una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita. Ella inicio con la venta de tajas con queso, tacos y enchiladas luego gracias a los préstamos invirtió en carne y pollo. 
Ella tiene la meta de invertir en otro negocio en futuro próximo con el fin de proporcionarle una  mejor calidad de vida a su hijo de 6 años.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Virginia P. Martínez is 29 years old and is an owner of a "fritanga" which is a fried food restaurant. She started out selling cheese slices, tacos, enchiladas, and was later able to buy meat and chicken thanks to a previous loan.
She has in mind growing another business in the future to be able to offer her children a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To buy meat and chicken.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael D. L. C. es un hombre D. 52 años que vive en el municipio D. Soledad, a 15 minutos D. BarranquilL., con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades D. 18 a 23 años;   allí tiene un negocio llamado “Panadería y Refresquería L. 12”  ubicado en el local D. L. misma casa,   donD. habita el con su familia, allí venD. frutas, refrescos, panes y carnes frías. Este negocio  el lo en el año 2007 cuando solo producía y vendía panes, posteriormente fue agregándole una refresquería  y con ello L. venta D. frutas y carnes. Los panes y derivados D. L. harina D. trigo que fabrica, solo los venD. en su panadería, L.  que se encuentra  bien posicionada; en su negocio, además D. Rafael,  trabajan un empleado, su esposa y una hija. El negocio tiene buen movimiento D. clientes, porque además D. ubicarse en esquina, en el sector funciona un colegio D. gran tamaño   y los estudiantes compran permanentemente.  Su margen D. contribución  es del 35% y en L. actualidad  presenta una utilidad neta que le permite cubrir su cuota esperada del crédito. Los gastos familiares y operativos son similares. Sus cuentas por pagar son bajas y es poca L. venta a crédito. L. mayor parte D. los activos totales los representan sus activos fijos. Tiene un bajo endeudamiento actual y todo a corto plazo, L. razón corriente es buena porque es poco el endeudamiento. L. rotación del inventario es bastante alta porque muchos D. los productos son perecederos. L. rentabilidad en ventas es del 21 %, por el alto margen D. contribución. El negocio presenta buena rentabilidad y capacidad D. pago.
