Thanks to their marital effort and sacrifice they have built their own home. José has worked as a taxi driver for 20 years. He works 14 hours daily. He has a good friendship with his friends in the communal bank. This is his second cycle with the foundation. It was his mother who motivated him to become a member of the bank. He used the loans he has received to invest in his wife’s business. He will use the new loan from the Espoir Foundation to invest in his wife’s business of selling clothes like pants, and blouses, etc. His big dream is to have health and life to be able to continue giving his children everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, and clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita D. is from the village of Kauswagan in Dangcagan Bukidnon. Juanita is married and has one grown child. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over eight years, and she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Juanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Juanita chose to request a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Juanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne Nabwile M. lives in Bukirimo, in the Busia district. She is 30 years old, married, and a mother of five (5) children.
Anne sells fish at Miyanga market, which she ventured into in 2005 due to demand created by customers within that area. Before, she used to do subsistence farming which was not giving her any reasonable income to be able to support her family. With her fish vending business, her life and that of her entire family has been changing and it is for this reason she would like to get a loan worth KSH 25000. This will enable her to add more stock, to expand her business and to be economically stable.
Her future dream is to see all her children get a better education that will guarantee them a better future.

loans.use: increase her stock to expand her business

loans.name: Iponi

texts.en:
Iponi V. is currently in the business of selling cows and goats at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more cows to sell.  Iponi is 26 years old and is married to a husband who is a farmer. She has two children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for renting.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César es un hombre de 34 años, vive con su pareja Susana de 29 años y sus 3 menores hijos en una casa alquilada que les facilitó un familiar de ella.

César está seguro que sólo se sale adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación, y mejor aún cuando se trabaja en lo que mejor se sabe hacer. Por eso, desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposa, siembra en terrenos arrendados papa y arveja, y también crían tres asnos que le ayudan a trasladar los insumos y herramientas agrícolas hacia sus terrenos. Lo que más lo motiva es cosechar, pues le permite apreciar la calidad de producción que obtuvo. Por otro lado le disgusta tener que caminar hasta más de una hora para labrar su chacra, pero no se da por vencido porque considera que su labor le es muy rentable, ya que nunca ha perdido lo invertido sino por el contrario le alcanza para solventar la educación de sus hijos, cubrir los gastos domésticos e incluso para ahorrar. Para más adelante planea construir su casa propia y comprar más hectáreas de tierra que le den mayores ingresos para que pueda brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia.    

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, está muy gustoso de continuar laborando activamente con su grupo, el cual está integrado por personas que respetan lo establecido en su reglamento interno y son puntuales en los pagos. Con el dinero ahora solicitado tiene pensado comprar una bolsa y media de semilla de arveja, cinco sacos de fertilizantes y tres botellas de insecticidas para fumigar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
César is 34 years old. He lives with his 29-year-old wife Susana and their 3 small children in a house that they rent from a relative of hers. César is sure that he can get ahead with effort and dedication, because when he works he knows that it is what he does best. For 10 years now he and his wife have planted potatoes and peas on the fields that they rent, and have also raised three donkeys that help them to transport the supplies and agricultural tools to the fields. What motivates César the most is harvesting, since it allows him to appreciate the quality of the crop that he has obtained. On the other hand, what he doesn’t like is having to walk for mO. than an hour to work on his farm. He doesn’t give up, though, because he considers his work very worthwhile, since he has never lost what he has invested; on the contrary, he has managed to pay for his children’s education, meet his household’s expenses, and even to save some money. To get further ahead he plans to construct his own house and purchase mO. hectares of land that would give him mO. income. This would allow him to provide his family with an adequate quality of life. This is the fourth loan that César has received from Kiva partner MFP, and that is why he already knows his communal bank’s work methodology. He is very happy to continue to work actively with his group, which is made up of people who respect the group’s established rules and who are punctual in their payments. He will use the money he is now asking for to purchase one and a half bags of pea seeds, five sacks of ferilizer, and three bottles of insecticide so that he can fumigate his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom O. is 32 years old and married to Susan Atieno, who sells milk. They have three children: Stacy, who is 6 years old and in grade one of primary school; Kingsley, who is 3 years old and in baby class; and Winsley, who is 3 months old. 

He runs a shoe-selling business in Oile Market, an open-air populous market in Kisumu City. He has been in this business for the last three years. Tom gets the shoes from vendors in the capital city, Nairobi, and sells them at a profit in Kisumu. He sells shoes for both genders. 

Tom learned about KADET Ltd. from a friend who is an existing client. This is his third loan. He intends to use the loan to increase his stock of ladies shoes, since the season for school shoes is over. He will also buy sports shoes since most of his clients have been asking for them.

From the profits made, he intends to open a dairy shop for his wife. Tom, a hardworking and industrious man, has a dream of expanding his business by having a variety of shoes. He also hopes to have his children well-educated.

loans.use: To buys sports and ladies shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and hair accessories.

loans.name: Sodikhuja

texts.en:
Since he was a boy, Sodikhuja has loved animals. He has learned to raise them well so that he can market them. Sodikhuja is married and has two kids to provide for. To support his family, he has to invest in his livestock business and, consequently, he's approached IMON International to apply for a loan that will allow him to purchase young cattle and feed for them. This will, in turn, increase his income from the milk, meat, horn, etc. that cattle provide.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Frank

texts.es: El Sr. Frank vive en la localidad de El Torno en el barrio Naciones Unidas,  su esposa con la cual tienen un hijo se dedica a labores del hogar,  su actividad principal es la de moto taxista(transporte de pasajero urbano),  se encuentra en su  segundo crédito con la institución, el primero fue para comprar una línea de moto taxi(pertenecer a una asociación), ahora es para renovar su herramienta de trabajo, comprar una nueva moto,  el solo mantiene el hogar, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le brindo; su deseo es poder comprar una casa ya que donde el vive es de sus suegros.  En la foto posa acompañado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Frank lives in the Naciones Unidas district, in the town of El Torno; his wife is a housewife and they have one child. He works as a Moto taxi driver (transporte de pasajero urbano) and he is asking for his second loan with our institution. He used the first loan to buy a Moto taxi phone line (to become member of an association); he will use this new loan to renew his working tools and to buy a new motorbike. He sustains his family alone, and he is thankful to our institution for the help we are offering; he desires to buy his own house, as the one he is living in right now belongs to his in-laws. The woman with him in the picture is his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jaime Estuardo

texts.es:
Jaime Estuardo M. B. tiene 49 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y 2 hijos, Mauricio de 21 años y Andrés de 15 años en el cantón de San Miguel, en la provincia de Bolívar.
Jaime es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Jaime se dedica al negocio: compra y venta de ganado y productos agrícolas, como principal fuente de ingreso de su familia. Los que mas comercializa son ganado vacuno y el choclo. Compra sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en San Miguel y Guaranda. 
Solicita el préstamo para la agricultura y para capital de trabajo en su negocio. Piensa que el crédito le ayudará para el negocio, en las compras y ventas de productos. Su sueño seria de mejorar el modelo del carro y comprar un terreno. Enfrenta desafió de sobreproducción de productos que baja los precios y no se tiene utilizador.  
Le gusta salir de paseo con su familia, las costumbres del carnaval y fiestas de patrón San Miguel que celebra con amigos y familia.
texts.en:
Jaime Estuardo M. B. is 49 years old and lives in the canton of San Miguel in Bolivar Province. He and his wife have two children, Mauricio (age 21) and Andrés (age 15).

Jaime is a member of the Communal Bank “Lotan Bajo”, which is 30 minutes away from the town of San Miguel. The group has a total of 13 members, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Jaime is dedicated to his two businesses, buying and selling cattle and growing agricultural products. These activities are the main source of income for his family. The two products he sells the most are cattle and corn. He acquires his products in San Miguel and also sells in both San Miguel and Guaranda. Jaime is requesting a loan to use for farming and to increase the operating capital for his business. He believes the loan will help his business so that he can buy and sell products. His dreams include upgrading the model of his car and buying a plot of land. The main challenge he faces is overproduction since his products can only be sold at lower prices since there are not enough buyers.

Jaime enjoys spending time with his family. He takes time to celebrate Carnival and the San Miguel patron saint festivals with his friends and family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in farming & increase the operating capital for his business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 37 años, tiene 4 hijos, juntos viven en casa de sus familiares. Hace mas de 2 años y medio tiene un puesto de venta de gaseosas y dulces, en un pequeño espacio que arrendó en un local comercial. Desde entonces brinda este servicio todos los días en la tarde. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, atendiendo a los clientes.  Considera que este negocio le es rentable, por eso desea mejorar su servicio, abasteciéndose de variedad de golosinas y de su puesto de venta. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y espera concretar sus objetivos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de dulces, golosinas y gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Luisa is 37 years old and lives with her 4 children in her family’s home. For more than two and a half years she has rented a small stall in a local shopping center where she sells soft drinks and candy. Her shop is open every afternoon and some days her children help her attend to customers. Her business is profitable and so she would like to improve the service she offers by expanding her inventory to include a variety of sweets. This is Luisa’s second loan from MFP. She has been very responsible about repayment and she hopes to continue to meet her goals. She will use this loan to buy wholesale candy, sweets, and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy, soft drinks, and sweets

loans.name: Mr. Moeun Chin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Moeun C., age 41, is the village bank president, having been selected by its 17 members. They live in Srah Trakuon village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion to support different business purposes. 

Mr. Moeun C. and his wife, Mrs. Yeang M., are farmers who own a hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. To improve the farm, Mr. Moeun C. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy fertilizer. The rest of the loan will be saved in order to buy a cow for breeding. 

Aside from farming, Mr. Moeun C. is also a laborer, which allows him to receive a small salary to support his family living. 

This couple has three children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to save for the purchase of a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen S., 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a teacher at a public primary school and earns an income of USD 2.5 per day. She is also a silk weaver when she is available from her school. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice, earning an income of USD 1 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more raw silk to produce more silk products for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cement and Stones

loans.name: Tsedendamba

texts.en:
Tsedendamba C. is 63 years old and lives with his wife in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. He and his wife are retired, however, they are still capable of managing their own small business.

In 1995, the couple began their business with a slight amount of working capital, and since then the two have made a lot of progress in the business. Now they sell the products at their own store.

All of his four children live separately. Tsedendamba is a very hardworking entrepreneur and has very good character. He is focused on operating his business sustainably. Tsedendamba is proud that all his children have already established businesses of their own, so Tsedendamba and his wife can operate their food retail business for themselves only. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital for his current business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 54 años D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel, es casada vive e con el esposo y dos hijos D. las edades D. 16 y 15 años, el esposo trabajo como despachador D. línea D. transporte, ella posee una tienda D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad.
Hace nueve años tiene D. iniciado el negocio D. la tienda el cual está ubicado en la casa D. habitación, ella también hace tortillas D. maíz para generar ingresos, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo par la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad como son aceite, azúcar, arroz, maíz, entre otros, lo cual le ayudara a incrementar los ingresos, solventar las necesidades básicas D. la familia.
Las aspiraciones son generar ingresos, solventar los compromisos financieros, apoyar a la familia con los gastos del hogar, mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
Graciela is 54 years old and she lives in San Miguel. She is married and she lives with her husband and their two children, aged 16 and 15 years old. Her husband works in the dispatch center of a public transport company. She has a grocery store. Nine years ago she started her business, located in a section of her house. She makes also makes tortillas as a second source of income. She requests a loan to purchase general grocery store products such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, corn etc. This will help her increase her earnings, to be able to proviD. for her family's basic needs. Her aspirations are to generate an income and fill their financial needs. She wishes to support the family and proviD. for the household expenses, and improve the family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar, rice, corn etc.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia A. is a widow who has two children who are 29 and 31 years old. She lives in Portland within the barangay of Cahumayan, a part of Danao City in Cebu province on the Visayas islands. She runs two businesses: pig fattening and a carinderia eatery where meat is served. 
>p>
Emilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, thus lifting the family's standard of living. 
>p>
This time Emilia is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase feed and other materials for her businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future and to improve her family’s living conditions. Emilia A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 
>p>
About NWTF: 
>p>
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other materials

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso G. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. He is 46 years old. Celso is single. To make a living, Celso owns and operates a beauty salon. Celso has been engaged in his business for more than 26 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Celso joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Celso is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase supplies for his beauty salon. This will be the first loan taken by Celso from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby V. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Ruby is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ruby owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She is also into making and selling foods for viands (fancy dishes) for different meals like sotanghon and pancit guisado. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ruby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruby from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Asdrúbal Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Asdrúbal Francisco C. C. es trabajador Activo de la Empresa “Emprosa” desempeñándose como operador de vigilante tiene un  año de trabajar para esta Empresa, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Asdrúbal Francisco C. C. has worked at Emprosa as a security officer for a year.  He is married.

He has had two loans from CEPRODEL, which he has used to purchase construction materials to expand and improve his home.  His loans have benefited him very much because he has been able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, stones, stone blocks, flooring, and doors

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes; tiene 38 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chompas y también se dedica se dedica a la crianza de pollos, la socia se dedica a realizar los acabados de las chompas y luego los vende a una empresa, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de crianza de pollos. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construccion para construir su casa.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lourdes belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Lourdes is 38 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling sweaters and also her business raising chickens.  She finishes the sweaters off and then sells them to a company.  She would like to improve her chicken-raising business.  She is requesting this loan to buy building materials to build her house.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build her house

loans.name: Azianfo

texts.fr: Azianfo  a  49 ans  et est marié. Il a en sa charge 7 enfants.  Pour s’occuper de ses enfants, il fait la vente de meuble  et compte dans cette activité 11 ans déjà. IL achète au grand marché de Lomé et revend à Akodessewa.  IL demande ce prêt pour acheter 10 armoires, et 25 portes pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en:
Azianfo is 49 years old. He is financially responsible for 7 children. To provide for his children he sells furniture and has already been practicing this activity for 11 years. He buys at the large Lomé market and resells at Akodessewa.

He is requesting this loan to buy 10 armoires and 25 doors in order to meet the demand of an increasing number of customers.

loans.use: Furniture purchase

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes; ella tiene 34 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, golosinas entre otros, a la vez la se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y al cultivo de verduras, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio y para la compra de algunas semillas y comida para sus animales (chanchos). 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Lourdes is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; the bank is located in the district of Urubamba which is part of the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. Lourdes is 34 years old; she lives with her partner and has two children. Lourdes divides her time between her daily household activities with her grocery store business where she sells the common staples such as rice, sugar, mixed vegetables, milk, snacks and others. Together with her husband, she also grows pigs and cultivates vegetables. Lourdes is asking for a loan in order to supply her business as well as to purchase seeds and animal feed. She is happy about the loan and is committed to timely repayment.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and animal feed; to purchase supplies for the grocery store business

loans.name: Eliana Yaneth

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIA: Eliana Yaneth Q. Sánchez

En un reducido espacio de tan solo 2 habitaciones, una pequeña cocina y un baño, habita Eliana Yaneth Q. Sánchez con sus padres, su esposo y sus dos hijos.  

En este lugar también está ubicado el taller de confección que desde hace 7 años se ha convertido en la fuente del sustento familiar y en el que trabaja de la mano de su padre que es discapacitado y una hermana. Su jornada de trabajo inicia a las 6:00 a.m. y se extiende hasta altas horas de la noche puesto que en la medida en que más trabajen, mejor será su calidad de vida.

Su mayor dificultad ha sido lo reducido del espacio en el que viven y trabajan, por esto requiere un crédito que le permita comprar más insumos para laborar y de esta manera tener más capacidad de producción que le permita generar mayores ingresos, con los cuales podrá mejor las condiciones en que habitan puesto que su más preciado sueño es poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y que su microempresa pueda estar en un lugar diferente al de su hogar.
texts.en:
Small businesswoman:  Eliana Yaneth Q. Sánchez

Eliana Yaneth Q. Sánchez lives with her parents, her husband, and their two children in a small space.  It only has two bedrooms, a small kitchen, and a bathroom.  

Her seamstress shop is also at this location. Her shop became the source of family support seven years ago.  She works with her father, who is disabled, and a sister.  Her work day starts at 6:00 a.m. and goes into the late hours of the night.  However, the more she works the better her quality of life will be.

Her biggest difficulty is the small space where they live and work.  That is why she needs a loan that will allow her to buy more supplies for work.  This way she will have a greater production capacity, which will allow her to generate greater income.  With this income she will be able to improve their living conditions.

Her most valued dream is to be able to give her family a better quality of live and that her small business is able to be in a location other than her home.

loans.use: Buy supplies and catalogues

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old, married and has four children between 1 and 14 years old. Currently two of his children attend school. 

Samuel sells boutique items including mandazi (a pastry), clothes for ladies, biscuits, etc. He has done this for four years. His wife helps him in the business. 

Samuel will use the loan to purchase more cooking oil, soaps, salt, rice, hand bags, paper bags, lotions and other items. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo, de 64 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Nilda de52 años y de sus dos jóvenes hijos que ya trabajan independientes; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 6 años este emprendedor hombre se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en un motocarro. Se siente muy satisfecho pues la labor que desempeña durante todo el día, de lunes a viernes, le genera regulares ganancias, que le han permitido sacar adelante a su familia; además con el tiempo ha logrado comprarse un motocarro más que brinda en alquiler y así obtiene mejores rentas. Manifiesta que le agrada mucho trabajar prestando servicio de movilidad pues se entretiene bastante con los paisajes de la zona; además es un trabajo tranquilo pues no tiene mucha presión. Como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una flota de motocarros  para administrarla, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá salir adelante. Bernardo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en mandar a refaccionar su herramienta de trabajo, pues ha presentado algunas imperfecciones y quiere brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Bernardo, 64, lives in his own house alongside his wife, Nilda, 52, and their two young children who already work independently.  Together they strive daily to get ahead.

For the last six years this enterprising man has been providing public transportation services in his vehicle.  He feels very satisfied because the work he does all day, from Monday through Friday, generates regular income which has made it possible for him to support his family.  Besides, in time he has managed to buy an additional vehicle that he leases out thus earning better profits.

He states that he enjoys providing transportation services because he enjoys the scenery in the area quite a bit; besides, it’s a tranquil job with little stress.  Because he’s an enterprising man he plans in the future to set up a fleet of vehicles to run thus attaining progress.

This is his 4th loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual with his payments because he does not want to disappoint the people who make the loan possible which will allow him to get ahead.

Bernardo plans to use the requested loan to service his vehicle because it has started to manifest a few problems and he wants to provide better service.

loans.use: For vehicle technical maintenance.

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilaria Ursula; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía y también se dedica al tejido y a la venta de chompas, ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando la artesanía y chompas a las diferentes tiendas que le hacen pedido, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de artesanía y lanas para hacer las chompas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilaria Úrsula, 51, is a member of the “HATAN RUMIYOC” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is a widow and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a crafts business; she also knits sweaters to sell.  She works independently taking the crafts and sweaters to various stores that place orders with her.  Through this business she raises her children.  She wants to expand the crafts business and is asking for a loan to buy crafts and wool to make the sweaters.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: To buy crafts and wool to make sweaters.

loans.name: 'god Is With Us' Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel Merchant, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers, called "God Is With Us".  He is 42 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 16 and 8 years. He is a high school graduate. 

For 18 years, he has been operating a garage and selling spare parts in “River View” Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 30,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 110,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more spare parts.
He describes himself as a kind man whose goals are to grow his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus  dos  2 hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, este distrito es catalogado como uno de los más pobres de la Provincia de Chiclayo, sin embargo podemos encontrar mucha gente trabajadora y empeñosa, que trabaja de sol a sol para salir adelante.

Luis se dedica a brindar el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de motos y mototaxis (unidades móviles que consta de una moto y una cabina que permite el transporte de personas), asimismo se dedica a la venta de lubricantes para este tipo de vehículos. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, y los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Luis desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería para vender a sus clientes, es por ello que ha creído conveniente adquirir un préstamo de 1000 soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Luis is 45 years old and he lives with his common-law wife and their 2 children in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz. This district is known as one of the poorest in the province of Chiclayo, although here he can find many people who are hard working and earnest, working from sun up to sun down in order to make a living. 

Luis provides maintenance and repair services to motorcycles and rickshaws (motorized vehicles consisting of a motorcycle and an attached cabin to transport clients), and he also sells lubricants for these vehicles. He has had this business for 10 years and the income that he earns is used to cover his personal expenses and those of his family. 

Luis wishes to expand his business with the acquisition of more merchandise to sell to his clients. For this reason he has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase engine lubricants for resale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Aisha has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for one year. She also has a second business selling tap water.

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, Aisha hopes to become a doctor.  

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to make money from her business to pay for her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.es: El señor Ponciano trabaja como joyero y también tiene una pensión donde vende almuerzos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mesas y sillas para dar comodidad a sus clientes y ayudará al crecimiento de su negocio. Vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez  que el cliente está solicitando un crédito de Impro y de Kiva.
texts.en: Sr. Ponciano works as a jeweler and also has an eatery where he sells lunches. He needs the loan in order to buy tables and chairs to make his customers more comfortable and help his business grow. He lives in his own house in the Villa Copacabana part of La Paz. He is divorced and has two children. This is the first time he has requested a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for his eatery where he serves his customers lunch

loans.name: Sgoun

texts.en:
Sgoun M., 56, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. 

M. grows vegetables to sell, earning an income of US $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $25 on food and US $90 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a water pump to water her vegetables. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to water the vegetables.

loans.name: Vicenta Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vicenta, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y el menor de 17 que es el  que  aun vive con ella y estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es un ama de casa que realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo, el cual se dedica a la venta de toldos, toallas y embases plásticos, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es ambulante, él se desplaza hasta otras ciudades o por el centro de la ciudad para  ofrecer sus productos, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, sus productos los compra en Picoaza en un lugar que le dan a buen precio al por mayor. Nos cuenta que él lleva realizando esta actividad por casi 30  años y que gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar toldos, toallas  y productos plásticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos de alguna forma ella le colabora a su esposo.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The El Pedregal communal bank meets every 15 days in El Pedregal, which is in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. It is a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the joy of its people.

This is where Fundación ESPOIR met Ms. Vicenta. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children with her husband. Three of her children are grown and the youngest is 17 years old, still lives with her, and attends high school. Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife who takes out loans for her husband's business. He sells awnings, towels, and plastic containers, among other things. He is an ambulant salesman, who goes out to other cities or around the center of their city to offer his products. He works every day from 8:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. He buys his products in Picoaza, where there is a place that gives him a good wholesale price. Vicenta tells Fundación ESPOIR that he has been doing this for almost 30 years and that thanks to God, he has always done well.

This loan is to buy awnings, towels, and plastic products. Vicenta has been a member of her communal bank since its inception and she enjoys it because these loans are a way to collaborate with her husband.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy awnings, towels, and plastic products

loans.name: Yanaturo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Yanaturo está formado por 11 mujeres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les ha permitido aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias. Nuestras socias son personas muy amables y cordiales. 
Viven por el sector de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, esta ciudad se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía y su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Rosa vive por la comunidad de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 9, 8, 7 y 4 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo trabaja en la área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Rosa trabaja realizando la limpieza de varias casas hace 6 meses, labora de lunes a viernes solo medio día ya que el resto de su tiempo lo dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar.
 
El dinero de su préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar algunos acabados a su casa. En el banco comunal se encuentra en su sexto crédito y es una socia fundadora del banquito.

Su meta es terminar su casa y  colocar un negocio en la misma.

Las fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de dos socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo. Son las fotos de María josé y María Aquilina.

Los tres niños de la foto son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
The Yanaturo community bank is made up of 11 women who work in different business activities which have enabled them to contribute to their household finances and get their families ahead in life.  The ladies are very kind and friendly people who live in Yanaturo district, in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is the third most important city in the country and is a mixture of colonial and modern.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Rosa lives in Yanaturo community, in the city of Cuenca.  She is 32 years old, married, and has four children aged 9, 8, 7 and 4.  Her eldest three children attend a local elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Rosa works as a cleaner, cleaning other people's homes.  She has been in this business for six months and works from Monday to Friday.  She only works half days as she spends the rest of her time looking after her children and her house.

Rosa will invest her loan money in buying construction supplies so that she can do some work on her house.  She is applying for her sixth loan through her community bank and she is one of the bank's founding members.

Rosa's goal is to finish off her house and set up a business there.

The small photos attached to the main group photo are those of two members who, for work reasons, couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.  They are photos of María José and María Aquilina.  The three children in the photo belong to the members.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Ainakan's Group

texts.en:
Ainakan is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a coordinating manager. Together with her husband she has raised a daughter and a son, and both children are employed. Ten years ago with the initial investment of 35000 soms Ainakan purchased a pavilion and began to provide hairdressing services. At the moment her monthly profit is 7400 soms. Ainakan applied for the loan because she needs some additional funds to purchase foodstuffs, beverages, meat and other items for celebrating her grandchild’s birth. In the future she wants to save money for purchasing a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to assist with building their businesses; also, to purchase foodstuffs, beverages, meat and other items for a celebration.

loans.name: Abatiganda No 6 Group

texts.fr: Emmanuel est  agri-éleveur né au Rwanda. Il est membre du groupe Abatiganda no 6. Il est marié, il  a 38 ans, il a 6 enfants entre 1 an et 10 ans et trois enfants vont à l’école,  il n’a aucunes personnes en charge. Il  a cinq  ans des études primaires. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter les champs en vue d’accroitre la production. Sa vision il voudrait devenir le grand producteur du riz. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le frais du minerval pour ses enfants et les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en: Emmanuel is an agricultural producer born in Rwanda. He is a member of the Abatiganda No 6 group. He is 38 years old and married. He has 6 children between the ages of 1 and 10 of whom three attend school. He has no employees. He has completed five years of primary education. This is his second loan with ACB.He will use his credit to purchase chemical fertilizer and pay for labor. He does not expect any difficulties with the repayment of his loan. His strategy for the growth of his business is to increase the number of fields in order to increase his production. His ambition is to become a big rice producer. For his family he would like to pay the school fees for his children and medical expenses for his family.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser and pay for labor

loans.name: Kanyshai's Group

texts.en:
Kanyshai, 49, is the treasurer of this group. Due to a terrible accident that happened to her husband, who later became disabled, Kanyshai became the main breadwinner of the family. She has been sewing national clothing and selling traditional home appliances for 15 years. With the help of her 17-year-old daughter she manages to attract additional income to the family budget by cattle breeding and reselling. At the moment, her monthly income is 3,000 soms, which helps towards the construction of her house. Her initial investment in the business was 10,000 soms. Her requested loan will be invested in the business by purchasing raw materials for sewing.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hard-working 31-year-old man. He and his wife have a five-year-old child who is enrolled in school. For the past year and a half, he has been providing tailoring services to make ends meet. His alternative source of income comes from working as a matatu driver. Previously, he used to operate a cafeteria. 

Over the next five years, he hopes to own more than one tailoring shop. This goal is in line with his dream to become a major distributor of clothing materials.

He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy materials for tailoring. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances well.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring

loans.name: Winlight

texts.en:
Winlight is 23 years old and supports his mother. He buys and sells second-hand clothing. He has been in the business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 6000.

Winlight has borrowed a loan of KES10,000 from KADET. This being his first loan, he hopes to use the loan to purchase a bale of t-shirts for resale. 

The profits will be used to purchase more clothing for the business. He hopes to live a happy life and to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of secondhand t-shirts.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria forma parte del Banco comunal “Antu Domo” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas por catalogo, desde hace 10 años, comenzó vendiendo en una empresa que tenía una sucursal en la ciudad de Temuco, actualmente trabaja directamente con una empresa de joyas de la ciudad de Santiago, por lo que en ésta compra su mercadería, que además exhibe sus joyas en la ciudad de Temuco una vez al mes. En estos catálogos ofrece diferentes productos. Paralelamente también cuenta con otro negocio que es la venta de productos de mar preparados, listos para servir, estos productos los compra en la ciudad de Puerto Montt, posteriormente los envasa, etiqueta y entrega en locales, eventos y restaurantes. Estos productos son exclusivos. Su horario en ambos negocios es flexible.
Con el crédito comprará específicamente cadenas, pendientes, pulseras, colgantes y anillos, joyas de la temporada primavera verano.
Sus metas para su negocio son cursar un curso de orfebrería para realizar sus propios e innovadores diseños y espera también abrir un taller que ofrezca sus joyas. 
Gloria vive junto a su hijo menor, el trabaja de manera independiente. Sus sueños son poder independizarse económicamente y que pueda solventar sus gastos solo con el negocio de la joyería. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con los créditos y servicios entregados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha brindado la oportunidad y confianza. Las capacitaciones y reuniones le han permitido conocer experiencias de sus compañeras del grupo del Banco comunal. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the "Antu Domo" community bank which is located in the city of Temuco.  She has been selling jewelry through catalogs for 10 years.

Gloria started out selling jewelry in a company that had a branch in the city of Temuco.  She currently works directly with a jewelry company in the city of Santiago.  She buys her merchandise from them and displays her jewelry in the city of Temuco once a month.  She sells different products from the catalogs.  In parallel with this, Gloria also has another business selling seafood which is prepared and ready to serve.  She buys these products in the town of Puerto Montt and then packages them, puts labels on them and delivers them to stores, events and restaurants.  These products are exclusive.  Her working hours for both businesses are flexible.

Gloria will use her loan to buy chains, earrings, bracelets, pendants and rings: Spring and Summer season jewelry.

Gloria's goal for her business is to attend a course to learn how to work precious metals so that she can make her own, innovative designs.  She also hopes to open a store where she can sell her jewelry.

Gloria lives together with her youngest son who works independently.  Her dreams is to be able to become financially independent so that she can cover her expenses herself through her jewelry business.  The training sessions and meetings have allowed her to learn from the experiences of her fellow community bank members.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the area there are a number of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very colorful native flora and fauna which can be found in nearby nature reserves.  We should point out that 50% of the Mapuche (the native people of our country) live in this region.

loans.use: to buy chains, earrings, bracelets, pendants and rings - Spring and Summer season jewelry

loans.name: Katcha's Group

texts.en: Katcha is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised two daughters and five sons. The youngest son is at school, two sons went to work in Russia and the other children are married and live separately with their families. The family is engaged in cattle breeding. In order to earn additional money for their livelihood, Katcha sells dairy products. Her husband breeds cattle and then resells them at a higher price after being fattened. With money received from the loan, Katcha wants to purchase more farm animals in order to expand their family business. In the future, with the profits gained from this activity, she wants to purchase construction materials for building a house for their son. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gulzodahon's Group

texts.en:
Gulzodahon is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married to a builder. Her husband works in Russia and each month he transfers to Gulzodahon about 15,000 soms. She takes care of a daughter and a son; both children are preschool age (under seven). Gulzodahon works as a teacher at school. Her monthly salary is 9,000 soms. In order to earn additional money for the family budget, the family cultivates agricultural products. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase onion seeds and mineral fertilizers. In the future, Gulzodahon plans to rent a piece of land for farming and purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nouen

texts.en:
Nouen (pictured here in the pink shirt) is 30 years old. She makes and sells baskets to earn a living. Her income is $4 per day. Her husband is a farmer and earns an income of $2.50 per day. They have two children, both of whom are studying and working. Every month, Noren spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $400 to buy a motorcycle in order to transport her baskets to offer them for sale. This loan will help her to be able to bring her baskets to other provinces where she can get higher prices than when she is limited to selling them in her own village. 

Her goal is to enable both her children to continue their education through university level.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to transport her baskets to offer them for sale in other provinces

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy peak powdered milk (one carton @ Le420,000), soft drinks (five crates @ Le30,000), stout drink (10 crates @ Le88,000), beer (five crates @ Le 49,000), pure drinking water (100 bundles @ Le3,000), and amoxicillin syrup (two cartons @ Le500,000).

loans.name: Nagdali

texts.en: Nagdali is a very hardworking man who has for the last 15 years earned a living by raising cattle and selling milk to local dairy wholesalers. He is married and has three children, two daughters and one son. He is seeking a loan of 1,200 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to buy more animals to raise and feed for them to eat. He believes that this will allow him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. This will be his fifth loan from our organization.

loans.use: to enlarge his herd and buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Angela es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la producción y comercialización de alimentos como: comida rápida, fritos y comida típica de la región. Desde hace unos meses su negocio ha progresado, pues las ventas han aumentado y proporcionalmente sus ingresos, sin embargo actualmente solicita un prestamos con el cual comprar insumos para la preparación de alimentos y hacer algunas adecuaciones locativas en la cocina, pues en época de fin de año las ventas y los clientes se incrementan y Angela no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir al por mayor y adecuar la cocina, es conciente que así su calidad de vida mejorará pues prestará un mejor servicio, la capacidad de producción será mayor y tendrá mas clientes satisfechos con la comida que Angela les ofrece.
texts.en: Ángela is an enterprising woman who prepares meals to sell.  She prepares fast food, fried snacks and traditional regional dishes.  Her business has been making progress the last few months because sales have increased and her income has done so proportionately too.  However, she is asking for loans at present to buy ingredients to prepare her meals and to do some improvements in her kitchen because at the end of the year the number of customers grows and sales increase and Ángela does not have the necessary capital to stock up at wholesale and to equip her kitchen.  She is conscious that her quality of life will improve because she’ll provide better service; production capacity will also be greater and she’ll have more customers satisfied with the food she offers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her meals and to do some kitchen improvements.

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур более 10 лет. Он выращивает пшеницы, а потом продает за выгодную цену. Также он занимается скотоводством. Кроме этого он имеет дополнительный доход, который предоставляет услуги стройки домов. Дилмурод хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. С прибылью он хочет ремонтировать свой дом. Дилмурод запрашивает займ для покупки семена и скота.
texts.en: Dilmurod is married and is a loving father of one child.  Dilmurod has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over ten years.  He grows wheat and then sells it at a more profitable price.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.  Besides, he has an additional income from providing housing construction services.  Dilmurod wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  He then wants to use this profit to make repairs to his house.  Dilmurod is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old, and married with one child. 

Madelyn owns and operates a business providing trysikad (pedicab) services in the local community. She has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Madelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Madelyn is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 61 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four children. Perla has a buy and sell business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month from this business. Perla has requested a loan to buy used clothes to sell.

She has been a member of PMPC for four years, since October 2007. In the future Perla hopes to have her own space in the market for her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Awak

texts.en:
Awak is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. All of them are in school. For five years, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan.

Awak requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda and sugar. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase soda and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice, aged 36, is married to Monica. They are blessed with four children aged between six and fifteen years. Maurice runs a hotel and a retail shop that have been in operation for seven years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is his first loan with KADET. He will use the funds to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other supplies for the shop. Maurice hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for work and complete one of the orders

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen is 50 years old and married to Johnson. They have four children living in a rural area – Rukungiri District. She is applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 with the purpose of improving her banana plantation through mulching to generate more yield. Her agricultural business has helped her to pay tuition for her children of whom two are at the university. Her dream has been to increase her banana production, now standing at 200 bunches per month, to 500 with the help of a financial boost from Kiva lenders through UGAFODE. In the photograph are Kellen, her husband and the Ugafode credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Josiane's Group

texts.fr: WANGNINA est un groupement composé de vingt personnes qui vivent dans le même village. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Josiane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Josiane est âgée de 30 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. Josiane est mariée à un certain Alphonse. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Josiane et son mari. Pour cette raison, Josiane vend du riz et de l’huile végétale à son domicile depuis huit ans. Josiane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Josiane sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupement WANGNINA, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Novisssi

texts.en:
N. from Ahonkpè is a solidarity fellowship comprising twelve (12) women and created four (04) years ago. Its target is improving the living conditions of its members through economic activities, education, cultural and social activities, the creation of solidarity within the fellowship and mutual assistance to members. The members are in the 26-52 age group. All members are illiterate except the secretary that manages administrative and bookkeeping documents. The fellowship already received three credits of $400;$1000, and $1500 that were all reimbursed smoothly. Just like the entire Ahonkpè village, this group of women is confronted with a serious problem of potable water. The consequences are very dramatic in a village where child mortality rate is very high. The main drinking water source is a stagnant water pool exposed to all sort of water born diseases. So they had the interesting humanitarian idea of realising a drilling with views to providing the village with potable water to guarantee the health of the population chiefly the children. On that purpose, the female fellowship “NOVISSI of Ahonkpè” applied for a credit of $ 2000 to achieve its project of water drilling in order to sell water to the entire population of the village. Financing this project is not only an economic action but also a humanitarian one: it will help contribute to the reduction of the child mortality rate in the village of Ahonkpè, in the suburban area of Lomé.

NOVISSI de Ahonkpè est un groupe de solidarité constitué de douze (12) femmes créé il y a quatre (04) ans. Il a pour objectif, améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres par l’exercice des activités économiques, éducatrices, culturelles et sociales, créer une solidarité en son sein et faire des entraides mutuelles entre les membres. L’âge des membres varie entre 26 ans et 52 ans. Tous les membres sont analphabètes à l’exception de la secrétaire qui tient les documents administratifs et comptables. Le groupement a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits respectivement de $400, $1000 et $1500 qui sont tous bien remboursés sans incident. Ce groupe de femme tout comme le village de Ahonkpè est confronté au problème sérieux d’eau potable. Les conséquences sont très dramatiques dans ce village où le mortalité enfantine est très élevé. La principale eau de consommation est un point d’eau stagnante exposé à toute sorte de maladie hydrique. Alors, elles ont eu cette idée géniale et humanitaire de faire un forage afin de doter le village d’eau potable pour garantir la bonne santé de la population surtout celle des enfants. A cet effet, le groupement féminin « NOVISSI de Ahonkpè » sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour réaliser son projet de forage dont l’eau sera vendue à la population. Financer ce projet, est un acte non seulement économique mais plutôt humanitaire : contribuer à la réduction du taux de mortalité enfantine dans le village de Ahonkpè, banlieue de Lomé.

loans.use: to realise the drilling

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando A., 32 years of age and a native of Nampula, did not attend school beyond the 5th grade because of the war. He arrived in the province of Maputo in the company of his oldest sibling in 1995 and encountered the necessity of starting a small business in an ambulatory regime. Later, he acknowledged this endeavor as a good idea now that the conditions of starting a business had already materialized in a fixed location, also because he had married and needed to better organize his life. Today he is a father of 2 children. Through his neighbors he obtained information about the services provided by Hluvuku-Adsema (Field Partner), who he approached and solicited an initial low-cost loan. He was able to open a bank account and start a small savings in case of an emergency. Right now, he employs 4 people and supports the basic familial expenses. With this loan he intends to expand his business by diversifying the products he sells. His business’ impact on the community is a positive one: he provides employment for himself, his wife and his sister-in-law; he places the product as close as possible to the consumers of his village. His future plans include expanding the business and offering employment to more people in the community.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Armando A. de 32 anos de idade, natural de Nampula por causa de guerra não conseguiu estudar para alem da 5 classe. Chegou na província de Maputo na companhia do seu irmão mais velho em 1995 e viu a necessidade de iniciar um pequeno negócio em regime ambulatório mais tarde achou por bem e já criada as condições de fazer o negócio no local fixo também porque já tinha se casado e precisava organizar-se melhor. Hoje é pai de 2 filhos e conta que através dos vizinhos obteve a informação sobre os serviços que a HLUVUKU ADSEMA presta à população de Boane, tendo aproximado e solicitado o primeiro empréstimo num valor bastante reduzido tendo em conta as capacidades de financiamento da instituição. Conseguiu abrir uma conta bancária e começou a fazer pequenas poupanças para os momentos de crise. Actualmente emprega quatro pessoas, suporta as despesas básicas da sua família. Com o este valor pretende ampliar o negócio diversificar os produtos de venda. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na sua comunidade, providencia emprego para ele próprio, esposa e cunhada. Coloca o produto, mais próximo do consumidor do seu bairro. Tem como planos de fazer crescer o negócio e dar emprego mais pessoas da comunidade.

loans.use: To increase the stock of clothes in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase the resources needed to start his flower farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his Jaggery (brown sugar) stocks

loans.name: Rodiyah

texts.id:
From her hobby cooking, finally Rodiyah was able to work independently and open a food stall in her home, with a capital of only Rp 300,000 (about US $33.00)/day, Rodiyah was able to collect a profit of about Rp 75,000 (about $8.00)/day from her sales of: rice, various kinds of small dishes, vegetables, drinks, and other various small selection of other light meals. The business that she worked since 10 years was barely enough to pay for her daily household expenses, and pay for schooling of her three children. Rodiyah opens her foodstall from daily form 09:00 to 23:00, serving mostly student renters who live in the same location as Rodiyah. The funds she will receive from DINARI will be used by Rodiyah to buy  a small push cart to sell meat-balls that her husband would use to sell those meatballs around the neighborhood, and therefore increase the household income for daily expenses and pay for the children schooling.

__________________

Dari hobinya memasak akhirnya Rodiyah mempunyai usaha sendiri yaitu membuka warung makan ditempat tinggalnya, dengan modal 300.000 rupiah/hari Rodiyah mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 75.000 rupiah/hari dari hasil jualannya berupa; nasi, berbagai macam lauk-pauk, sayur-sayuran, minuman dan makanan kecil lainnya. Usaha yang ditekuninya Sejak 10 tahun yang lalu ini mampu mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, bahkan menyekolahkan ketiga anaknya. Rodiyah membuka warungnya dari pukul 09.00 sampai pukul 23.00, para pembelinya adalah anak-anak kost yang tinggal selokasi dengan Rodiyah. Dana yang diterima dari DINARI dipakai oleh Rodiyah untuk membeli rombong bakso (gerobak bakso) yang nantinya akan dipakai suaminya untuk berjualan bakso keliling sehingga dapat mendongkrak pendapatan rumah tangga mereka untuk kebutuhan setiap hari dan membiayai anak-anak sekolah.

loans.use:
To buy Food ingredients and a small push cart to sell meat-balls
___________
Untuk membeli bahan-bahan makanan serta membeli Rombong Bakso.

loans.name: Lucrecia Yrayra

texts.es:
Lucrecia is hard working and optimistic, and her charisma and responsibility have made her an excellent seamstress and her work of high-quality. She began her business seven years ago, motivated by one of her aunts who inspired her to study cutting and sewing and gave her confidence that she would be good at it. Lucrecia is a native of Arequipa who moved to Sicaya when she got married, and now lives in her husband’s parents’ house. She is very satisfied with her work because it allows her to care for her little daughter. Through recommendations, she has been able to earn contracts with educational institutes for sporting uniforms, and this allows her to pay for her daily home expenses. Lucrecia performs her work in a small sewing shop in her home; among her many dreams is one of opening a small shop downtown with a line of sports clothing. To keep on with her work, she is asking for a loan that she will invest in her shop and in the purchase of fabric for sportswear. Help this young mother continue on her path to success with your important contribution, and she will be able to increase her happiness and her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Lucrecia es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, su gran carisma y responsabilidad en sus trabajos han permitido que ella se desempeñe como una excelente costurera, gracias a esto realiza trabajos de excelente calidad; hace siete años empezó a desempeñarse en esta actividad motivada por una de sus tías que la animó a estudiar corte y confección dándole mucha seguridad de que ella podía ser muy buena en esta actividad.Lucrecia es natural de Arequipa y viene a radicar a Sicaya cuando contrae matrimonio y decide radicar en casa de los padres de su esposo.
