El Sr. Faustino  tiene 38 años y vive con su hermana.
El desde muy joven empezó a trabajar  como limpiador de paradas de taxi y luego como chofer, gracias a su esfuerzo logró comprar un vehículo y trabajar en él.
Él necesita de este crédito para la compra de cubiertas y también para realizar algunos arreglos que le faltan al vehículo  para que de esta manera pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Faustino anhela comprar otro vehículo y así obtener mejor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Faustino is 38 years old and lives with his sister. At a very young age, he began working as a taxi cleaner and later as a driver. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to purchase a vehicle to use for his work.

He needs this loan to buy hubcaps and also pay for repairs since his vehicle is experiencing a few malfunctions. By correcting these problems, he hopes to provide better service to his customers. Faustino plans to buy another vehicle so that he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: Purchase new hubcaps & pay for vehicle repairs

loans.name: God First Group

texts.en:
Hannah B., shown holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God First. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children aged 10 and 3 years. She is currently attending adult literacy school; she received no previous education due to lack of financial support.

For 10 years, Hannah has been selling charcoal in Jallah’s Town Monrovia, Liberia, and plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Hannah describes herself as a friendly woman whose dreams are to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Luis Ricardo

texts.es: Luis tiene 32 años de edad y vive en el distrito de Chochope con su esposa y dos hijos de 1 y 2 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años, gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte público en su mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de nuevas llantas y otros accesorios faltantes. También desea realizar algunos arreglos en su moto que se ha deteriorado debido al uso. Con las reparaciones, Luis puede mantener en mejor estado su mototaxi lo que lo permitirá ofrecer una mejor calidad de servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Luis es muy trabajador y su negocio se ha visto incrementado ya que ha ahorrado su dinero. Su mayor anhelo es seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y tener ingresos para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis, 32, lives in Chochope District with his wife and two children who are 1 and 2 years of age.  For the last three years he has been earning his livelihood providing public transportation services in his own mototaxi, a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to transport passengers in its interior. 

He wants to use his loan to buy new tires and other needed accessories.  He also wants to repair his motorcycle which is showing some wear and tear due to use.  With these repairs Luis will be able to keep his motorcycle in better condition which will allow him to provide better customer service thus increasing his income to meet family expenses.

He has, therefore, deemed it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  Luis is very hard working and his business has grown and he’s been able to save some money.  His greatest wish is to continue improving his quality of life and to have income for his children’s future.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi and buy new tires.

loans.name: La Verite Group

texts.fr: Nyirarudodo  A.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « La Vérité », âgée de 52 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants, tous ont leurs propres foyers.  Son conjoint est chômeur, sans emploi. La  cliente  Nyirarudodo  A. est vendeuse de fruits Mangues, oranges, avocats, etc. Elle vit de cette activité de fortune. Il fait longtemps  qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser  4 cycles en  bénéficiant des crédits de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produis fruitiers (mangues, avocats, oranges, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise, améliorer sa maison d’habitation et vivre paisiblement en paix avec ses enfants et ses  petits fils. La cliente Nyirarudodo  A.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe « La Vérité » est constitué de 35 membres.
texts.en: Nyirarudodo  A. is an entrepreneur and leader of the group La Vérité (Truth).  She is 52 years old and has three children who all live on their own.  Her husband is unemployed. Nyirarudodo  A. sells fruits such as mangoes, avocados and oranges. She makes a living from this business. She has been in this business for a long time. She has just completed four rounds of loans with the micro-finance institution (MFI) Hekima which increased her capital. She will purchase an inventory of new fruits such as mangoes, avocados and oranges with the new loan.  Moreover, she hopes to make her business stable in the long term, make some home improvements and live peacefully with her children and grandchildren. Nyirarudodo  A. thanks the MFI Hekima for their committed work with poor women excluded from the traditional banking sector. The group La Vérité has 35 members.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, avocados, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata  es socia del Banco Comunal Socos, tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos.
Honorata se dedica la preparación y venta D. comida, se inició hace 7 años, para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos D. la casa y le va bien. Honorata vive en el distrito D. Socos y los sábados y domingos se levanta temprano para viajar a Ayacucho. En el mercado Nery García Zarate, tiene un puesto donD. venD. comidas como: Mondongo, Puca picante, Cau cau, Lomo Saltado, Garbanzo, Pallar.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D.: arroz, fideos, azúcar, entre otros para la preparación D. alimentos. Los demás días D. la semana se dedica a la agricultura siembra cereales.
Le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal, porque pueD. acceder a los créditos y pueD. ahorrar ya que en la casa no se pueD. lo que ahorro en lo ciclos anteriores lo invirtió en su negocio.
Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Honorata is a member of the Communal Bank “Socos”. She is 56 years old, married, and has six children.

Honorata prepares and sells food. She started her business seven years ago so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and is now doing well. Honorata lives in the District of Socos and wakes up early on Saturdays and Sundays so that she can travel to Ayacucho. At the Nery García Zarate Market, she has a stand where she sells food such as tripe stew, “puca picante” (a dish consisting of pork, roasted potatoes, peanuts, and peppers), “cau cau” (beef tripe and potatoes), marinated steak and potatoes, chickpeas, and butter beans.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, sugar, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes. On the other days of the week, she engages in farm work by growing grains. Honorata enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she is able to access loans and accumulate savings. Since she already has a home, she did not set asiD. savings in previous cycles so that she could invest in her business. Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Chak S. is a hard-working woman who has spent her life cultivating crops. Chak S. is a 57-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. Chak S. is married to Phin Pei, age 56. This couple, who work together in the farming business are blessed with four children, two of whom are employed in different jobs to earn a profit. The remaining two are students who attend the local school. In order to earn extra income, Chak S. will be using the loan to buy some pig feed and piglets for feeding purposes. She hopes to use the remaining cash to pay the arrangement fees of her child to go to work overseas.

loans.use: to buy some pig feed and piglets for feeding purposes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dried fish vending.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and bamboo for her fishing business.

Josephine  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and bamboo for her fishing business.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa is 56-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her older daughter is a teacher and her youngest one is a student. She operates a hat trading business out of a rented booth at a trading center. She started her business in 2001. Now she sells a variety of imported hats of all ages. She imports her goods once a month from China. She is very good at picking modern and stylish hats for her business. Therefore her goods are well-known among her customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to buy more hats to increase my business sales." She is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventories.

loans.use: To purchase more hat inventory.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 36 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. He earns about Php 30,000 per cropping season as a farmer working in the Philippines.

Domingo grows corn and has been doing it for 15 years. Domingo is asking for a loan of Php 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

In the future, Domingo hopes that his farming business will improve to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is married with 5 children. She is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows corn and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase 100 sq. meters of land to plant additional crops. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Veneranda hopes to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase 100 sq. meters of land to plant additional crops.

loans.name: Fasokounawolo Ii Group

texts.fr:
Fasokounawolo II est constitué de  10 femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 35 ans, en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KOURANI, qui est la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,7 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
Fasokounawolo II is made up of 10 women, all of whom are married, are on average 35 years old, have on average two children, and live mostly in polygamous families in Koba, one of the villages in the Massigui commune, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali.

They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal to better organize their businesses for the start of winter. They grow, among other things, millet, rice, and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.

With this new loan, Kourani, who is the first one standing on the right, plans to buy the ingredients and small tools and pay for labor to maintain .7 hectares of millet and peanuts. The crops are sold in the city of Massigui after harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She foresees making a profit of about 40,000 FCFA at the end of the year.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, and small tools

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 69-year-old married man with eight children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

The responsibility to look after the family rests solely on him, and his dream is to educate his children up to university. 

He has operated a retail shop for 20 years now, and his main constraint is inadequate capital to invest in his shop. But his dream is to own a wholesale shop and also buy a motorcycle for transport business so as to increase on his daily income. He intends to get a hired driver to ride the motorcycle, who will remit to Edward 80% of the daily earning.

Edward needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Zainab.  She is a widow and has 3 children aged 7, 10 and 14 years who are school-going children. In 2002, Zainab established her textiles business.  She learnt from her mother after dropping out of school how to do business. Her business assisted her before and after she got married to her late husband. 

She earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  Zainab has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy  different types of clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  In the future, Zainab plans to open a larger shop and also see her children through their education. 

Zainab serves customers around Makeni City and the surrounding villages.  She offers quality materials; that’s why her business is popular.  Zainab travels by public transport to Guinea Conakry once a month and Freetown twice a month. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for different types of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Omungyenyi Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
At her flourishing food stall in Ntungamo market, 49-year-old Mary sells food items such as beans, millet, and maize. Mary is an enterprising business woman who has been running her business for the past 6 years. The food items she sells are highly-favored staple foods on most food markets and at homes in Ntungamo and most parts of Western Uganda.

Mary is an exception to the rule. Notwithstanding the fact that she is divorced, she has showed fortitude in the face of hardship. It is a trait which is a rarity in most Ugandan women. She says that the odds were stacked against her but due to her strong resolve, she was not fazed. Her approach was to work assiduously to better her own welfare and that of her family. The entry into her business, just like any other business, was formidable but she remained firm in the face of the hurdles she encountered.

In many ways, affirmative action programs have been invaluable to her, just like they have been to many women entrepreneurs all across Uganda. Farming is the second string to her bow and, needless to say, her farms provide all the food items she sells after harvesting.
Mary says that her monthly sales income totals up to Uganda shillings 800,000. Mary is going to use this Kiva loan to pay school fees for her kids and for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her kids and for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Faa Yaa Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme Mariam est la représentante du groupe FAA YAA WENDE. Elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. Les 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle fait la coiffure depuis 15ans et s’est fait représenter sur la photo par la trésorière qui vend des draps. L’argent va servir pour la coiffure. Elle s’approvisionnement dans les différents marchés. Ses clients sont les femmes et les filles.

Elle veut s’acheter des mèches, des produits de beauté, des casques et des lave-tête.

Mme économise pour de la famille. Elle ambitionne de bonne choses pour son affaire et pour la famille.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the FAA YAA WENDE group. She is the single mother of 2 children aged 11 and 5, both of whom go to school, and she is responsible for the upkeep of 5 dependents in total. Mariam has been a hairdresser for 15 years. She is represented in the picture by the group's treasurer, who sells sheets.
The loan will be used to fund her hairdressing business, which caters to girls and women. She gets her supplies from various markets and needs to restock on hair extensions, beauty products, hairdryers and shampoo basins. Mariam is saving up for her household and has big ambitions for her business and family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, beauty products, hairdryers and shampoo basins.

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru:
В этот раз Роман изъявил желание воспользоваться кредитом, так как предвидел рост цен и решил закупить товар заранее, по более низкой цене. На кредитные средства Роман приобрел муку, сахар, соль, макароны, майонез, консервы рыбные, чай кофе и др. продукты для реализации.

За счет предыдущего кредита Роман смог расширить ассортимент своей продукции и увеличить прибыль. Роман ценит полученные кредиты и считает недопустимым опаздывать с выплатами даже на один день.
texts.en: This time, Roman expressed his desire to obtain a loan because he had anticipated an increase in prices and decided to purchase merchandise in advance, at lower prices.  He used the funds from the loan to purchase flour, sugar, salt, pasta, mayonnaise, canned fish, tea, coffee and other products for sale.  Using the previous loan, Roman was able to expand the assortment of his products and increase his profits.  Roman values the loans he obtained and considers it unacceptable to be late on payments even by one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories at low prices

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Charlyn has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like adobo, caldereta and afritada. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Charlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Charlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 33 years old and married, with two sons. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the construction field.

Thu has been making stuffed animals for 12 years. She receives the materials from toy dealers and makes the stuffed toys at her house. 

Thu would like to take out a loan to buy a new sewing machine and materials for making stuffed toys. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and materials for making stuffed toys.

loans.name: Leemu

texts.en: Leemu, a single 30-year-old high school graduate living in Congo Town, has two children aged 3 months and 12 years, the latter of whom attends school. For the past ten years Leemu has been involved in local soap-making, and is now requesting a loan to purchase more oil, caustics, and wood for her business. She hopes to buy land and build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, caustics, and wood for her soap-making business.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is 48 years old. Warlito is married and is a loving father of four children. He lives in Namnama village, in the Isabela area, with his wife, his children, his parents, and his brother. 

He is a responsible and goal-oriented person. He is involved in growing agricultural crops. Warlito primarily grows corn. He wants to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to treat the land in order to get a good harvest. He also needs money to pay for his employees' work. This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of 25,000. Warlito thanks all creditors, who will support him.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband works as a farmer and mechanic.

Jeneth is a food vendor. She sells cooked meals and local delicacies. Jeneth also helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. She does her best to support her family.

Jeneth has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, and farm fertilizers. She hopes for her business to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a twenty nine year old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. He has been running a retail shop for a period of one year. He started the shop with the savings he had acquired from cotton farming. The major challenges he is experiencing are: price fluctuation and inflation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. None the less, he has a goal of diversifying his business and expanding into new markets.

Godfrey needs a loan to buy a weighing machine and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy a weighing machine and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Jocelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Jocelyn became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Yason

texts.en:
Yason is 49 years old and married to Hellen. They have seven children.

He has been in this business for the last three years and from it he earns a monthly income of Kenyan shillings 40,000.  He is applying for his first loan of Kenyan Shilngs 15,000.  He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by  a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more sewing machines and  textile materials.  His dream is to expand and open more tailoring shops.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines and textile materials.

loans.name: Chimedtsogzol

texts.en:
Chimedtsogzol is 51 years old and lives with her 4 children in Arhangai province in Central Mongolia. Since her husband died 5 years ago, she became the only person taking care of and earning money for the family. Her daughter is now employed and independent. Chimedtsogzol has been selling dairy products in a market regularly since 2000, both in the neighboring province and in the capital city. Since her income is not enough to support the family, she would like to increase her variety, sales and income and extend her business further.

Chimedtsogzol is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, 'I'd love to extend my business based on my 12 years of experience in order to help my family financially."' The total amount she is requesting is 1,200,000 MNT to purchase dairy products such as milk, dried curds, curds, etc. from herders,

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es: María Gladys de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia; ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y obtener las mejores cosechas,  el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona muy apta para el desarrollo y crecimiento de la siembra y está cercano a su residencia; comercia en todas las zonas aledañas  y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los precios bajos  y sobre todo por el buen servicio; María es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar sus sueños;  quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, insecticida, etc. María Gladys tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable sabe que saldara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una vida mejor

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, insecticida etc

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: El cliente vive en la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Tiene 12 años en la venta de limones y escogió esta actividad debido a que se compró un vehículo para transporte y con el cual también realiza fletes.  Trabaja todos los días, desde muy temprano en la mañana.  Se encuentra en estado de unión libre y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene 2 hijos, una hija de 10 años quien va a la escuela fiscal del sector y el otro de 11 meses de edad.  Su sueño a futuro es poder ver crecer a sus hijos y que tengan una profesión.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de limones para su comercialización.
texts.en: This client lives in the city of Portoviejo.   He’s been selling lemons for 12 years and chose this activity because he bought a vehicle for transport that he also uses to make deliveries.  He works every day starting very early in the morning.  He’s in a common law relationship and his wife’s a housewife.  He has two children, a 10-year-old daughter attending public school and an 11-month-old son.  His future dream is to watch his children grow and that they have professions.  For now, he needs the loan to buy lemons to sell.

loans.use: to buy lemons.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 43-year-old single mother of two children, both of whom attend school. Agnes lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a very hard working woman who dreams of having a stable income-generating business. As a result, she owns houses for renting, supplemented by incomes earned from salary. She is seeking credit to complete her commercial house.

loans.use: to complete her commercial house.

loans.name: Merceba

texts.es: Es una señora sonriente de 35 años de edad, pertenece a la  etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casada con 3 en edad escolar. Su esposo se encuentra desempleado. Desde hace 12 años se dedica al comercio de marisco, de esta manera genera sus propios ingresos, contribuye con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Solicitando financiamiento para comprar más marisco y pescados. Su sueño es llegar a tener su propio propia lancha con motor de borda, para incrementar el inventarios de sus productos, mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

loans.use: para comprar más marisco y pescados.

loans.name: Reine Béniwoa

texts.en:
Madam Reine Béniwoa J. was born on this 10th September 1977 at Tsévié (P/Zio). Office secretary by trade, she is married and is a mother of two (02) children. As the incomes of her unemployed husband does not covering the household charges, while she has her mother sicked and blocked on bed. Madam Reine Béniwoa J. had to launched in the trading which is bringing to her better incomes than her job of secretary which is not more paying. With her first credit of $250 well repaid, she has meeting a little by little the two ends. Madam Reine Béniwoa J. requests today a new credit of $500 to buy ladies shoes and bags. The implementation of this project will allow her to increase her incomes and the impact will be the improvement of her family living conditions and the normal progress in the studies of her brothers at dependence.

Madame J. Béniwoa Reine est née le 10 Septembre 1977 à Tsévié (P/Zio). Secrétaire bureautique de formation, elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Comme les revenus de son mari sans emploi, ne suffisent pour les besoins du foyer alors qu’elle a sa mère malade et alitée, Madame J. Béniwoa, a dû laisser se lancer dans le commerce qui lui rapporte mieux que son emploi de secrétaire qui ne se paie même pas. Avec son premier crédit de $250 bien remboursé, elle pu tirer son épingle de jeu. Madame J. Béniwoa sollicite aujourd’hui un nouveau crédit de $500 pour acheter des chaussures et des sacs de femmes. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et l’impact sera l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille et l’évolution normale dans les études de ses frères à sa charge.

loans.use: To buy ladies shoes and bags

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: A Matalena V. was born on the 17th of October 1965.  She has six children. Her small business project is BANANA FARM.  She said, this is a good income for her family not only that but it really helps her husband who is working in order to get extra money for their family. Matalena is very happy about her project that she is working on it gives her time to get away from her family and exercise.  Matalena works from eight o’clock in the morning and finished at five in the evening.  Matalena goes to town to sell her baskets of banana to the market.  She earns more than hundred tala a day from her selling.  She is confident of how to run her business and she has her family to give her a hand in order for her make things easier.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides, fungicides, farm implements

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir lives with his wife, Sandra Zeballos, and their four children in his home in El Alto. Vladimir works as a security guard for a customs company at El Alto International Airport. With prior loans, he's been able to add four rooms to his home. But the main wall facing the street is deteriorating and dangerous, and it can let in water when it is raining. The loan Vladimir is requesting would be used to replace the current adobe and construct a wall of brick and mortar. This is the fourth loan he has requested, and his credit history makes him an excellent candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Vladimir vive con su esposa, la señora Sandra Zeballos y cuatro hijos de 16,14 y 12 año, en su vivienda de Villa Tunari en la ciudad de El Alto. Vladimir trabaja como oficial de seguridad en una empresa aduanera del Aeropuerto internacional de El Alto, del Departamento de La Paz. Con créditos de Impro otorgados en gestiones pasadas pudo efectuar la conclusión de cuatro habitaciones, las cuales son ocupadas por su familia, pero el muro principal de la vivienda que queda hacia la calle, se encuentra en total deterioro y es peligroso, por cuanto corre el riesgo de caer con las lluvias. El destino del crédito es para cambiar el muro de adobe existente y construir un muro de ladrillo y cemento. Es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo en nuestra institución, y su rendimiento y puntualidad demuestran un comportamiento crediticio bueno.

loans.use: Renovating his home

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
BERTA a 37-year-old married mother of four. Her husband works in the country harvesting cane. She runs a convenience store out of her home and also sells clothes. She belongs to a collective with Rosalba Jimenez R., Asuncion del Transito Hernandez, who sells perfume and cosmetics, and Bertha R. R., who sells clothing. With the loan, they plan to increase their merchandise and thusly grow their businesses and help cover family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

BERTA TIENE 37 AÑOS, CASADA, CUATRO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DE LA CAÑA. ELLA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA EN DONDE TAMBIEN VENDE ROPA. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SAN VICENTE 2 JUNTO CON: ROSALBA JIMENEZ R. (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS) Y ASUNCION DEL TRANSITO HERNANDEZ (VENTA DE ROPA). CON EL PRESTAMO AUMENTARAN SU MERCANCIA Y DE ESTA FORMA CRECERAN COMO COMERCIANTES Y PODRAN CONTRIBUIR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sihami

texts.id:
Madam Sihami P., has two child a boy and a girl. She lives with her family at a rented place. Her husband runs a drink stall. Her cake selling business is to increase her household income. She starts work from 5am in the morning till 9pm. Besides selling her cakes at her stall, she also takes delivery orders. Her average daily revenue is around Rp 50.000,00. With this extra Rp 700.000,00 she hopes to take in more order by stocking up more ingredients and materials for the upcoming festival. She also plans to buy a mixer, to ease her cake making task.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard , Kiva volunteer.

Ibu Sihami P. merupakan ibu rumah tangga yang dikaruniai seorang putra dan seorang putri. Dia tinggal di rumah kontrakan bersama suami dan kedua anaknya. Suaminya memiliki usaha air minum isi ulang. Usaha kue ini dia jalani untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga. Dia mengerjakannya mulai dari jam 5 pagi sampai dengan jam 9. Setelah itu dia titipkan di warung - warung untuk dijual. Selain itu dia juga menerima pesanan. Penghasilannya perhari berkisar Rp 50.000,00. Modal sebesar Rp 700.000,00 ini dia harapkan untuk menambah modal pembelian bahan - bahan mentah. Sehubungan dengan hari raya Lebaran yang akan datang. Tentunya akan banyak sekali pesanan yang akan bisa dipenuhi oleh Sihami dengan modal yang besar. Selain itu juga untuk rencana pembelian mixer. Alat ini sangat memudahkan Sihami dalam proses pembuatan kuenya.

loans.use: Membeli bahan - bahan membuat kue dan rencana membeli mixer  - To buy ingredients for making cake and a mixer

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mr. Mark O. I. is 57 years old, married with 3 children, and lives in Benin City. He sells provisions, and is seeking a loan of $800 to buy more provisions for sale. He has been in business since 1988, after learning the business for 6 years. He is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
We found Doña Basilia in her cosy and humble home, in the company of her charming and affectionate children. This enterprising mother and her faithful husband devote themselves to selling used electronic equipment, a business they took up two years ago and which is bringing them a lot of satisfaction and happiness due to the favourable results which they are obtaining, permitting them to prosper and offer the best to their dear children.

This enterprising mother’s wish is to increase her capital in order to invest it in her business selling second-hand equipment, merchandise they bring from Arica to sell in the town of Juliaca. This activity is very important for them and has become the family’s major source of income: so each and every effort is necessary thanks to the monthly bills they have to pay to cover the healthcare of their dear son Ramiro who suffers from a painful illness that makes it impossible for him to complete everyday tasks. Right now Basilia needs our help in order to move forward with her dear son.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Encontramos a doña Basilia, en su acogedor y humilde domicilio, en compañía de sus encantadores y amorosos hijos. Esta emprendedora madre y su fiel esposo se dedican a la comercialización de artefactos usados, negocio que emprendieron hace dos años y que les está trayendo mucha satisfacción y alegría por los resultados favorables que van obteniendo, permitiéndoles así prosperar y ofrecerles lo mejor a sus queridos hijos.

El deseo que tiene esta emprendedora madre es aumentar su capital para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de artefactos usados, mercadería que trae desde la ciudad de Arica para comercializarlos en la ciudad de Juliaca. Esta actividad es muy importante para ellos y se ha convertido en el principal ingreso económico de su hogar, todos y cada uno de los esfuerzos son muy necesarios debido a que mensualmente tienen que costear los gastos de salud de su querido hijo Ramiro que sufre de una penosa enfermedad que le imposibilita realizar labores cotidianas.En estos momentos Doña Basilia necesita de nuestro apoyo para salir adelante junto a su querido hijo.

loans.use: Investment of capital to acquire a larger number of electronic goods.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Vanny has been married since 1982 and has four children one son and three daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1985. Her husband is assisting her to spin thread and silk at home. He sometimes helps her weave as well. Two of their children got married and live in different houses with their families. The other two are living with them, one is sewing cloth and another one is studying in the local school. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting another loan of the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in raw materials necessary to make his products

loans.name: Ni Komang Partini

texts.id:
Ni Komang Partini is a wife of a local school teacher. She opens a canteen at the school where her husband teaches. This school canteen is managed together with other school teachers' wives and they sell in turn. Ni Komang Partini gets one week time slot in a month to sell her stuffs at the school canteen. She sells stuffs favored by the school kids such as traditional snack, rice, drinks etc.

Apart from this, she also opens a small general store at her house. She started this business with initial capital of IDR 1 million (approx of USD 105). In her small stores, she sells snack, drink and daily necessities.

With the loan money, she plans to add the merchandise by selling pig feed as there are a lot of pig farmers in the neighborhood. She hopes this can increase the stores' revenue.

With the increases in revenue, she will be able to have more money to fund the education of her two children who are studying in university in Java island. She also hopes that this will make her business more successful.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Biar pun sebagai istri seorang guru, namun Ni Komang Partini tetap ulet bekerja. Partini membuka kantin disekolah dimana tempat suaminya mengajar. Selain itu juga membuka usaha warung dirumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000.- Partini memulai usaha ini. Jenis barang dagangan yang dijual dikantin sekolah seperti jajan tradisional, nasi, buah-buahan, minuman dan juga makanan ringan yang sangat digemari oleh anak –anak. Untuk dikantin sekolah Partini berjualan dengan cara bergilir dengan istri-istri guru yang lain. Dalam satu bulan Partini mendapat giliran berdagang sebanyak 1 minggu dan kesempatan ini dipergunakan sebaik – baiknya. Partini mulai berjualan dari pagi hari sampai siang hari sesuai dengan waktu sekolah. Selanjutnya Partini berdagang dirumahnya. Untuk dirumah, Partini juga menyediakan bermacam-macam barang dagangan seperti makanan ringan, minuman dan semua kebutuhan pokok. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, Partini berencana untuk menjual pakan ternak seperti dedak padi dan juga dedak gandum yang sangat dibutuhkan oleh para peternak yang ada disekitar tempat tinggalnya. Dengan adanya tambahan jenis barang dagangan, Partini yakin akan mendapatkan keuntungan lebih. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk membiayai pendidikan kedua anaknya yang masih kuliah di Jawa. Rumahnya dibangun sendiri ditanah mertuanya dan hidup berdekatan dengan semua keluarganya. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh,usahanya semakin maju dan berkembang.

loans.use: To add working capital and to buy more merchandise (Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli barang dagangan)

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Welcome to Fernando’s Bar!! Fernando is 56 years old and is originally from Xilembene, in the Gaza Province. He is single and father of 2 daughters (25 years old and 11 years old) who live in South Africa with an uncle, as their mother died a couple of years ago.

Fernando lived in the capital Maputo most of his life, completing primary school and working as a government employee for the FRELIMO Political Party. When he retired 3 years ago, he decided to open a bar in Ponta D’Ouro, a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

The bar is located near the village’s central open-air market and serves only Mozambican national brands. A glass of beer costs MTn 50 (US$ 2) and a bottle of rum, his most-sold product, costs MTn 150 (US$ 6). Fernando loves his bar and to serve clients. He has become quite close to some of them, and together they recently started to sell T-shirts and hats with Fernando’s brand name (“Fernando’s Bar – Ponta D’Ouro”). These customers produce the clothing in South Africa and bring it to Ponta for him to sell at the bar; the profit is split 50/50. A T-shirt is sold for MTn 350 (US$ 14) and hats go for for MTn 50 (US$ 2). With the bar, Fernando makes from MTn 50,000 (about US$ 2000) up to MTn 200,000 (US$ 8200) per month, depending on the season and South African holidays, and with the sale of clothes he is making up to MTn 100,000 (US$ 4100) per month, and he is incredibly satisfied about it.

On top of supporting his daughters, Fernando also helps 3 sisters and his mother who live in Zipeto, near Maputo. He goes to Maputo around once a month to buy inventory for his bar and spends around MTn 5,000 (US$ 200) in food for his family (in total around 15 people). As he doesn’t have a car, he goes with the minibus and pays MTn 300 (US$ 12.50) for the round-trip ticket.

Hluvuku is part of Fernando’s life. He has already had 5 loans that he used in the bar (for expansion and increase of inventory), the first one in August 2005 of MTn 6,000 (US$ 250). This sixth loan of MTn 30,000 (US$ 1200) will also be used to increase inventory and prepare for South African holidays in April. In the future, Fernando plans ask for a leasing loan to buy a good car to help him buy merchandise and sell his signature clothing at close beaches. He also dreams of building a small house in Ponta (he currently lives in the back of the bar) and a kitchen in the bar to sell food to his clients. With his motivation, charisma and will to grow his business, he is definitely going to succeed in life.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en: Mrs. Sothea S. lives in the village of Trapaing Taluong in the KampongSpeu Province.  She is 44 and is the mother of six children, three of whom work in a garment factory, a third one is studying in a local school and the two youngest are at home because they too young to work or study.  Sothea S. is a farmer who cultivates a field near to the village.  Her husband, Rithy Nhim, is a construction worker and when he has free time, he uses his motorcycle to do as a motorbike taxi driver to support the household.  Mrs. S. previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding purposes.  Last year a drought hurt her crop, but this year all are hopeful that it will rain more and the rice crop will be more abundant.  In order to work her field she needs to buy one more cow to plow the field; so Mrs. Sothea S. is asking for a loan to help afford it.  She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: Buy one more cow to plow the field.

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en: The hardship and the struggle for survival is seen in Tawa S., who has been a widow for the past eight years. She is 40 years old and has four children to cater to. She sells garri at Sabo Oniba in Lagos State, Nigeria. She acquired her skill over four years and has been in this business since 1988. Tawa needs a loan of $700.00 to enable her to buy more bags of garri to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Garri to sell.

loans.name: Lita Alcidia

texts.es:
Mrs Lita is a partner in the Communal Bank "Santo Cristo de Bagazn". She lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Rioja. She business is located in her own house at Jr. 7 de Junio N º264. She sells general food supplies, candy and other products consumed on a daily basis.

Brought about by the necessity of supporting her husband, in order to aid economically with spendings of the house, and thanks to her perseverance in her work she was able to little by little stock up until she had a store supplied with all the products required by the inhabitants of the neighborhood in which she lives.

With the loan of S/. 800.00 ($ 275.00) to be repaid in 6 months, she would purchase bulk quantities of packets of noodles in different brands and varieties, preserved fish in boxes, bags of sugar and rice and liters of oil as well as stocking up on sodas and candy and personal cleansing products.

Mrs Lita is 22 years old and is very sure of herself and is characterized as being a woman who fights for what she wants, is very hard working, responsible and persistent. Her dream is to have her own distribution company for products and to secure the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lita es socia del Banco Comunal “SANTO CRISTO DE BAGAZAN” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Rioja y distrito de Rioja, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en Jr. 7 de Junio N º264, en él vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. Surgió por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo, y de esta manera poder aportar económicamente en los gastos de la casa, gracias a su perseverancia en el trabajo hizo que poco a poco vaya creciendo hasta llegar a tener una bodega surtida con todos aquellos artículos que son de requeridos por los moradores del barrio en el que vive. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 para pagar en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos en paquetes de distintas marcas y variedades, conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en litros, y a granel, además de surtir con bebidas gasificadas y golosinas y productos de aseo personal. La señora Lita tiene 22 años se siente muy segura de si misma se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante, sueña con tener su propia distribuidora de producto y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of general products.

loans.name: Rehema's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 28 years old, single, and has an 11 year old child. She is a clothing seller. She works from 10am to 7pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $87 from her sales.

Rehema hopes this loan can help her buy more clothes for her business. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members Mariam, Yasinta, and Halima, who have businesses dealing with clothing and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rosaura Adelaida

texts.es:
Rosaura is a member of “Banco Comunal Sarita. She lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Rosaura is an obstetrician. She rents 3 practices in strategic places in the town of Ayacucho, all located on crowded main streets and there are 3 people assisting her at the offices. At one of the practices there is a pharmacy where they also sell gift items, jewellery, and make photocopies. Rosaura supervises the practices on a daily basis.

Rosaura needs a loan of 1400 soles to be invested in buying glass cabinets for her offices. It is her dream to own a clinic and finish building her house with all possible comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Rosaura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita. Rosaura es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Rosaura es de profesión Obstetriz, Tiene 3 consultorios obstétricos en lugares estratégicos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, están ubicados en avenidas principales y concurridas, para lo cual cuenta con 3 personas que le ayudan en la atención de los consultorios, todos los locales son alquilados, en uno de los consultorios también tiene una farmacia y vende artículos de regalo, joyas, servicio de fotocopiado, Rosaura visita diariamente todos los consultorios para supervisar.

Rosaura necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de vitrinas para implementar sus consultorios. Los sueños de Rosaura son tener una clínica y terminar de construir toda su casa con todas las comodidades.

loans.use: Purchase of glass cabinets to be installed at medical offices.

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
Esta señora inició vendiendo productos naturales combinado con una mini pulpería, ella pensó en invertir más en la pulpería porque era donde mas vendía, vendió tres pepanos (triciclos para hacer viajes cortos en la localidad) (ciclo taxis) para invertir en el inventario e hizo un primer crédito con ADIM y así logró tener un crecimiento en su negocio y ahora con cada crédito ella invierte en más productos que son de primera necesidad y de rápida rotación y otros que sus clientes le encargan como cosméticos, ropa menor y grande, etc. 

Vive con su esposo que es taxista, ella se entiende sola en el negocio, tiene un hijo pequeño. Piensa en crecer más para así garantizar el futuro de su hijo y ser independiente económicamente y así sentirse dueña de su empresa decidiendo solo ella en su futuro.
texts.en:
Yaqueline started out selling natural products along with a small convenience store. She planned to invest more in the convenience store because that's where most of her sales were. She sold three moto-rickshaws so she could invest in supplies and took out her first loan with Kiva partner ADIM, and she was able to grow her business. Now with every loan she invests in more products that are of prime necessity and rapid rotation, as well as other items her customers demand like cosmetics, small and large clothes, etc. She lives with her husband, who is a taxi driver, and they have a small son. She works on her business alone. She plans to grow it even more so she can guarantee a bright future for her son and be economically independent, thusly feeling like the owner of her business and having control of her future.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena Gutiérrez Sánchez tiene 53 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valerosas, vive en la calle Francisco de Miranda 1994 del distrito Esperanza Alta provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta el tercer año de educación primaria y no continuó estudiando por falta de recursos económicos, pues quedo huérfana muy pequeña y la criaron sus abuelos.
Se casó con Santos Minchón león y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 son estudiantes y dependen de ella puesto que son estudiantes.
Empezó con su negocio, vendiendo pan, luego también vendía hielo, poco a poco incrementó su negocio, un tiempo quebró completamente y no podía recuperar, fue cuando una amiga la invitó a participar de los bancos de Manuela Ramos y ella con mucha duda entro al Banco, se dio cuenta que era de gran ayuda porque empezó a incrementar su negocio y a recuperar nuevamente.
Con el primer monto de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas compró galletas, dulces y gaseosa.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que se cancelará en 6 cuotas piensa comprar gaseosa, frugos, azúcar y leche.
Su sueño es tener un negocio surtido e independiente donde no sea el pasadizo de la casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena Gutiérrez Sánchez is 53 years old and is a member of the Mujeres Valerosas (Valiant Women) Microfinance Institute. She lives on Francisco de Miranda Street 1994, in the Esperanza Alta district of the Trujillo province in the department of La Libertad Perú. She studied up to the third grade in elementary school, but did not continue with her schooling due to a lack of financial resources as she was orphaned at a young age and was raised by her grandparents.

She married Santos Minchón León, and they have 6 children, 4 of whom are still dependants because they are school age.

She started out her business by selling bread, and then she sold ice as well. Little by little, she increased her business. At one point, however, the business went completely bankrupt and she could not recoup her losses. At this time, a friend invited her to participate in the Manuela Ramos microfinance institutes, so she reluctantly joined one. She realized that it was a big help for her because her business started to increase and she started to once again recover her losses.

With the first 300.00 PEN loan, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, she purchased cookies, candy and soft drinks.

With this 800.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she is planning on buying soft drinks, fruit juices and nectars, sugar and milk.

She dreams of having a well-stocked and independent business that is not located in the corridor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, juice, and other goods

loans.name: Tula

texts.es: Tula tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace un año decidió dar un giro completo en sus actividades para generarse recursos económicos en su propia casa, mediante un locutorio, donde además de ofrecer el servicio de fotocopias. Arrendó un local en una zona céntrica de su ciudad para  asegurarse las ventas, considera que ha sido un año de éxitos, lo que la motiva a perseverar en este negocio y con miras a expandirlo para seguir progresando. EL servicio que ofrece en su establecimiento es diario, con su amable y cálida atención logra captar nuevos clientes, una ligera dificultad es la competencia, por lo que quiere ofrecer un mejor servicio. Tula es una de las clientas más fieles que tiene MFP, estuvo en un grupo en Jauja (a 1 hora de distancia), pero se mudó y ahora ha empezado en esta zona con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de una cabina más y para el mantenimiento de su fotocopiadora. Ambos, suman la cantidad que solicita.
texts.en:
Tula is fifty years old and lives with her husband and their three children. A year ago she decided to make a a complete change in her activities to generate economic resources from her own home by opening up a phone booth store ("un locuturio," a place where long distance calls can be made at a cheaper a rate) as well as offering photocopy services. She leases a location in the center of their city to insure sales, and considering she has had a year of successes, she is motivated to continue in this business and has thoughts of expanding it to keep progressing. She offers these services every day at her store. With her friendly and warm attention, she gains new clients. A small challenge though is the competition, which is why she wants to offer better service. Tula is one of the most loyal clients that MFP has. Previously she was a member of a group in Jauja (one hour from her current location), but she moved and now has begun in this zone with MFP. With the money requested, she will invest in purchasing another booth and pay for the maintenance of her photocopier. These two goals sum up to the quantity of money that she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a booth for her phone booth store and pay for maintenance of her photocopying machine.

loans.name: Fazrat

texts.en:
Fazrat M. is a 26-year-old man who breeds calves in a small village in Saatli region. Fazarat is young but full of energy; he tries every single day to make the life of his parents better. Fazrat started his business in 2002. He continued the business of his father, who is a pensioner. Fazrat has great experience in cattle breeding because he observed it from his childhood. He got an education in finance/economics he works in local organization as an accountant so that he doesn't lose his skills, but his main financial income comes from cattle selling.

Fazrat would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase income and improve life conditions. Fazrat is planning to get married next year. We wish his good luck and appreciate for your help!

loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Elizabeth R. is 33 years old and from Mwanza. She is married with three children, who are between the ages of 4 and 16. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan.

Elizabeth runs a tailoring business. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing, primarily for women. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week. Elizabeth currently earns about $100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to buy one tailoring machine, and more materials for making clothes. In the future, she plans to open another store. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy one tailoring machine, and materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Nyètaa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nyètaa est composé de huit (08)  femmes,  toutes mariées  qui ont un âge moyen de 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques dans le village de Zogofina Were II (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe se sont connus à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage dans le village.
Elles ont connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers les femmes de Zogofina Wêrê I qui mènent les mêmes activités génératrices de revenu qu’elles et qui sont dans le système depuis plusieurs années à l’issu de l’assemblée générale tenue au chef lieu de la commune rurale de Sakoïba. Elles  sont avec l’institution depuis deux ans et sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour acheter, 1 869 litres de lait frais et 5sacs de mil. Elles s’approvisionnent en lait frais sur place au village et à Kamakono village situé à 3 km ; en mil à travers leurs propres activités journalières au cours des récoltes dans les champs des hommes et à la foire hebdomadaire au grand marché de Ségou. Le lait est vendu frais ou caillé en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou et quant au mil, il est d’abord transformé en couscous séché pour être revendu au village à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles  espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 31 150FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer pour la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille. Leur objectif principal est d’épargner afin d’élever des vaches dans le futur.
texts.en:
The Nyètaa group is composed of eight married women, who, on average, are 32 years old and have 5 children. The majority live in monogamous families in the village of Zogofina Were II (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The members of the group became acquainted through bonds of marriage and neighborhood in the village. They heard about Soro Yiriwaso during general assemblies held at the rural town of Sakoïba, from women in Zogofina Wêrê I who run similar money-making businesses, and who have been part of the system for several years. The group has been with this institution for two years and is seeking its third solidarity group (group loan). This loan will be used to buy 1'869 liters of fresh milk and 5 sacks of millet. They purchase fresh milk in their village, as well as in Kamakono, a village located 3 kilometers away. Millets is obtained from their daily work during harvest season in the men's fields, as well as at the weekly fair at the grand market in Ségou. Milk is sold fresh or sour, itinerantly in the neighborhoods of Ségou. As for the millet, it is firstly transformed in dried couscous, and then sold in the village, to a clientele composed of men and women. They hope to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 31'150 (ca US$ 62), to be used to repay the loan and to contribute to the family expenses. Their main goal is to save money in order to be able to raise cows in the future.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk and millet

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en la casa que lograron construir a base de mucho esfuerzo. Ella es una mujer muy activa, según la temporada vende diversos productos que estén de acorde  a la demanda, pues sabe que la moda o las fechas festivas son clave para invertir en mercadería, es por eso que no tiene un producto de venta específico. Cada semana, comercia sus productos en las ciudades más cercanas a su distrito, lo cual le demanda costos operativos altos, pero los cubre con las ganancias que tiene, pues el precio de sus productos son adecuados para obtener buenas ganancias. Norma tiene el anhelo de instalar una pequeña bodega en su casa y dejar de movilizarse de un lado para otro para vender sus artículos, aunque también le agrada conocer nuevos lugares y otras provincias de su país, pero lo difícil es tener que cargar con toda la mercadería para ello. Norma tiene un año trabajando con MFP, y desde que ingresó tuvo el apoyo para mejorar su negocio y relacionarse con las personas con quienes viene trabajando tan amenamente en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita esta vez es para la compra de útiles escolares y aprovechar la campaña, ya que las clases se inician en marzo.
texts.en:
Norma is 39 and lives with her husband and son in the home that they were able to build with great effort. She is a very active woman—depending on the season she sells various products that satisfy her customers’ demands. She knows that holidays and fashion trends are key when investing in merchandise, which is why she does not only sell one specific thing. Every week she sells her merchandise in nearby cities. She has high operational costs but those are covered by the profit she makes from selling her products at a good price. Norma would like to open a small general store in her home so she can stop traveling from place to place selling her products. Although she likes visiting new places and other states in her country, it is very difficult to transport her products to these new places. Norma has been working with MFP for one year and has found the needed support to improve her business and get to know the other people who work with this community bank. The loan money will be used to buy school supplies to sell to students—she wants to take advantage of the fact that classes begin in March.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies for resale

loans.name: Manzalo

texts.fr: Mme Manzalo A. est née en 1943 à Lassa Lawou. Elle est marée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes en charge. Son commerce de céréales (maïs, haricot) lui réussit très bien. Etant de plus en plus recherchée par sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement pour disposer d’un stock considérable et satisfaire constamment ses clients. Les bénéficies tirés de ce commerce lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Manzalo A. was born in 1943 at Lassa Lawou. She is married and the mother of five (5) children and taking care of two (2) other people. Her cereals business (corn, beans) is going very well. Being more and more turned to by her clients. she is asking for a loan to have a considerable inventory and to satisfy her clients on an on-going basis. The benefits from this business will enable her to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling cereals

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Ms. Agustina B. is a single mother, 59 years old, with one child. She started her business with a small sari-sari (variety) store located in front of Century Ice Plant and Paglaum MPC. She is a pioneering member of the Masidlakon Center under the Microfinance PDP-LP program of Paglaum Coop. Good credit standing has justified Agustina's continued qualification for higher loan amounts.

Because her mini-grocery can already provide for the family's daily needs, Agustina borrowed money to finance the education of her son, who is now working abroad.

"I am very grateful to Paglaum because we were able to meet the family's needs, even the education of my child. I cannot imagine my child going to college had I not been a member of Paglaum," she said. Agustina is happy with what she is getting from her little store and the support of PMPC. She is now venturing into the ready-to-wear (RTW) business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of RTW's (ready-to-wear) clothing

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys es una alegre madre de familia que a raíz de su separación tuvo que mantener su hogar, que gracias al apoyo que recibe de sus padres puede solventar las necesidades de sus hijos. A ella siempre le gusto bien arreglada, tuvo el interés de estudiar cosmetología, y aprendió no sólo a realizar algunos cortes, sino que también puede hacer tratamientos de limpieza, masajes y diversos tratamientos de la piel. Desde que sus padres le brindaron un local dentro de su casa  abrió un salón de belleza, el cual tiene 2 años de funcionamiento y cada día brinda la mejor atención a sus clientas que fielmente la visitan cada mes. Gladys tiene el anhelo de instalar un Spa dentro de su local, por lo cual requiere ambientar y ampliar su espacio para brindar diversos servicios de belleza a las personas, pero por falta de capital no puede realizarlo, por lo cual se dedica todos los días a su salón de belleza desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, pues trata de descansar temprano para atender a su hija quien también requiere de su atención. Gladys está solicitando un crédito individual con MFP, pues no cuenta con horas libres para agruparse con las señoras que conformaban los grupos o bancos comunales. Los 3000 soles los invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza que requiere para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladys is a happy mother. Because of her separation, she became responsible for taking care of her home. Thanks to the support she gets from her parents, she can provide for her children. She has always liked to be well kept, and she was interested in studying cosmetology. She learned not only how to cut hair, but she also learned how to give cleansing treatments, massages, and different skin treatments. Since her parents provided a place in their home, she opened a beauty salon two years ago. Every day she offers better service to her customers who loyally visit every month. Gladys wants to put a Spa on the premises. To do that, she needs to set up and expand her space to offer diverse beauty services. But, she cannot do that due to lack of funds. To that end, she works in the beauty salon every day from nine in the morning until six in the evening. She tries to rest early so that she can see to her daughter who needs her attention. Gladys is asking for an individual credit from MFP. She does not have the free time to join the women who make up the community banks. She will use the 3,000 PEN to buy the beauty supplies she needs to take care of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo T. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. il est propriétaire d’une ferme d’élevage à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Kodzo exerce cette activité depuis 7 ans et a considérablement augmenté son chiffre d’affaires au cours du dernier exercice. Il désire avec ce nouveau crédit élargir sa bassecours afin d’accroître la taille de son activité et mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Kodzo T. is a young man aged 35 and is married with 3 children. He is the owner of a livestock firm in Avetonou, a village situated about 100 kilometres from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Kodzo has run this business for 7 years and has significantly increased his sales over the course of the last fiscal year. With this new loan, he would like to enlarge his flock of polutry in order to increase the size of his business and better respond to the needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his flock of poultry

loans.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria L. socia D. la alcancía comunal  Grupo Unido
tiene 45 años, es natural D. la Libertad y se dedica a la venta D. comida en la Zona D. Nueva  América del Distrito D. Carabayllo, lugar donD. resiD. hace mas D.  15 años.  Maria es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a quienes ha sacado adelante con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo en el negocio. Maria es conocida en su localidad por los ricos potajes que prepara para el deleite D. su clientela, permitiéndole también desarrollarse personalmente. 
 
Hace 4 años se inicia como socia D. la Alcancía Comunal  buscando apoyo para invertir en el mejoramiento D. su negocio, logrando su objetivo, no solo por el apoyo financiero que le brinda Edaprospo sino también por el trabajo conjunto que imparte en la organización donD.  es líder y presiD..

Actualmente, la Alcancía Comunal grupo unido,  se encuentra en el primer ciclo D. la segunda fase  desembolsando  el monto D. s/ 7,700.00, con un total D. 10 socios, que en su  mayoría se dedican a la venta D.  productos lácteos (leche y queso) adquiridos en D. la provincia  D. canta por la cercanía y el bajo costo del producto que les genera mayor utilidad.

la meta D. Maria es tener su Restaurant donD. pueda brindar  mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes y a la vez generar mejores ingresos para el progreso y bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Maria L. is a member of the Grupo Unido Communal Bank. She is 45 years old and was born in La Libertad. She sells food in the Zona D. Nueva América, in the District of Carabayllom, where she has lived for 15 years. Maria is a single mother who has raised her two children by working hard at her business. Maria is known in her town for the delicious stews she prepares to the delight of her customers, allowing her to also grow personally.
She started as a member of the Communal Bank 4 years ago, looking for support to invest in the improvement of her business. She achieved her goal thanks not only to Edaprospo’s financial support, but also to the team work offered by the group that she leads. The Grupo Unido Communal Bank is currently in the second phase of their first loan cycle, disbursing the amount of S/.7,700.00 to a total of 10 group members. They mostly sell dairy products (milk and cheese) from Canta Province because it is nearby and the low product costs generate better profits.
Maria’s goal is to have a restaurant where she could proviD. her customers better service and comfort, while also generating a better income for the growth and well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana N. is 52 years old, married and has four children, a daughter and three sons, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in Ghana's Western Region. Her husband works for a cocoa company, and Christiana works as a trader, selling kerosene by the gallon. She buys her supplies in bulk from distributers in tank cars. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy more kerosene to sell to her customers. Christiana goals are to expand her business and continue to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy kerosene in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sergio Salomão

texts.pt:
Sergio Salomão M., natural de Maputo, de 28 anos de idade, com nível médio de escolaridade já concluído, casado e pai de um filho menor de idade escolar.
Vive na sua casa construída no mesmo espaço físico no bairro da Massaca, em Boane.
Nunca mudou de residência e sempre viveu com a sua família.

Trabalha para o governo como Docente numa das escolas primarias de boane. Aprendeu esta profissão no Instituto de Magistérios Primários da Matola e exerce esta tarefa desde 2003. Ganha um salário, mensalmente, no valor de 5.500,00MT e consegue poupar na sua conta bancaria 500,00MT.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos e este é o seu primeiro com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção/ ampliação da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar sem problemas para no futuro aceder a mais empréstimos e cumprir o sonho de iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Sergio Salomão M. is a native of Maputo. He is 28 years old, has finished high school, is married and the father of a child who is still a minor in school. He lives in his house, built in the very same place in the neighbourhood of Massaca in Boane. He has never moved and has always lived with his family. He works for the government as a teacher in one of the elementary schools in Boane. He learned this profession in the Institute of Elementary Teachers of Matola, and has practiced this job since 2003. He earns a monthly salary of 5,500 MT and manages to set aside 500 MT in his bank account. He has never had loans with other banks; this is his first with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 20,000 MT, for purchasing construction materials to build onto his house. He promises to pay the loan back without problem so that in future he can accede to more loans and fulfill his dream of starting his own business.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build onto family home

loans.name: Jesús Eduardo

texts.es: El joven Jesús Eduardo con reidencia en la comunidad de Chotacaj a cuatro kilometos de la ciudad de Totonicapán el desde ñiño aprendio la actividad del comercio ya desde esa edad acompañaba a su querido padre para la ventas en diferentes lugares, en plazas y fiestas atravez de los tiempos el deside hacer su propio negocio, que hasta la fecha todo le esta saliendo bien el fisita las oficina de ASDIR para solicitar un credito para ampliar su capital, para surtir su mercaderia y poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, en las diferentes comunidades del altiplano.
texts.en:
Jesús Eduardo is a young man living in the community of Chotacaj, located four kilometers from the city of Totonicapán. Since he was a boy, he learned about conducting business by accompanying his father to sell at different places, such as markets and festivals. After some time, he decided to go into business for himself and is doing well so far.

Jesús Eduardo came to ASDIR seeking a loan to increase his capital. He needs to restock with more merchandise so that he can fulfill the needs of his clients who live in the various communities of the Altiplano (High Plains).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza del Socorro L. se dedica a laborar arduamente por medio de la venta de bebidas como jugos y gaseosas y también en la venta de electrodomésticos como lo son televisores, abanicos, licuadoras, refrigeradores, entre otros.

El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de las bebidas y para la compra de los electrodomésticos y es por este motivo que ella esta confiando en que el crédito será aprobado y así mejorará las condiciones de su negocio en su localidad en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza del Socorro L. dedicates herself to working hard through the sale of beverages, such as juices and sodas. She also sells electrical appliances such as televisions, fans, blenders, refrigerators and other items.

She is requesting a loan to purchase beverages and appliances. Sra. Esperanza is confident that her loan will be approved and will help improve her business, which is located in the district of León.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electrical appliances & beverages

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales  algunos viven con ella y otros ya formaron su propia familia. 
La señora Edelmira emigró de la ciudad de Caraguataity a un populoso barrio de la ciudad de Itá hace 21 años en busca de mejor su nivel de vida. 
 En dicha ciudad montó una despensa donde surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales de carne, leche, azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general y otros insumos de primera necesidad hace más de 15 años. 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de dichos insumos a modo a aumentar su stock de mercaderías y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Edelmira is 52 years old and has seven children, some of which live with her and others that have their own family. Twenty-one years ago Edelmira moved to the city of Caraguataity, a populated community in the city of Ita. She moved here to improve her quality of life. In this city she began a small grocery store where she provides her neighbors and others meat, milk, sugar, yerba (a type of tea), general drinks and other necessary goods. She has been doing this for fifteen years. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase new goods to increase her stock of grocery goods. In this way she will improve her family’s income
