Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, general drinks, flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas.
Eva es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Eva tiene 2 carros con los que realiza transporte de pasajeros a la selva ayacuchana, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo y un chofer.
Eva necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos.
Los sueños de Eva son tener otro negocio y tener mas capital.
texts.en:
Eva is a member of the Communal Bank “Orquídeas” (Orchids). She is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children. Eva has two cars that are used for transporting passengers through the Ayacuchan jungle. The vehicles are operated by her husband and another driver.

Eva needs a loan of 450 soles in order to buy tires. She dreams of having another business and acquiring more capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn M. lives in the village of Brgy. Camba-og, Hinigaran Negros Occidental. Analyn is 34 years old.  She is married to Jose Hernal, who presently operates a Tangkop business, which is a kind of fishing using a fish trap in deeper water just off the shoreline. Food is placed inside the trap to attract the fish, crabs and shrimp. After an hour, whatever is in the center of the maze-like cage is harvested. The couple has 3 children who are 12 to 17 years old. 

Based on experience,  Analyn knew that she could not rely on her husband's income from the Tangkop or fish trap because it is seasonal and the catch can sometimes be erratic. During stormy weather, her husband could not go to his fish trap and collect the catch. This is the reason why Analyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 - to be able to borrow money to add to her capital and start a general store which could provide her family with a more steady daily income. 

Because of Analyn's regular income from her business, she could send their children to school and also provide for the daily household expenses. She earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000 from her general store. Having her own income has gone a long way in improving the quality of life of the M. family.

Analyn's credit history with Kiva's partner NWTF-Project Dungganon has been good. She always pays her dues on time and completely pays off her loan within the loan term. Her last loan, which was her 12th from NWTF-PD -- amounting to PHP 17,000 -- was invested in her general store. She industriously paid her weekly installments.  Now that she has paid it off, she is borrowing her next cycle loan of PHP 19,000 to fix her husband's fish trap so that he can continue with his fishing business. 

They intend to use the profits from this loan to start a rice retailing business to further increase their income and save up for their children's college education. 

Analyn is shown here in front of her General Store as it is quite difficult to photograph her in the middle of the sea where her husband's Tangkop or fish trap is located.
 
About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Maintenance of Tangkop (fish cage)

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija runs a provisions kiosk in the market square. She is 28 years old, married and has given birth to two children: one is currently in school while the other has yet to start. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Goaso, a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo region. Hadija buys her goods from Kumasi and sometimes from big shops in her community. She has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Starch Factory B 2 Scovia Adyek Group

texts.en:
Scovia A. is twenty-three years old and is married with three children, all going to school. She also has three dependents of whom two are going to school.

Scovia runs a business selling secondhand clothes and has been doing this business for over eight years. She is using the loan to improve her business - that is, to purchase used clothes for sale. This will enable her pay her children’s school fees and also to raise her standard of living.

Scovia is a really courageous business lady whose hope is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She is a committed LAPO client. She sells yams and has been in the business for five years. The profit from this trade enables her to support her husband, who is a motor repairman, in providing for the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase yams in bulk, as this attracts sales and increases her profit. With the loan, she plans to expand her yam business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for her children's education. She says thank you to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn L. is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in a town in Agusan del Sur. She has seven children. Her oldest is now 21 years old. She has to work hard to provide for her family. She dreams that someday her family’s living conditions will be better.

Roselyn is involved in rice farming. She also has a stall at the public market where she sells her rice. She is now preparing her land for the next planting. She will need seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, which she will use to purchase the farm inputs she needs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La señora Wilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra de ganado.
Wilma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar animales menores.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar alimento balanceado  y forraje para el ganado.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su situación económica y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Wilma has been a partner of the communal bank "Lupakas" for two years now. She is from the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, and department of Puno. She is 34 years old, a single mother, and has two children. She completed her secondary education and makes a living by purchasing livestock. Wilma tells us that with the first loan requested from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, of 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to buy small animals. Now, she is requesting a credit of 1,500.00 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to purchase balanced food and forage for her livestock. Her dream for the future is to improve her economic situation and for her children to become professionals. The things she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with her partners.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced food for her livestock

loans.name: Tavakal

texts.en: T. Tavakal is an older man with lots of experience. He is married with four children. He is uneducated and he works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 11 years, working with his family during this time. He is a professional farmer and, from back when he started his business, he has always wanted to improve his business. In the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask IMON to help with their problems. Therefore, today Tavakal is applying to Kiva hoping for your help. He is requesting a loan of 3,500 somoni to buy some seeds and fertilizer for his land. He is grateful for this loan process. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine D. C. is from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Josephine is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Josephine is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye N. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a eu 4 expériences avec le crédit. Elle est éleveuse de moutons et de poulets de chaire. Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle prend en charge sa famille et augmente son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Ndèye N. is a 54-year-old woman, married and mother of five children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for two years and had four prior experiences with credit loans. She raises sheep and chickens. Her earnings enable her to take charge of her family and increase her savings level.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano, se conformó en fecha 20 de marzo del 2009, gracias a que la Directora General la Sra.Basilia B. que se dedica a la venta de frutas, se informó del Programa gracias a la presidenta de otro grupo que era su vecina y la misma la invitó a formar su propio grupo, la misma contacto con la asesora informándose del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y su forma de trabajo.
Cada una de las actividades que realizan las mujeres de este comité es independiente pero sin perder en sentido de pertenencia y solidad hacia el grupo.
Todas las señoras son luchadoras, como ejemplo la vida de la señora Basilia B., vendedora de frutas y verduras, ella posee una casilla al costado de la ruta donde ofrece sus productos, y al mismo tiempo debe cuidar la casa para ayudar a su marido quien se dedica a la agricultura de varios cultivos, con mucho sacrificio la familia sobrevive.
Se citan las actividades de cada integrante:

texts.en:
The San Cayetano Women's Committee was established on March 20, 2009, thanks to the Ms. Basilia B., general director, who sells produce for a living. She learned about the program thanks to the president of another group, who was her neighbor. Her neighbor invited her to form her own group, so she contacted the consultant to get information about the Committee of Enterprising Women program and how it works.

Each business that the women of this committee owns is independent, but without losing that sense of belonging and solidarity with the group.

All of these women are hardworking. Take, for example, the life of Ms. Basilia B., who sells fruits and vegetables. She owns a fruit stand on the side of the road where she sells her produce, but at the same time, she has to take care of her household to help her husband, who works in agriculture. Through much sacrifice, the family is able to survive.

The following are the group members and their businesses: 1 Basilia B. Produce sales 2 Rafaela Fernández Sandwich sales 3 Claudelina V. Notions shop 4 Agustina C. General store 5 Blanca B. Fashion jewelry sales 6 Nicolaza T. Foodstuffs 7 Francisca S. Charcoal sales 8 Shirley A. Cosmetics sales 9 De las Nieves T. Produce sales 10 Griselda R. Newsstand 11 Raquel C. General store 12 Felicia V. Pharmacy 13 Ma. Mercedes B. Candy store 14 Rosenda C. Fashion jewelry sales 15 Ma. Lourdes P. Newsstand 16 Quiteria C. Café

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits (apples, pears, pineapples, melons) and vegetables (onions, tomatoes, bell peppers, potatoes)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth sells bags of maize in Oyo state, Nigeria where she lives with her family. She is a hard-working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more bags of maize to sell. Maize is used in Nigeria to prepare mouth-watering Nigerian cooked foods. She is married, with 4 children, and she is 36 years old. She hopes to give her children a quality education. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, pepper and oil

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of United Hands (Banco Mujer Manos Unidas) Group

texts.en: The name of this group is Banco Mujer Manos Unidas which translates as "The Women´s Bank of United Hands". The nine women members live in the rural area of Pococí, Limón, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. Opportunities for employment are scarce in Pococí; many families rely on the production of subsistence crops and raising livestock in order to maintain their standard of living. The members of this group are involved in various productive activities including hen rearing for the production and sale of eggs, chicken rearing in order to produce quality poultry products and pig rearing in order to produce pork products. This loan will be used by each individual member to make necessary investments for the growth of their businesses to increase revenues and for the improvement of the lives of their families. The majority of this loan will be put towards the purchase of livestock and animal feed. Flor E. R. is a 39-year-old mother of four and the elected president of Banco Mujer Manos Unidas. She lives with her husband and three of her children. One of her daughters is studying Business Administration at the National University in Sarapiqui. She has one and a half years left until graduation. On their land, Flor and her family have planted subsistence crops including rice, beans, corn and plantains, among others. At the moment, Flor is raising 20 chickens, one pig to be slaughtered and sold, and 30 hens whose eggs will later be sold. She plans to invest this loan in the purchase of 40 more hens as well as nutrients and vitamins to feed them. Flor will be able to use family-produced corn to feed her chickens, but she will need to buy special vitamins to fight off dangerous parasites which could infect the animals. Her main challenges are coping with the high costs of animal vitamins and the occasional electricity problems at home, due to the fact that Flor and her family live in a rural area, 600 meters from the nearest road. At the moment, Flor is altering her production methods in order to produce 100% organically. This method of production is favourable to Flor because she "wants to provide a higher quality product and [she] is more comfortable eating food when [she] is conscious of the composition of all the nutrients used in its production" (meat products, crops, fertilizers and gas). Her main goal is to increase organic production on her land and to become independently sustainable, meaning she would like to use only home grown products in production. She would also like to install a biodigester (equipment used to harness animal discharge in order to produce gas for cooking). This equipment is sometimes donated to farmers by the Costa Rican government. Flor has known the other members of her group for 8 years. She says that applying for a loan in a group is better because the women can help each other to succeed in their businesses and repay their loans. Zelmira F. plans to use this loan to buy chicks and nutrients to feed them. When the chicks are ready, she will sell them and their eggs to neighbours and acquaintances in the community. Zelmira sells 12 eggs for 1000 colones (roughly $2 US). She mentions the importance of maintaining the good health of her animals in order to ensure a quality end product.

loans.use: For the purchase of livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun K. is a 36-year-old married woman and she is the leader of a group loan selected by nine members, located in Koh Chamroeun village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use their share to support their different purposes. With the loans all the members also hope to increase income to improve their families' living standards. 

Mrs. Yoeun K. is a grocery seller who can earn a small income to support herself. Since this business is going well she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities. Mrs. Yoeun K. is a widow and does not have any children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda G. is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family with her general store and with the buying and selling of livestock. She lives in Cabacungan, La Castillana, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their child, who is currently in school. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and livestock businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 15,000 Philippine pesos. Melinda is now borrowing Php 29,500 so that she can continue her general store and livestock businesses. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Melinda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Fibiana

texts.es:
Fibiana tiene 2 hijos que estudian y es casada, tiene un taller de tejidos de chompas y buzos, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, hijo y tiene un empleado, negocio que inicio hace 4 años, empezó con la venta de comida en el mercado de abastos, actividad que dejo de realizar porque es muy forzado. Con su nuevo negocio sus ingresos son mayores y menos forzado, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor y menor, viaja a las diferentes ferias 4 veces por semana.
Fibiana pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor de Coral y solicita un préstamo de 300 soles dinero que será invertido para la compra de lana, liga.
Fibiana sueña con educar a sus hijos y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Fibiana is married and has two children, who are students. She has a knitwear workshop, which she runs with the help of her husband, son, and one employee. She started in business four years ago, selling food in the central market, but she gave this up because the work was too difficult. With her new business, her income is higher and easier to obtain. She sells wholesale and retail and travels to different markets four times a week. Fibiana is part of the Flor de Coral Community Bank and is asking for a loan of 300 soles ($125) to invest in buying wool and elastic tape. Fibiana wants to give her children an education and to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and elastic tape

loans.name: Blanca Andrea

texts.es:
Blanca es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Filoque, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, el distrito con la extensión geográfica mas grande de la región, se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población agrupada en caseríos pequeños que distan mucho uno del otro, sus principales actividades son la agricultura y el comercio. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Este negocio le provee de ingresos con los que ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares y también es de mucha ayuda para sus vecinos, ya que la zona en donde vive se encuentra alejada del pueblo y ellos no cuentan con acceso rápido a productos de uso diario.

Blanca desea incrementar sus ventas comprando mas productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y así obtener mayores ingresos, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas mercaderia para lograr su objetivo.

Blanca es una mujer alegre y optimista, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 44-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the hamlet of Filoque, a rural area of the Olmos district, the largest district of the region. it is known for having the majority of its population grouped in small hamlets with much distance between them. The main activities of the area are agriculture and business. It belongs to the Lambayeque province and is located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For two years she has sold basic needs products and groceries in a store in her home. This business provides her earnings with which she helps her husband with household costs. Her business is also a great help for her neighbours, since the area where they live is far from the village and they do not have fast access to daily use items. Blanca wants to increase her sales through buying more products to offer her customers and thus to obtain better earnings. Thus, she has requested her first loan of 2000 soles with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to meet her goal. Blanca is a happy and optimistic woman. In her neighbourhood her neighbours and acquaintances hold her in high esteem and consider her to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic needs items and groceries

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom P. is 33 years old and lives in Prey Chour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice and she is also laborer in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sarin Soung, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family.

In order to support her husband’s work, Mrs. Rom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to provide for her husband’s transportation needs.

This couple has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more new movies

loans.name: Simeamativa

texts.en:
Simeamativa C. W. is 35 and married with eight children. She owns a business venture, operating a retail shop in her home village. She has one year of experience in this business. Simeamativa is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase more goods for her shop. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
In 2010, Simeamativa joined Kiva partner, SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Simeamativa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. Visit http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her shop

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn M. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Benito Soliven. She is 30 years old. Carolyn is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Carolyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Carolyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carolyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Carolyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Carolyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Celia Argentina

texts.es: La señora Celia Argentina S. C., es una mujer adulta de 54 años madre soltera de 4 hijos, que son adultos, casados y totalmente independientes, ella es estilista desde hace mas de 15 años, uno de los hijos menores de edad sufre de una enfermedad que dificulta las condiciones económicas de la familia, dentro de sus planes estaba la reinversión a su negocio pero se ha visto en la necesidad de adecuar su hogar para prestarle mejores comodidades su hijo y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan la remodelación del porche de su vivienda, tras esta inversión le permitirá un mejor espacio donde su hijo se desarrolle.
texts.en:
Celia Argentina S. is the 54 year old single mother of four children. The children are adults, married, and completely independent. She has been a stylist for over 15 years. One of her youngest children suffers from an illness, which makes the family’s financial situation difficult. Within her plans was to reinvest in her business. But, she has seen the need to adapt her home in order to make her son more comfortable. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials that will allow her to remodel her porch. This investment will allow for a better space for her son’s development.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her home

loans.name: Akossiwa Françoise

texts.fr: Mme M. Akossiwa Françoise est née en 1957 à Godomé (république du Bénin). Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle se débrouille avec le peu de fonds qu’elle a pour préparer et vendre de la nourriture notamment des mets locaux dans son village. Elle a seule en charge toutes les dépenses de la famille et c’est ce petit commerce qui lui permet de s’en sortir un peu. Malgré son dévouement et sa détermination, elle n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce crédit qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter en gros la matière première entrant dans la préparation de ses mets afin d’en tirer plus de bénéfice pouvant améliorer les conditions de vie de son ménage.
texts.en: Mme M. Akossiwa Françoise est née en 1957 à Godomé (république du Bénin). Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle se débrouille avec le peu de fonds qu’elle a pour préparer et vendre de la nourriture notamment des mets locaux dans son village. Elle a seule en charge toutes les dépenses de la famille et c’est ce petit commerce qui lui permet de s’en sortir un peu. Malgré son dévouement et sa détermination, elle n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce crédit qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter en gros la matière première entrant dans la préparation de ses mets afin d’en tirer plus de bénéfice pouvant améliorer les conditions de vie de son ménage.

loans.use: acheter en gros la matière première entrant dans la préparation de ses mets

loans.name: Nova

texts.en: Nova L. is from the village of St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Nova is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nova runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nova has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nova joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nova is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nova from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Davlat

texts.en:
Davlat N. is 25 years old. He has 9 years of experience in the beef business. His wife is a housekeeper and Davlat is the sole breadwinner in his family. Due to this way of life, this father works hard every day to support his family with the best quality of life he can afford. His butcher shop supplies large amounts of meat to the population that reside in their region. Davlat buys cattle in the market and sells their fresh meat daily to his customers. Due to high demand, this man seeks a loan of 5000 Somoni to invest in more cattle so he can have enough meat to satisfy all of his customers' demand.    
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Santiago Antonio

texts.es: El señor Santiago Antonio E.  tiene un negocio en su casa de habitación en el que vende frijoles cocidos es un señor luchador soltero tiene a cargo tres nietos por los que lucha fuertemente para sacarlos adelante, tiene seis años de trabajar con nosotros y se siente muy agradecido por los financiamientos que le hemos brindado ya que con estos ha salido adelante y le ha dado estudios a sus nietos solicitaba el financiamiento para invertir en comprar frijoles aunque sea medio quintal ya que el frijol está bien caro
texts.en:
Mr. Santiago Antonio E. has a business installed in his home where he sells cooked beans.  He is a hard working single man who has three grandchildren in his care.  He struggles mightily to support them. 

He has collaborated with us for the last six years and he is very thankful for the loans he has gotten because they have made it possible for him to get ahead and provide education for his grandchildren.

He is asking for funds to buy beans, even if just half a quintal, because beans are very expensive.

loans.use: To buy quintales (A unit of mass in the metric system equal to 100 kilograms) of beans.

loans.name: Omar De La Concepción

texts.es: El señor Omar de la Concepción R. L., es un hombre adulto que habita con su pareja de vida y sus tres hijos  menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a los estudios primarios, el señor Omar labora como Guarda de seguridad, ellos habitan en un humilde casa, la cual con este año con las lluvias de invierno, daño significativamente el techo de su vivienda, ha sido con el esfuerzo de él y el de su esposa que han logrado edificar su hogar, y es por esta misma causa que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para el cambio del tejado, esta inversión les permitirá mejor seguridad y condiciones socio económicas para sus tres hijos, sobre todo porque los ingresos que a familia tiene mensualmente cubre solo lo gastos necesarios, ellos esperan que con este préstamo mejoren sus vidas significativamente.
texts.en: Omar de la Concepción R. L. is an adult man who lives with his life partner and three young children who are in elementary school.  Omar works as a security guard and they live in a modest home.  However, the winter rains this year significantly damaged the roof of their house.  They have been able to build the house with the effort of both Omar and his wife, and it is for this same cause that they are requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to change the roof.  This investment will provide them with better security and socio-economic conditions for their three children.  Their monthly family income covers only the necessary expenses, so they hope that this loan will significantly improve their lives.

loans.use: To change the roof of their house

loans.name: Pedro Teofilo

texts.es:
Pedro de 59 años (lo encontramos arreglando su casa), trabaja vendiendo ropa desde las 08h00am para poder cubrir con sus gastos ya que a su edad es un poco complicado conseguir trabajo. Vive con su esposo y hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.

Vende pantalones, blusas, camisas a un precio muy económico y en ocasiones vende por docenas. Para que a sus clientes se les haga más fácil pagar la ropa él se las da a crédito para que las paguen en cuotas. Con el préstamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalón para surtir más la ropa y dirigir una parte para la construcción de su casa. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local propio para tener mas ingresos y así sus clientes se sientas cómodos comprando.
texts.en: Pedro is 59-years-old (in this picture he's working on his house). He sells clothes starting at 8 a.m. to be able to pay his expenses because at his age it's a little difficult to find work. He lives with his wife and children in an urban zone called Guasmo. Most of the people who live there are merchants. He sells pants, blouses, and shirts at reasonable prices. Sometimes he sells by the dozen. To make the transaction easier for his customers he sells on credit and allows them to pay in installments. With this loan he wants to buy blouses and pants to stock up his merchandise and set aside some money for the construction of his house. In the future he wants to have his own shop in order to make more income and make his customers feel more comfortable as they shop.

loans.use: Purchase of shirts and pants

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
El Señor Saturnino V. F. es soltero y no tiene hijos, desde muy pequeño el se dedico a trabajar, el trabajaba de ayudante de albañil, ayudante en chapería , en todo tipo de trabajo donde podría aprender y ganarse un poco de dinero para poder subsistir ya que sus padres lo abandonaron y lo dejaron a cargo de su abuela que es una persona de edad la cual no puede estar todo el tiempo sobre él, después de mucho tiempo ahorro un poco de dinero y se compro una motocicleta y empezó a trabaja como moto taxista  en la localidad de Ivirgarzama, el tiene una antigüedad de más de 5 años dentro esa institución la cual es muy conocida por el servicio eficaz que brinda tanto la institución como sus afiliados.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Saturnino V. F. is single and has no children, he began to work from a very young age, he works as a mason and general bodywork assistant, in any type of work where he can learn and earn a bit of money to be able to live since his parents abandoned him and left him in charge of his grandmother, that is at an age where she cannot be take care of him. After saving for a long time, Mr. Saturnino bought a motorcycle and began to work as a motorcycle taxi driver for Ivirgarzama. He has been working as a motorcycle taxi driver in this company for over 5 years, the company is very well known for its efficient service.

This is Mr. Saturnino’s first loan, it will be used to buy a new motorcycle since the one that he has fulfilled its purpose the new one will allow him to improve his service to his customers as well as his income and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his job as a motorcycle taxi driver.

loans.name: 24 Thieu Ngoc Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Trang N. T. (11) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of Thieu Ngoc Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Trang is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 24 (01.11.24).


Trang is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Trang operates a family member's business raising cattle for sale.  Trang has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Trang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Trang is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Trang from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Trang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:



1.  T. T. Sam (12) is a 58-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Thuy (7) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  T. T. Thanh (8) is a 50-year-old male who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support his business raising livestock.


4.  N. T. Hai (9) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


5.  T. T. Giang (10) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Trang N. T. (11) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu Ngoc Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Trang là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 24 (01.11.24).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Trang thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Trang kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Trang đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Trang đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:



1.  T. T. sam (12) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. thuy (7) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  T. T. thanh (8) là 50 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. T. hai (9) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  T. T. giang (10) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy K. is 42 years old and lives in Bungoma town. She is married to Newton. They have three children who are age 15, 10 and 7 years old. 

Lucy has a beauty salon that she runs in the market and has seen her business grow through the years. This is her 13th year in business. She is in need of hair chemicals and hairpieces for plaiting her clients' hair. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the first one. Her monthly income comes to about $200 which is mostly used to go back into her business.

Her desire is to open up another beauty salon in the neighboring town.

loans.use: Buy hair chemicals and hairpieces for plaiting.

loans.name: Ariunbileg

texts.en: Ariunbileg is 34 years old and lives in the Tuv province of Mongolia. He is a single man and lives in a rented house. His parents and siblings live in the countryside. He started his wooden product business in 1998. He is popular in his area as a highly skilled, talented carpenter and wood engraver. He has made a professional fiddle, a highly respected traditional musical instrument of the Mongolian people, commissioned by the local administration house of the province. He operates his business with a partner. He wants to expand his business and establish a corporation. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy more wood, as the price in the market is lower these days.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida D. es una mujer de 57 años de edad que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena; en un barrio donde habitan trabajadores independientes,  comeciantes y  en general gente muy trabajadora,  Zaida se dedica a la venta de hayacas y pasteles desde hace cuatro años, cuando su esposo quedò desempleado  y llegaron a Cartagena con su madrè y un pequeño capital.  Asì fuè como empezaron  a vivir de la preparaciòn de estos  alimentos y el apoyo de una pequeña  pensiòn de su mamà; Zaida cuenta que con su negocio le ha ido muy bien, porque ha aumentado los ingresos del hogar, su esposo la ayuda y tambien viaja para vender mercancias  por eso se ausenta en largas temporadas y su negocio en ese momento es el sustento del hogar .  Esta actividad productivapracticada por Zaida, ha sido importante para todos porque  ha  logrado reunir un dinero para la cuota inicial de su vivienda  y ahora espera recibirla  para  adecuar su negocio allì, porque su gran desafio es lograr un mecado permanente el este barrio donde proximanete habitarà con su familia. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo,  con el comprarà arroz, aceite,verduras,carnes de cerdo y pollo, para aumentar su capital,  pues espera vender sus productos a tiendas y puntos de venta, con los cuales estaria impactando positivamente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Zaida D. is a 57 year-old woman who lives in the city of Cartagena.  She lives in a neighborhood whose residents are self-employed workers, salespeople and generally very hard-working people.  Zaida's business is selling pies and 'hayaca' (a cornmeal dough with a savory filling wrapped in plantain leaves then boiled or steamed).  She has been in this business for four years, since her husband became unemployed and they came to Cartagena with her mother and a little bit of capital.

They started living on the income from her business preparing this food, with the support of a small pension of her mom's.  Zaida tells us that her business has done very well and her household income has increased.  Her husband helps her and also travels to sell goods.  For this reason, he is often absent for long periods of time and during these times her business supports the household.  Zaida's business activity has been important for all of them because she has managed to get together enough money for a down payment on a house.  She now hopes to receive her house so that she can set up her business there as a big challenge for her is managing to attract a permanent market in this neighborhood where she will soon live with her family.

This is Zaida's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy rice, oil, vegetables, pork and chicken to increase her capital.  She hopes to sell her products to stores and other sales locations.  This would have a positive impact on her income.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, vegetables, pork and chicken

loans.name: 'moonlight' Group

texts.en:
Mamie K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Moonlight'. She is 41 years old, married and has four children who range from 1 to 19 years old. She also cares for two siblings. Mamie was only able to attend school through 3rd grade due to poverty. 

Mamie has been selling pepper, soap, milk, tomatoes and other items in Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for eight years. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more pepper, soap, milk, tomatoes, etc. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman. Her goal is to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, soap, milk, tomatoes and other items

loans.name: Andryi

texts.en:
Andryi is married with an 11-year-old daughter. His family lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. He works as a taxi driver and offers transportation services in the Ukraine. He has been in this business for nine years, and his current monthly income is about 5,000 UAH. 

Andryi is a very determined and hard-working man – he sometimes works 24 hours a day. He is trying to invest all his energy in his venture in order to keep it profitable and sustainable. He is hoping to receive a loan of 12,000 UAH to repair his car engine. A more reliable car will help him to reduce his operating costs, as well as enable him to serve more clients, handle tough competition, and expand his business. Profits generated will not only promote continued growth of his business but also provide a good income for his family.

loans.use: to repair his car engine

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 22 years old. She has one child who is three years old. She is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle. Her husband is a motorcyclist and he hopes to use it for business. With the profits, together with her savings, she wants to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 55 años, vive en su casa propia con el menor de sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 30 años decidió tener una granja de animales menores como cuyes y desde entonces se dedica en la atención y alimentación de éstos. Parte del forraje que ofrece a sus animales ella mismo los cultiva, ya que posee terrenos de cultivo, ahí siembra alfalfa y cada dos meses están listas para ser cosechadas. Considera que la crianza de cuyes es una  opción rentable, pues le genera ganancias que le permite sostener a su familia, sin embargo la bajas temperaturas perjudican en su crianza, muriéndose algunos de frío, por ello ha tomado medidas de prevención, por tanto espera comprar materiales para restaurar sus galpón, asimismo comprará pollos para que aumente la cantidad que tiene. Por otro lado también se dedica a la venta de productos  alimenticios y los ofrece en otras ciudades, entonces cada 15 días viaja para así generarse más ingresos económicos. Es su crédito número 9 que tiene con MFP, considera que pertenecer a su banco comunal le ha traído varias ventajas que hoy agradece ya que pudo  acceder a un crédito  para mejorar su negocio y en la actualidad renueva esa confianza con el firme compromiso de seguir siendo responsable. En esta ocasión invertirá el crédito que solicita, en la compra de mercadería para su negocio que realiza en sus viajes y también más cuyes productores y gallinas.
texts.en:
Lucia, 55, lives in her own house with the youngest of her three children.  Thirty years ago she decided to have a farm to raise small animals like guinea pigs; since then she’s been dedicated to caring for and feeding these animals.  Part of the forage she feeds them she grows herself since she has farmland where she grows alfalfa that’s ready for harvest every two months.  She considers raising guinea pig to be a profitable option because it generates income that allows her to support her family.  However, low temperatures affect production because the cold kills some of the animals. Because of this, she’s taken some preventive measures: she hopes to buy supplies to repair her sheds and chickens to increase the number she has She also sells foodstuffs in other cities that she visits every two weeks to sell and earn more income.

This is her 9th loan with MFP.  She thinks that belonging to a communal bank has brought her many advantages that today she’s grateful for because she was able to access a loan to improve her business and the trust placed in her is today being renewed with her firm commitment to continue being responsible.  

On this occasion, she will use the loan to buy merchandise for the business she carries out on her trips and also to buy more breeding guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a farmer in Kitale town in Western Kenya, producing milk, beans and vegetables. She is aged 41 and married with eight children aged between 19 and 7 years. She has been in farming for 15 years and has two farmhands.

Emily has made a request for a loan amounting to 76,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow and set up a poultry breeding business. This is Emily's third loan request and she says it will help her boost her dairy business by buying another dairy cow for 30,000 KES and using the rest to set up a poultry breeding business.Emily says the income from both the businesses will go into paying her children's school fees.

Emily says unpredictable weather conditions and and poor market prices for  farm produce are their undoing.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and buy poultry.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 40 years of age and married to a farmer with three children. They live harmoniously in the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She has a retail store that she has operated for almost 20 years. She sells grocery products such as sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, and beverages. She earns PHP 6,000 monthly. She is requesting a loan from KIVA and ASKI for PHP 13,000 to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her retail store. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and gain more income to uplift their way of living.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is married, has five children and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school. Marilou earns a living by repairing vehicles and is applying for a loan for PHP 16,000 from NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her shop. She has been in this line of work for nine years and dreams of having enough money to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living on his own. In 2007, this man decided to start his own business selling coffee using a speciA. carrier. He travels across different areas and villages to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. products needed. He’s planning to expand his business in order to earn a greater income. In the future, he is hoping to open his own coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Miyansara

texts.ru: Миянсара проживает в городе Душанбе. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. У нее высшее педагогическое образование. Она преподает математику в средней школе. В этой области она работает уже 19 лет. Кроме того в свободное от работы время она занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Miyansara lives in the city of Dushanbe. She's thirty-eight years old, married and has one child. Miyansara has a university degree in pedagogy; she has taught mathematics in middle school for the past nineteen years. In her free time she breeds cattle for sale. She's asking for a loan to purchase some small cattle breeds.

loans.use: to acquire some small cattle

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 40 years old and is married. She has five children. She sells goods such as water, biscuits and toilet paper in her small boutique. She has three years of experience and she employs one person to help her. She works from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except on the weekend. 

Seraphine has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods such as water, biscuits and toilet paper for resale. With any profits, Seraphine will reinvest in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as water, biscuits and toilet paper for sale.

loans.name: Dalu

texts.en:
Dalu is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He also operates a boda boda (motorcycle) business, which contributes to his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his business. Dalu dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and spare parts for his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Roun

texts.en: Mrs. Roun is a 34 year-old married who make a living by selling some Khmer cakes and other front of her home, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Roun is blessed with three children, all of them are students and living under her care. She has a life partner in her husband who is a coal seller in the village as well. They are able to make an income from the different occupations in average of $4.25USD. Mrs. Roun will use all percentages of a loan fund to add with her personal saving to construct a new house for her and her family’s members to live in as her currently is very old and broken.

loans.use: to construct a new house .

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Grace has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads and canned goods. She has had this business for five years, and she is a new member of HSPFI.

Grace requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is 43 years old and a single mother of one child who is 17 years old. She has been a dairy farmer for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her child’s needs.

She is applying for her second loan of KES 75,000 from KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Florah will use the loan to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child up to university level. Her hope is to export her farm produce.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for mixed crop farming

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: In the photo, Efua is shown with some white sacks containing maize which she purchases in bulk and retails in both bulk and small quantities. A mother of two children, Efua is requesting a loan to add to her existing capital to acquire more bags of maize to sell to her customers. She eventuallty hopes to build a storeroom for the maize.

loans.use: to acquire more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.  Ronald has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. He has had this business for a year. 

He requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional rice to sell.  Ronald is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ronald hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith, 37, lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Faith has a shop that sells fish, such as milk fish and sardines. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell.

Faith has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is married and has 6 children. All of them do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers. He is a very good driver and his passengers trust his driving and like to travel on his rickshaw. Nasreen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her household duties very efficiently. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband. With the loan, he will overhaul his rickshaw and also change its body, which will allow him to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and increase his income.  Nasreen has a lot of confidence in her husband and she is very sure that after investing in his business, her husband’s income will be increased.  That will help her family to live a better financial life. 
Note: "In the photo, one of the members has an embroidery business. That's why she is holding cloth".

loans.use: To overhaul & change the body of the rickshaw

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a small hairdressing business on her porch at Abura in Cape Coast. Efua has received junior high level of education.  She is married to a driver.  The income she makes from her sales is used to help feed the home. Her loan will be used to buy hair products to use on customers' hair. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a dryer.

loans.use: to buy hair products to use on customers' hair.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is an experienced entrepreneur and has been growing corn crops for 13 years. He is married to Margette who is a business-minded woman. Edgar is thankful because she helps him cultivate the farmland. She also works in their grocery store where she sells different kinds of groceries. Edgar sells his harvest at the local market.

He is requesting a loan of 27,000 PHP to expand his business. He will buy farm inputs to treat the land in order to generate more income for his family needs. Though he suffers hardships in maintaining his farming business, he does his best to make it more profitable. He hopes to improve his family's living conditions and to educate his children through the financial assistance he gets from all the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to maintain farming business.

loans.name: Veth

texts.en: Veth, 63, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Veth and her husband are farmers. They also sell natural medicine when they are available from the rice field. Veth is requesting a loan of USD 800 to repair her house. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: André

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il pratique l'activité d'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine et ovine.Il achète des vaches et des moutons sur les marchés hebdomadaires de sa région.Après quatre à cinq mois d'engraissement, il les revend avec une marge bénéficiaire assez importante.Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus tirés de cette activité. Pour augmenter ces revenus, il sollicite un prêt de 400000f de l'UIMCEC afin d'acheter 2 bœufs.Son ambition est de clôturer une de ses parcelle pour en faire une ferme d'élevage.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married father of three children. He is a livestock farmer who specializes in fattening cattle and sheep.

He buys cows and sheep at the weekly regional markets. After four to five months of fattening, he sells them with a sizeable margin. He maintains his family with the income from this activity.

To increase the income, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs from UIMCEC to purchase two oxen. His aim is to fence in one of his plots to raise livestock.

loans.use: buy two oxen

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 11 Group

texts.en:
Umi is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to help her martabak stand.  Martabak is an Indonesian snack that can be made fluffy and sweet with eggs and chocolate or savory and crisp with onions. She has been making and selling martabak since 2009.  She is taking this loan to buy more ingredients so she can increase the amount of martabak she makes. These ingredients include items such as eggs, sugar, flour, onions, cheese, and chocolate. She will also by Tupperware because she wants to start selling Tupperware outside of the nearby school to the parents who wait for their children.

Umi is married with three children. Her children are 10, 8 and 4 years old and they all attend school.  Her husband works as a handyman.  Umi likes making martabak and is happy to contribute to the economical well being of her family.  Until now, her business has faced a few challenges including competitors in her area and lack of access to capital.  But now that she is getting a loan, she does not need to worry about a lack of capital to grow the business.

The other group members will use their loans to help grow their businesses, which are selling nasi uduk (Indonesian coconut rice), selling snacks for children, and running a store selling food at a school.

loans.use: to pay for more ingredients to make martabak (Indonesian snack) and tupperware to sell

loans.name: Meoliole

texts.en:
Meoliole is 37 years old, married to Naomi. They have five children.

He buys  cattle, rears them and resales them when market prices are high, His business has been operating for the last 10 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 13,000. He is applying for his third loan of Kes 50,000. He paid the previous loan on time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds  to buy more cows for  rearing and  resale, he plans to start large scale livestock rearing business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of hides and skin for sale.

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui a arrété ses études à l'école primaire avant de se lancer dans le commerce de produits alimentaires qu'il pratique depuis maintenant 10 ans.Il vit avec ses deux parents et ses frères qu'il entretient avec les revenus de son commerce.Afin de renforcer sa boutique, il sollicite un pret de 25000f pour acheter du riz, de l'huile, du sucre , du savon.Son ambition est de devenir grossite.
texts.en: This loan seeker is a young man who ended his studies after primary school, in order to start selling food products for a living. He has now worked in this trade for 10 years. He lives with his parents and siblings, and looks after them with the money he makes from the business. To boost his business he is seeking a 25,000 F loan in order to purchase rice, oil, sugar, and soap. His goal is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar and soap

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 31 years old, married and has a 2-year-old child.  He does carpentry so as to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person.  He also does masonry work part-time to earn extra income.

Michael hopes to expand his business and grow his clientele in the future.  He has requested a loan of 12,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 42 year old married woman who supports 4 family members from Hay Nazal Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to pay for various products such as perfumes, makeup accessories to sell.In the future she would like to develop her project and she hopes to buy a home.

loans.use: to pay for various products to sell

loans.name: Jimmy Geovanny

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó en esta actividad desde que tenía 15 años, cuando salía a trabajar con su padre quien también era maestro constructor.  Luego decidió independizarse y laborar por su propia cuenta, como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.    Labora solo y cuando tiene bastante trabajo, lo hace todos los días.  Actualmente se encuentra en estado de unión libre y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene un hijo de 8 años, quien estudia en la escuela fiscal del sector donde habita.  A futuro planea arreglar bien su casa, ya que no la ha terminado de construir; y además, tener un local para la venta de materiales de construcción.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas de construcción para su labor.
texts.en: This client is from the city of Portoviejo.  He started this activity when he was 15-years-old.  He used to go out to work with his father who was also a master builder.  He then decided to become independent and work for himself as he’s done to date.  He works alone and when there is much work to be done he works every day.  He’s currently in a common law relationship and his wife’s a housewife.  He has an 8-year-old son who attends the local public school.   In future he plans to fix his house up nicely since he’s not finished building it and also to have a locale to sell building supplies.  For now, he needs the loan to buy work tools for his construction work.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan has 2 children, is 30 years old and lives in Bogesia A village Kuria East sub-county, Kenya. Susan works as a subsistence farmer for a living. Where Susan lives,  community do not have access to safe drinking water. The community collects their water from a local water spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. If Bogesia A community had a way to treat their drinking water, it could reduce the cases of water-borne diseases, keeping Bogesia A community at school and work.

This is why Susan is requesting a loan for a chlorine dispenser on behalf of  community. Susan was elected to represent her community as a volunteer promoter. She is not only representing her community on Kiva, but also volunteers her time to educate the people of her community on the importance of safe water and how to use the chlorine dispenser when they come to fetch water at their local water point. The loan will be used for the installation of the dispensers and the initial supplies of chlorine. Susan wants to be a promoter because she envisions a community free of water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Susan’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 45 years old. He is married and has four children aged between 6 and 16 years old. They all go to school. 

He is a farmer and he has been in business for the past six years. His wife is a businesswoman. Boniface is the man who is raising his hand while the other person is the cow seller.

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows for rearing.With the profits from the business he would like to pay school fees for his children and to improve his standards of livings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.es: Es una señora sonriente, luchadora, madre soltera de 1 hijo adolescente que estudia su quinto año de secundaria. Tiene 43 años de edad, trabaja como enfermera. Desde hace más de 12 años habita en una casa de tambo y madera, que necesita cambiar la madera. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavo y en parte cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento), ya que es mayor durabilidad y para brindarle mayor seguridad a su hijo.

loans.use: para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavo y en parte cubrir los costos de mano de obra.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy wants to pay schools for her children

loans.name: Ilo

texts.en: Ilo I. is a well-known woman in her village and she believes in herself and in what she is doing.  Ilo struggled for a long time due to financial stuff.  But I. has achieved one of her goals to become a successful businesswoman.  I. works everyday on her plantation to maintain its good condition.  She is very happy because she does not worry about anything; she has her own business to run and earns money for herself.  Ilo I. receives more than a hundred tala a day from her merchandise she sells to the market. Ilo uses her loan to buy equipment to help her to do her work easier.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides, fungicides

loans.name: Marcia Alicia

texts.en:
My business is making tortillas and selling them in my community. Now I need to buy corn and have it ground. The income this business generates buys school supplies for my children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es elaborar tortllas y venderlas a toda mi comunidad, ahora necesito comprar el maiz y lugo molerlo. Los ingresos que me genera este negocio compra utiles escolares para mis hijos.

loans.use: To buy corn and other supplies
