loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. is a single mother nurturing two children. She comes from Gulu district in the northern part of Uganda. Currently she is living in one of the residential areas located in Kampala known as Nakawa Quarters. She is 30 years old, and she currently is totally responsible for her children without any assistance.

Helen left Gulu because she felt the North was unsafe due to the war, and she also needed to search for some kind of work so that her family could survive. It was not easy finding work in Kampala, so Helen started a small business. She would cook food and then take it to busy places and sell it. That was how she found Life in Africa: she came to us to sell her meals. She soon became a member and is now employed in the bracelet-making project. She has proved herself to be an understanding and patient person with great interpersonal skills.

Helen is very active and committed to the activities that LIA offers at our center. Over time, through Helen’s job at LIA, she was able to save some money that enabled her to start a small charcoal business in her effort to set up a side income to sustain herself and her family. She has proved to have a good head for business and has developed a solid customer base. She now plans to expand this business.

Currently Helen’s charcoal stall is located in her residential area and it’s being managed by one of her family members. They share the stall, each selling their own goods, and they take turns at working the stall.

Helen has now entered into a partnership with another dealer to travel up-country to buy charcoal at a lower price. They will split the transport costs which will allow each to make a greater profit. She has managed to save 150,000 Uganda shillings (US$ 90) and she is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 Uganda shillings to finance the expansion. Helen plans to reinvest the profits so that her business can continue to grow. With her good reputation and solid customer base she is very confident that her business will succeed and her family will benefit greatly. She feels sure she can repay this loan in a timely fashion.

Below is her budget:

1.Buying charcoal ( 40 bags) at 6000/= ..240,0000/=

2.Loading and off loading.........30,000/=

3.Transport....................48,000/=

35 empty bags @ 500….......17500/=

Emergency…………………14500/=

Total………………………………350,000/=

loans.use: Buying charcoal for resale

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Mr. Ilham is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 32, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ilham rents a barber shop and has two employees. They serve clients and pay the master for the rent at the end of each month. There is a school season coming up, and as a rule all schoolchildren cut their hair before going to school. Ilham's barber shop isn't in good condition and needs to be renovated immediately. Ilham applied for a $500 loan from the Normicro Saatli branch. After getting the loan and renovating the shop, he plans to collect more customers and increase his daily income.

loans.use: To renovate the barber shop

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Inés comes from a humble home; her father died in a traffic accident when she was just five years old, leaving in charge her beloved mother, Gabina, who worked very hard to get her ahead in life. Now Inés has formed her own family with Vicente, and they both dedicate themselves to selling cattle, a job that brings economic stability to their two small children, their reason for working and struggling day in and day out. They are currently living with her mother-in-law, and her hope is to build her own cottage that will offer a safe dwelling for her little ones. She is certain that with the work she and her husband do, they can succeed in this dream. She’s asking for a loan to invest in her business that will allow them to save enough to build this little dream home. Inés and her husband are committed to responsibly repaying the loan within six months. With your help, they can accomplish their dream very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Inés, proviene de un hogar muy humilde, su padre falleció en un accidente de transito cuando tenia cinco añitos, quedando a cargo de su querida madre Gabina, quién trabajó arduamente para sacarla adelante.Actualmente Inés ya formó su propia familia junto a Vicente, ambos se dedican a la comercialización de ganado, trabajo con el que están brindando estabilidad económica a sus dos niños menores, quienes son el motivo que los impulsa a trabajar y esforzarse día a día.En este momento vive en el domicilio de su suegra y el deseo que tiene es el de construir su propia casita para ofrecerle una morada segura a sus pequeños, está segura que con la labor que desempeña junto a su esposo puede lograrlo, para esto solicita un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y así ahorrar lo suficiente para hacer construir su tan deseada casita.Inés y su esposo se comprometen a retornar responsablemente el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.Con tu colaboración ellos pueden cumplir en poco tiempo sus deseos.

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire more small animals.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Tengo una casa de interés social muy pequeña, necesito construir un cuarto para que mis hijos estén más cómodos en realidad me gustaría poder ir haciéndola cada vez más grande pero eso me va a llevar algo de tiempo, quiero dejar a mis hijos una buena casa ya que es el patrimonio de ellos”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto atrás de mi vivienda

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise

I have a small house that is part of a reduced-cost government-housing program. I need to build a room so my children may live more comfortably. Ideally, I would like to gradually make it bigger, but that will take quite some time. I want to leave my children a good home being that it is what they will inherit from me. I need $500 USD for the construction of a new room behind my home.

loans.use: Build an additional room to my house

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 32 yrs old. She is a single mother of 3 children.
She plans to buy a plot of land and also pay school fees for her children from the profits gained from her public pay phone business.

loans.use: Buy her own public pay phone

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Celina, Victoria, and Lucila have been members of the community bank “Suni” for one year, ten years, and five years respectively. In that time they have learned important life values and how to manage their businesses more effectively.

Celina is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has two children. Celina sells beverages on one of the main streets of Ayacucho. She has been renting a building there for six months. Previously, Celina sold clothing at the market in the city of Tambo, which is two hours away. With her new business she is very happy to not have to work so far from her home.

Victoria is 72 years old. She is married and has ten children who are now adults. Victoria has a small store where she sells food staples such as flour, sugar, and beans. She also sells fruits and vegetables.

Lucila is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. Lucila sells a variety of drinks from a store located at her in-law’s house. She has been running this business for three years.

Celina, Victoria, and Lucila need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy soft drinks, beer, barley, peas, wheat, rice, and sugar.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Celina, Victoria, and Lucila plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s education, to build a home, and in the future. Their dreams are to have steady jobs, economic stability, and that their children will become professionals.

loans.use: Celina, Victoria, and Lucila need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy soft drinks, beer, barley, peas, wheat, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Kiwafu A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Justine K.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to buy more chicks. Justine is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. She has 2 children aged 5 and 8 and her children go to school. Each week, Justine makes approximately UGX 57000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for the future. Justine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to buy more chicks and complete the construction of a chicken house and the loan was paid back on time.

Justine is joined in her small group by Mary K., Faith N., Betty N., and Margret A.. Mary K. has a business running a retail shop and wants to add stock. Faith N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales and wants a loan to increase inventory. Betty N. operates a business of poultry farming and wants to add more capital. Margret A. is currently in the business of running a bakery and is requesting a loan to increase production volume.

loans.use: To boost poultry business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Giménez is 54 years old, and has been happily married to Mr Silverio Mercado, 59 years old, for 32 years. Silverio sells cattle. The couple has 7 children, four of whom are married and have left the family home. Two have moved to Spain to find better jobs and are now working, periodically sending a small amount of money home. The youngest, who is 24 years old, is the only child still living with the couple.

Isabel has been a merchant for more than 10 years. She owns a pantry from where she sells basic everyday food products. She began working in this business with the help of her husband who helped her with savings, so that she could set up her microbusiness. Isabel depends on a well-established customer base and furthermore, she offers home deliveries and supplies other businesses in the area.

She requests this loan in order to buy stock such as sugar, rice, noodles, flour, chorizo, maize flour, drinks etc, as well as pigs and chickens to rear. As a result, she will be able to offer a better supply to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Isabel Giménez de 54 años de edad está felizmente casada hace 32 años con el Sr. Silverio Mercado de 59 años de edad; Silverio se dedica a la compra y venta de animales vacunos. El matrimonio tiene 7 hijos de los cuales cuatro ya están casados y viven en forma independiente, dos viajaron a España en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales y en la actualidad ya están trabajando y envían periódicamente un poco de ayuda monetaria a sus padres, la menor de todos de 24 años es la única que está viviendo con sus padres.

La señora Isabel es comerciante hace más de 10 años, ella posee una despensa donde vende productos de primera necesidad, ella se inició en este rubro con la ayuda de su marido quien la ayudo con unos ahorros para que pueda montar su microempresa. Doña Isabel cuenta con una clientela bien formada y realiza además repartos de sus mercaderías a domicilio y provee a otros negocios de la zona.

Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, fideos, harina, chorizo, harina de maíz, bebidas en general, también cerdos y pollos para criar, de este modo abastecerán mejor todos los pedidos de sus clientes minoristas y mayoristas.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, flour, chorizo, maize flour, chickens, pigs, milk, herbs, oil, drinks etc.

loans.name: Kijakazi

texts.en:
Kijakazi, age 40, is married with four children (aged 19, 9, 3, and 1) and she also takes care of her parents financially. She runs a perfume and tobacco business, where she sells these items from 8am to 3pm daily. From this business, which she started 2 years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $30.

Kijakazi hopes for a loan to purchase more perfume and tobacco to sell. She belongs to the loan group, Hatuyumbishul, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of perfume and tobacco

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita lives on Pujio street in the San Juan zone of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are 7 and 3 years old. Her occupation is the creation of bedspreads, which she sells in the main fair of the city of El Alto. Her husband is currently working as a bricklayer in the city of La Paz, with which he helps with the sustenance of the family.

The loan will be used to purchase a sewing machine so that it facilitates her workload and increase her production. This is her second loan with Impro through Kiva, and the evaluation conducted on her qualifies her to receive this loan. The previous loan has been repaid punctually and in the terms that were established.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita vive en la calle Pujio de la zona de San Juan en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 3 años respectivamente. Trabaja en la confección de cubrecamas las cuales vende en la principal feria de la cuidad de El Alto; su esposo actualmente trabaja como albañil en la cuidad de La Paz, con lo cual ayuda al sustento de la familia.

El crédito lo destinara a la compra de una máquina de coser para facilitar su trabajo y aumentar su producción. Es el segundo crédito con Impro a través de Kiva; la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. El préstamo anterior ha sido pagado puntualmente y en los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine for her business in the creation of bedspreads.

loans.name: Ylmer

texts.es:
Ylmer belongs to “Las Divinas” (the wonderful) community bank, located in the district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 47 years old and has 4 children, her husband has a job in the education sector. The income was not enough for her family, thus Ylmer received a loan of $100 USD (S/.300) from Manuela Ramos and invested it in a business to sell personal use items, such as women clothing, lingerie, shoes and other. Currently, she sells different types of merchandise. She gets up at 7 a.m., makes breakfast for her family and sells merchandise from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. With the loan of $525 USD (S/. 1,500), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy clothing for women, men and kids, towels, bed sheets, shoes, lingerie and underwear, etc. Ylmer is a hardworking woman and an excellent mother, because she works with the purpose of helping her family. Her business just began to grow and she has a future ahead as an entrepreneur, she is very thankful for the support given by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ylmer pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Trujillo-252 A, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es empleado del sector educación, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no son los suficientes para su familia, es así que Ylmer con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un negocio D. venta D. artículos D. uso personal como ropa para damas, ropa interior, zapatos, entre otros. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio D. venta D. mercadería diversa, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, D. allí se dedica a la venta D. su mercadería a sus clientes desD. las 9 am hasta la 3 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, toallas, sabanas, zapatos, ropas interiores, etc. Ylmer es una mujer muy trabajadora y una excelente madre por que su trabajo lo realiza con el único fin D. ayudar a su familia . Su negocio recién empieza a crecer y tiene todo un futuro como mujer empresaria, esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, towels, bedding, etc.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing R. is thirty years old and she is married with four children. She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She has been in business since 1999. She is a LAPO client and she needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de Luren.

Yolanda lives with her partner; she is 31 years old and has 3 children. Her major in school was cosmetology and she now has her own beauty salon, located in a rented space in her neighborhood. She works from 9am to 10pm, depending on the number of clients she has. In addition to catalog cosmetics, she also sells small gifts and jewelry which she showcases at her salon.

Yolanda needs a loan of $375 USD to purchase stuffed animals, earrings and hangers. She hopes to be able to expand her business, own her own house, and wishes her children to be young professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.

Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Yolanda estudio la carrera técnica de cosmetología y tiene su salón de belleza ubicado en una avenida de su barrio, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche dependiendo de los clientes que tuviere. Además vende cosméticos por catálogos y también artículos de regalos y joyas que exhibe en vitrinas en su salón.

Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de peluches, aretes y ganchos. Yolanda sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de peluches, aretes y ganchos.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina inició su negocio para tener un ingreso y estar en su casa, hace un año decidió poner una mesa en su patio y empezó con botana, ahora venD. verdura, paletas D. hielo y tiene un mostrador con productos cosméticos.

ElL. necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para techar su patio y poner puerta en L. entrada y que el negocio no se moje y se vea más presentable.
texts.en:
Sabina started her business in order to have an income and to be at home. A year ago she decided to put a table on her patio and started with snacks. Now she sells vegetables, popsicles and has a counter with cosmetic products.

She needs a loan for US$550 that she will repay in six months to put a roof over her patio and a door on the entrance so that water doesn’t enter and the business looks more presentable.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel her business location

loans.name: Irene Maria

texts.es:
La señora Irene María Gutiérrez E. D. Ucañán pertenece al Banco Comunal JERID en Acción II, tiene 49 años y vive en la calle Manuel Arévalo 180 del pueblo joven Aurora Díaz  distrito D. Salaverry provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Irene estudió enfermería Técnica, no continuó sus estudios porque se casó, pero se divorció por falta D. comprensión, actualmente está casada con Martín Ucañán con quien tiene un hijo D. 10 años.
Irene empezó su negocio como artesana haciendo peluches, implementó su negocio con la venta D. ropa y abarrotes actualmente es socia con su cuñada Elvira en la tienda D. abarrotes que ella atienD.. Su negocio se ubica en su casa.
 Recuerda que con el primer préstamo D. 300 soles devueltos en 4 meses compró material para sus peluches.
Con este crédito D. 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas piensa comprar gaseosas, medias y otros materiales para la tienda.
Irene sueña con tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene María Gutiérrez E. of Ucañán belongs to the JERID Community Bank on Acción II. She is 49 years old and lives on Manuel Arévalo 180 Street in Joven Aurora Díaz in the Salaverry district, Trujillo in La Libertad, Perú. Irene studied to be a hospital technician. She didn’t continue her studies because she got married, but she got divorced because of a lack of tolerance. At present, she is married to Martín Ucañán, with whom she has a ten-year-old son. Irene began her business as a craftswoman, making stuffed animals. She stocked her business with clothes and groceries. At this time, she is a member with her sister-in-law Elvira in the grocery store that she takes care of. Her business is located in her house. With her first loan of 300 soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she bought material for her stuffed animals. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments, she plans to buy sodas, stockings, and other materials for the store. Irene dreams of having a big boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different products for her grocery store

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El señor José Samuel C. tiene la edad de 42 años habita en la concepción junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa de don José trabaja como domestica en una casa particular, para ayudarle con los gastos de la casa y la universidad de unos de sus hijos, el hijo de don José también trabaja como jardinero en casa particular para ayudarse con los pasajes y mensualidad de la universidad. Este señor tiene un taller de carpintería el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener ya que es una herencia que le dio su papá y la continuado trabajando por tradición ; pero lo que mas se dedica es a la agricultura la mayor preocupación de él es la falta de financiamiento , el se siente contento por que tiene el apoyo de AFODENIC , que le brinda su mano amiga para que trabaje con sus cultivos y tenga una buena producción , este vez solicita la cantidad de C$ 15,000.00 córdobas para establecer un cuarto mas de piña y lo demás comprar insumos que lo necesita con mucha importancia los otros cultivos establecidos . Su sueño es llegar a establecer seis manzana de piña para poder dejarles herencia a cada uno de sus hijos que al igual que el ; le acostado mantener la producción .
texts.en:
José Samuel C. is 42 years old and lives in Concpecion together with his wife and children. Jose's wife works as a domestic employee in a private house, in order to help with the household expenses and the university fees of one of their children. Jose's son also works as a gardener in a private house to help with University expenses. Jose has a carpentry workshop which with much effort he has managed to keep going, as the business was inherited from his father and he has continued working using traditional methods. But he dedicates himself above all to agriculture and his major worry is the lack of financing. He feels happy because he has the support of AFODENIC, which has given him a friendly hand so that he can work with his crops and ensure a good harvest. This time he is requesting $15000 Cordobas in order to estabilsh a further field of pineapples and also to buy much-needed materials for the other established crops. His dream is to establish six manzanas (about 10 acres) of pineapples, in order that he can leave an equal inheritance to each of children, who like him have worked hard to maintain production.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as pesticide and fertilizer to improve crops

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Vegetable farming is a traditional occupation in northern Tajikistan, especially in Dilafruz’s village. Having a fairly large amount of land surrounding her house, this mother of four decided to try growing vegetables. Neither she nor her husband has been able to find steady employment, and she has been observing the success of her relatives and neighbors who sell vegetables at the market. She has experience growing and selling produce and wants to now do so more intensively to generate more income for her family. She has many ideas about how to be competitive by growing the right crops in a certain way, and she is sure that she will do well. She is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds so she can grow her business. Dilafruz sincerely thanks you for your generous heart. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Gloria Ernestina

texts.es:
La pequeña Empresaria de Nombre Gloria Ernestina R. D. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Gloria tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 16 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria su otro hijo de 4 años cursa el 2 nivel de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como farmacéutico, los propósitos son de mantener su negocio ya que este es el que le da el sustento de diario por lo que con este pequeño negocio es que ha podido saciar las necesidades de sus hijos sus sueños son de que en el futuro comprar su casa propia para dejarle a sus hijos un lugar donde vivir y sea de su propiedad es por eso que en la casa que habita actualmente no es de su propiedad y debido a su necesidad tiene que alquilar sus deseos son de establecer una tienda donde ofrezca una variedad de mercadería y poder dejarle a sus hijos un negocio para que ellos puedan subsistir para el día de mañana por lo que tiene que trabajar fuertemente para darle mejores condiciones de vida a toda su familia.

Su actividad económica es una pulpería donde ofrece los productos como: golosinas, pasta de dientes, cremas, gelatina  entre otras cosas, la ubicación de su negocio es en la colonia Avellán, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de buscar un medio de trabajo y una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos y el pago de diferentes deudas y al principio tenia un trabajo estable pero debido a la situación tuvieron que despedirla y fue entonces que decide buscar un medio de ingresos y fue por iniciativa propia que decide establecer un negocio lo cual fue una pulpería y comenzó con pocos productos como: jabón y golosinas y poco a poco fue aumentando su materia prima pero todavía necesita aun mas es por eso el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de útiles escolares, uniformes de niño y niña ya que se acerca la entrada de clases y quiere aprovechar las nesesidaes de los clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria Ernestina R. D. a 36-years-old businesswoman; she is married and has two sons. Her 16-year-old son is currently in his second year of high school and her 4-year-old son is in level 2 of his elementary education. Her partner works as a pharmacist.

The intentions for her loan are to maintain her business, which is now what gives her daily support. This small business has been able to fulfill the necessities of her son and the family’s future dreams are to own their own home and property in order to give their sons a place to live. The house where they currently live is not their own property and due to necessity she has to rent.

Gloria wishes to establish a store where she offers a variety of merchandise and wishes to leave the business to her sons in the future. She works very hard to give her family a better life.

Her business is a local store where she offers products such as: candies, toothpaste, creams and gelatin among other things. The location of her business is in the Avellán district and she has been running her business for 3 years. She began the business out of necessity for work to support her sons and to pay different debts. In the beginning she had a stable job but due to her situation she had to leave it. It was then that she decided to search for a new mode of income and it was by her own initiative that she decided to establish her store. She began with few products such as soap and candies. Little by little she has increased her product offerings but still she needs more. For that reason she asks for this loan for the purchase of school supplies and boy’s and girl’s uniforms now that the beginning of school is approaching and she wants to take advantage of the necessities of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Osahenrunmwen

texts.en: Osahenrunmwen is 33-years-old and is married with two children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria where she has a hair salon and creates lovely hair styles for her customers. Osahenrunmwen also sells hair-related products such as hair extensions, hair cream, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of $275 (N40, 000) to purchase more salon products to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair-related products to sell in the salon

loans.name: Adesola

texts.en: Adesola A. is a shoe maker. He makes men and womens shoes. He is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Adesola requests the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more materials for making shoes. He says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make shoes to sell

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El sr. Walter es un cliente antiguo de la institución, muy responsable y puntual, trabaja con movilidad desde que era muy joven, sus hijas le colaboran con los gastos de la casa, y él esta al pendiente de su sra. Madre. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de un motor con caja 5ª, para mejorar su herramienta de trabajo. El Sr. es propietario de casa en vila Litoral una popular zona de la Ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Walter is a long-time client of the institution, very responsible and punctual. He's worked in transportation since he was very young, and his daughters help him with household expenses. He also takes care of his mother. He will invest the loan in the purchase of a motor to improve his work vehicle. He owns a house in Villa Litoral, a popular area of the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his taxi

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Mrs. Lam S. and her husband have been working as local crop cultivators for more than ten years. She is 48 and a good mother of four children, who still live in the family home. One of her children is employed. The couple works hard at their farm business activities every day to make an income to meet their children's needs.

The family faces difficulty with transportation during mature crop season. Lam S. is looking for a loan in order to buy an ox-cart so she can use it to transport her crops.

loans.use: To buy an ox-cart.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa es socia del banco comunal “María Asunción Galindo” de la comunidad Kajje, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, madre de 03 hijos, tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (segundo).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 18 años y es fundadora de dicho Banco Comunal.  Inició su préstamo con S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que le sirvió para comprar algunas truchas.

Debido a la demanda que tuvo en este negocio, ella desea prestarse la suma de S/. 700.00  Nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, le servirá como capital adicional para poder adquirir alimento para sus truchas; con ello contribuirá a mejorar la calidad económica de su familia y los estudios de sus hijos, por lo  mismo agradece al Moviento Manuela Ramos por la confianza y su apoyo a las mujeres.
Ella desea comprarse casa en Juli  y ayudar a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "María Asunción Galindo" communal bank in the community of Kajje, Juli district, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, is the mother of 3 children and did not complete her primary school studies (second grade). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 18 years and is a founder of the communal bank. She started with a loan for S/. 300 new soles with which she bought trout. Because of the demand her business had, she would like to borrow S/. 700 new soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, to use as extra working capital to buy feed for her trout. With this she will be able to contribute to her family´s economy and to her children´s education. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for their trust and for their support to women. She hopes to buy a house in Juli and to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed for trout.

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Rehema is a local alcohol seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Maendeleo 'A' group loan (Group code 2015). Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Rehema is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for the preparation of local alcohol for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rehema is married, and has six children: ages 22, 16, 13, 9, 4 and 2.

Rehema will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Sifa who has her own small business selling rice in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for preparation of local alcohol for resale

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., 59, is married and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh. Since 2000, he has been running a motor-taxi to earn a living and is able to make $3 per day. His wife sells newspapers and snow cones in front of her home. She typically makes $3 per day as well. This couple has four children, two of whom are married and two are employed.

To earn more money, Keo S. would like to take out a loan to build rooms to rent out to garment factory workers. This will give his family an additional income.

Note: Keo S. was not available for picture so his wife and his daughter are pictured instead.

loans.use: To build  rooms to rent

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. sells yams at Abotoase near Hohoe. Grace has received Junior High School education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Grace has been selling yams for some time now. She is responsible for taking care of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more yams for resale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and increase her capital  and profit.

loans.use: buy more yams for resale

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita S. is an experienced weaver who makes warm winter accessories such as socks, shawls and hats. Babita is requesting a loan of Rs. 15,000 to purchase new woolen material so she can continue to make her winter accessories which she supplies to a number of shops in Kathmandu and also to buyers overseas.

Babita explained that it is very easy to sell her stock during the colder months, but since it is very hot right now in Nepal, there is little demand for her products. She is certain that the demand will increase in winter and this loan will help her increase her stock in preparation.

Babita’s husband helps her in the business, and the couple has two children, a daughter who is in primary school and a son who is five months old.

loans.use: To buy materials for making winter accessories.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es una mujer trabajadora y muy querida en su barrio, a sus 35 años, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Marcial de 37 años y sus 4 hijos: Yara de 15, Pilar de 14, Fridman de 11 y Zulla de 9 años, ella ha luchado mucho para salir adelante y mejorar su vida. Maximiliana es la administradora de uno de los restaurantes más concurridos de la comunidad donde está  la mina La Rinconada en Ananea (distrito de Juliaca), tiene menús muy surtidos y la comida es muy deliciosa, sus clientes salen muy contentos y satisfechos. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es atender a sus comensales, ya que siempre los atiende muy rápido, en los 8 años que lleva en este negocio ha aprendido a trabajar bajo la presión de sus clientes y es justamente eso lo más difícil de su negocio, puesto que siempre trata de satisfacer a todos lo que comen en su restaurante. Para el futuro espera tener un restaurante con ambientes adecuados, donde sus clientes se sientan más cómodos. Maximiliana se encuentra en su sétimo préstamo con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos que tienen entre socias. Con los mil nuevos solicitados comprará nuevas mesas y sillas para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a hardworking woman who is much beloved in her neighborhood. She is 35 years old and lives in a rented house with her 37 year old husband Marcial and their 4 children: Yara - 15, Pilar - 14, Fridman – 11, and Sulla – 9. She has fought hard to get ahead and improve their lives. Maximiliana manages one of the most popular restaurants in the community near the Rinconada Ananea Mine (in the Juliaca district). She offers an assorted menu of delicious foods, and her customers leave very happy and satisfied. What she enjoys most about her business is attending to her customers, whom she tries to respond to each one fairly quickly. In the 8 years she has been operating, she has learned to work under the pressure from her customers. This is the hardest part of her business, but she always tries to satisfy everyone who comes to her restaurant. In the future, she would like to provide a suitable environment where her customers feel more comfortable.

Maximiliana is on her seventh loan with MFP and knows she has to make her payments on time. Her communal bank is a very happy group and all the members get along with one another. With her loan of 1000 soles, she plans to purchase new tables and chairs so that her customers will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es:
Loydith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 59 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de bocaditos, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de bocaditos,(dulcen pequeños propios de la región) ubicada en su misma casa, su principal herramienta es un horno, donde los asa. Trabaja con pedidos anticipados, para fiestas y cenas especiales, prepara buffets para matrimonios y cumpleaños.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que acuden a su casa, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como harinas de yuca, maíz y trigo, huevos en javas y cajas de leche y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Loydith, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Loydith belongs to Las Brisas Communal Bank in Bellavista, a district of the province Bellevista, in the department of San Martín. She is married, 59 years old, and the mother of 3 children, all of whom are grown. With a talent for cooking of different kinds of snacks, Loydith used her first loan of S/. 300.00 to, on her own initiative, launch her business selling "bocaditas" (small sweets from the region) out of her house. Her main tool is her oven, where she bakes her "bocaditos". She takes orders for parties and special dinners, and prepares buffets for weddings and birthdays. Now, despite the time that has passed, she continues to run her business, and has a faithful customer base that come to her house, where she serves them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of S/ 1,000.00, she will buy ingredients such as flour (yuca, corn, and wheat), eggs, and cartons of milk -- as well as some tools to implement her business and better serve her customers -- for the daily making of her foods. She is ready for everything and still feels the strength to continue working and get ahead. Loydith is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients and tools for the daily preparation of her food products.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: BilA. is a 24-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007, he decided to open his own business as a water distributor to earn income to satisfy his needs. Today, BilA. is requesting to borrow US$ 800 to buy merchandise to increase his sales.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 44 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos viven en su casa. Desde hace 22 años se dedica al comercio de comestibles en su misma casa, la cual está ubicada frente al parque principal de su localidad, por ello, sus principales consumidores son los jóvenes, pues los productos que más vende son las golosinas y bebidas, en un segundo plano, los abarrotes y verduras. Julia atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche y cuando sale de compras su esposo se queda atendiendo su tienda, pues esta pareja no desea cerrar ni un solo día para no perder clientela, pues gracias a ellos logran reunir poco a poco sus ganancias, las cuales invierten en la educación superior de sus hijos.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ella es una cliente muy responsable y participativa en las reuniones y decisiones de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará gran variedad de golosinas para satisfacer a su principal clientela, los jóvenes.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old. She and her partner have 5 children, of whom 2 still live with her at home. For 22 years, she has been engaged in selling groceries out of her house, which is located in front of the main park in her area. As a result, most of her customers are young. Her best selling products are candy and soft drinks, followed by groceries and vegetables. Julia opens her store at 6am and closes at 11pm. When she is shopping for supplies, her husband tends to the store because she does not want to close and chance losing customers. Thanks to the earnings that she has accumulated over time, she has been able to provide her children with a higher education.

This is Julia’s second loan with MFP. She is a very responsible client who participates in the meetings and decisions of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy a variety of candy to satisfy her main customers – young people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy to add to her inventory

loans.name: Sokveng

texts.en:
Mr. Sokveng C., 57 (pictured with is wife), has been an assistant of commune leader for almost 25 years. His wife, Mrs. Ly Hak, 51, stays at home and does housework. They have been married since 1975 and have five children: 2 sons and 3 daughters. Two of them have full-time employment and other two are in school. The family lives along national road number one apporximetely15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sokveng’s children don’t have transportation for commuting to school and they spend a lot of money for traveling costs very often. Therefore, Sokveng is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school.

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata K., Mabinty K., Mariatu K. and Mariatu T.. They named their group Talapsu. For the very first time, these entrepreneurs are requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leone each from Kiva lenders to enable them to improve their businesses and living standards.  

Aminata K. (on the right) is the leader of this group. She is age 28 and was born in Makeni. She is married to a lecturer and they have three children: one in secondary school, the other in primary school and the last one is not of school-going age. Aminata sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), “gara lappers” (locally dyed clothes) and shoes. Aminata has been a businesswoman for about 18 years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Zuleya Makongo

texts.en: Zuleya O. is a married woman, 26 years old, who is blessed with two children. She runs a retail shop selling things like soft drinks, cooking oil, snacks and other items at a place called Mautuna in Eldoret. Zuleya was introduced to KADET by an existing member. She has requested a loan which she is planning to use to buy more stock for her shop which includes cooking oil and sugar. Zuleya’s future dreams are to grow her business, to build a good house, and be able to educate her children. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy stock for her retail shop

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is 26. She is married and has two children. Both of her wards are in the basic school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Industrious as she is, Agatha works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a seamstress by profession. Her shop is on one of the streets in her community. Agatha designs and sews dresses for her female clients. According to her, she has no apprentice yet. Agatha buys the fabrics from nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing accessories to improve upon the quality of her services.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mr. Heang P. is a villager in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. He is a motorbike taxi driver.

Mr. Heang P.’s wife, Mrs. Thy Mary, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money for her cultivating. Thus, Mr. Heang P. decided to ask for a loan to buy farming supplies for her rice paddy.

Mr. Heang P. is 55 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other stays at home to do housework. His wife is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for his wife's rice paddy

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel C. P. tiene 46 años y vive en la zona de Esquilan Chico en la zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Angel aun no se caso y vive en casa de su madre. Angel trabajaba como constructor albañil toda su vida pero como su madre y padre son personas de mucha edad, el decidió dejar ese trabajo y dedicarse a la producción de leche cruda junto a sus padres. En esta casa es donde tiene 8 vacas lecheras que fueron la herencia que le dio su mama para que él se haga cargo.

Angel aun quisiera formar una familia, tener hijos y en un futuro nietos, pero él nos dice que lo primero es su mama y su papa y que después habar tiempo para todo lo demás. El crédito será destinado a la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción lechera y sus ingresos.

Angel nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a sus padres para que el día que mueran, lo hagan felices. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que saque quisiera utilizarlo para poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Angel C. P. is 46. He lives in the Esquilan Chico area south of the city of Cochababa. Angel has not yet married, and he lives in his mother’s house. Angel worked all of his life in construction as a bricklayer. Because his parents are elderly, he decided to leave this work and work with his parents in the production of raw milk. He has eight dairy cows at his house. His mother gave them to him so that he would manage them. Angel would still like to have a family, have children, and have grandchildren in the future. But, he says, his mother and father come first. Later, there will be time for the rest. The loan is to buy another dairy cow. That way he will be able to increase dairy production and his earnings. Angel tells us that his greatest dream is to be able to give his parents all of the comforts he can so that they will die happy. He also tells us that the next loan he takes he would like to use to be able to improve the condition of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia K. G. is 26 years old, married and has a two-year-old baby boy. Her husband is a casual laborer and they hope to give their child a good education some day. Her business is located at Kiganjo in Thika, a growing town where she engages in tailoring and embroidery. She serves the local people and she manages debtors who are not willing to pay for the services. She is using her loan to buy more materials and embroidery threads to enable her to make clothes and sell them at wholesale. She is a hardworking, intelligent, courageous, and patient worker.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Mohammad Esmail

texts.en: M. Esmail, son of A. M., is married and lives with his own family. He has a butcher's business and has been involved in this line of work for a long time. He used his first loan to further his business. Now he plans to enlarge his business and is therefore requesting a second loan of 50,000 AFN to enlarge his shop and purchase more stock. He is happy to receive his second-cycle loan.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and purchase more stock

loans.name: Bagna Jessica

texts.es:
Bagna García de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposo es comerciante con el tiene 2 hijos de 7 y  9 años ellos son estudiantes de escuelas fiscales.

Bagna empezó en la esquina de su casa vendiendo lápices, cuadernos, plumas, poco a poco sus ingresos fueron aumentando y puso un local grande en su casa.

Ahora ella trabaja todos los días desde las 09:00 hasta las 23h00 vendiendo papelería, cuadernos, lápices, marcadores etc. Hasta ahora no se le ha presentado ninguna complicación en el negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, lápices, marcadores para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda con víveres bien surtida.
texts.en:
Bagna García is 38 years old and lives in the peri-urban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and has all the basic services. Her husband works as a merchant and they have two children, ages 9 and 7. Both are students enrolled in public schools.

Bagna began selling pencils, notebooks, and pens on the street corner in front of her house. Over time she was able to increase her earnings and open a large store in her home. She now works every day from 9am to 10pm selling stationery, notebooks, pencils, markers, and other items. Until now, she has not encountered any difficulties with her business.

With this loan, Bagna plans to buy notebooks, pencils, and markers for her business. In the future, she wants to open a well-stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, markers, and pencils

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel tiene 50 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella cuenta con muy buena clientela pues siempre esta y con el paso del tiempo ha logrado incrementar su mercadería y la amplia variedad de clientes que posee, pues siempre está pensando en la mejoría de su familia  ya que busca la forma de ganarse el pan de cada día. Ella solicita este financiamiento como una oportunidad para comprar cremas, tratamientos para el cabello, pintura de uñas, pinturas de labios, perfumes, maquillajes, delineadores y brillos labiales. Por lo que sueña con obtener muchos clientes y ofrecer el mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel is 50 years old, her economic activity is the sale of cosmetics. For more than three years this has been her business. She has always had a very good clientele and over time she has increased her inventory and the variety of clients that she has. She is always thinking of the best interest of her family and how to earn their daily bread. She is seeking this loan as an opportunity to buy creams, treatments for hair, nail polish, lip sticks, perfumes, makeup, eye liners and lip glosses. Her dream is to gain more clients and to offer better services.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: creams, treatments for hair, nail polish, lip sticks, perfumes, makeup, eye liners and lip glosses

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 45 years old and married with six children ranging in age from 10 to 27. Her two youngest children are currently enrolled in school, along with one grandson that just began his education.

Priscah has been farming for three years now near Kitale, Kenya, and her focus is on tomatoes and other vegetable production which she then sells to local retail outlets. She spoke of a few challenges in her business, citing unstable markets as her main concern. She also spoke of diseases being common in the area with a number of livestock affected at times.

Priscah requested this loan of Kes 25,000, her second with Juhudi Kilimo, to start a poultry farm. She wants to expand out of just vegetable production and she says that the extra income will assist her family in alleviating poverty and in providing for better education in the coming years.

With an outlook to the future, Priscah wants to own at least two quality dairy cows in the next five years in order to further diversify her business.

loans.use: To start a poultry farm

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dioni, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, des céréales et la préparation de galettes.
Ces femmes du groupe Benkadi viennent de commencer leur collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont leur premier prêt.
Ce  premier prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité  de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes et des sacs de céréales pour en faire des galettes.
Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments alimentaires et en céréales à Barouéli  et environnants. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Barouéli  et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are all married, and on average are 39 years old, have two children and all live in traditional extended families in Dioni, in the Barouéli Prefecture, part of Ségou Region (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through family ties and they retail food condiments and grain cereals, and prepare flatcakes.. The women from the Benkadi group have just begun collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI and are requesting a first group loan. The loan will be used to buy a large quantity of various food condiments and bags of cereals to make flatcakes. They generally get their condiments and cereals from Barouéli and the surrounding area. They sell their products at the Barouéli market and in area market fairs, for cash, retail and credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 15,000 FCFA each, which will be used for daily family expenses, and the rest reinvested in the commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food condiments and cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn O. is from Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Merlyn owns and operates a motor transportation business. She has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2005, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan, her 7th, of 20,200 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Pablo O. F., tiene 41 años de edad es casado, y padre de 2 hijos adolecentes, la familia habita en el Barrio San Francisco, su esposa es docente y con sus ingresos aporta a la economía del hogar, el señor Pedro es agricultor de yuca, desde hace mas de 21 años, la mitad de su vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad y conoce el manejo de ella misma.

Ellos tienen planeado la adquisición de razas de ganado, para la formación de un ato, e incursionar en la ganadería, otra actividad en la cual se lucra de buena manera, para esto realizara la compra de pastos mejorados, pues planea tener todos los recursos para el ganado una vez que se compren,  pero antes de realizar esta inversión desea adquirir fertilizantes, abono y pesticidas que permitan un mantenimiento correcto para mejorar los niveles de venta y por ende aumentar las ganancia que favorezcan a los planes que la familia se ha trazado, en el pasado Afodenic bajo los fondos Kiva apoyaron al Señor O. y pudo diversificar sus cosechas que le permitieron un aumento en los volúmenes de ventas y ganancias, ahora espera que se le apoye nuevamente para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, en la incursión de nuevas fuentes de ingreso.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo O. F., 41, is married and has 2 teenage children. The family lives in the San Francisco neighbourhood of Managua. His wife is a teacher, and contributes economically to the home. Pedro has been a cassava farmer for over 21 years; half of his life has been dedicated to this activity and he knows it well. They plan to acquire livestock in order to form a herd and get into ranching: another very profitable activity. For this, they will buy improved grazing pastures, and they plan to have every resource needed for their livestock before they buy the animals. Before they do so, they want to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides which will help increase their sales and allow them to carry out their plan. With a previous loan through Afodenic and Kiva, Pedro was able to diversify his crops and increase his sales and profits. He hopes that he will find more help to improve his family's quality of life through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer, manure and pesticides

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old. He is a married father of three children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old. All the children are currently attending school.

He is a dedicated farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 25 years and has employed two people on a temporary basis. His products are sorghum, beans, maize and milk, which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from the sale of tea.

His biggest challenge in farming is the high cost of animal feed due to limited land to plant the animal feed.

He recently completed his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 and is requesting this loan for Kes. 60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will be used to pay school fees and improve the living standards of the family.

In the future, he would like to buy more cows and land to expand his farming activities in order to increase his income.

He is grateful to Juhudi because it has improved his living standards.  He says that the interest rate is affordable and promises to continue being a member.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yasmeen Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen bibi lives in Vehari Pakistan with her family. She has three children and none of have been able to get an education yet due to financial problems. Her husband has an animal selling business, specifically he sells donkeys to people who do loading (hauling) business on their donkey carts. He has been in this business for over six years.  

Yasmaan bibi is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. He will buy more donkeys and increase his earnings. She is hopeful that by investing money in her husband’s business for profit, she will be able to send her children to school one day. 

Note: "In this photo Bashiran the group member is showing her clothes selling business".

loans.use: Purchase donkeys for animal selling business

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf, aged 55 years, owns a dry produce business that he has operated for eighteen years. He lives in Kyenjojo Uganda. His dry produce business is affected by price instabilities and seasonal changes.

The father of ten children aged between 28 years and 10 years, Adolf dreams of expanding his farming activities. He intends to use the loan to buy groundnuts (peanuts), maize and millet to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts, maize and millet to sell

loans.name: Masinavaaia

texts.en: Masinavaaia A. is 46 and married with two children. She owns a business venture baking and selling puddings in the local community and has one year of experience in this business. Masinavaaia needs a loan of WST 1,000 to rent baking equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US$60 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Masinavaaia joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To rent baking equipment

loans.name: Uon

texts.en: The happy faced person, Mrs. Uon P., is a villager living in the province of Kompong Tom. She has spent her whole life farming crops. She owns a piece of farmland in a good location for growing, which she uses to plant morning glory, cabbage, and rice for a profit. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Uon P. is taking out her loan to use towards planting a rice crop during the rainfall season.

loans.use: To plant a rice crop during the rainfall season.

loans.name: Yeral José

texts.es: El Sr. Yeral José P. él es Trabajador de la Empresa Electric Man Power desempeñándose como Técnico auxiliar tiene dos  años de trabajar para esta Institución, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL uno lo  realizo para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para la compra de repuestos mecánico de un vehículo los cuales los créditos con ceprodel  le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Yeral José P. is an employee of the Electric Man Power Company and has worked the past two years as an assistant technician. He has a child who is of school age. Yeral has had two loans with CEPRODEL, one of which was used to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

He is now requesting a loan in order to buy mechanical parts for his vehicle. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit because they have allowed him to improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Etey

texts.fr: Agriculteur maraîcher de profession, Mr M. Etey est né en 1969 à Kpomé dans le Zio. Il est père d’un (01) enfant et a à sa charge un autre enfant. Il cultive principalement des légumes notamment les tomates et les oignons. Le financement qu’il sollicite servira à acheter des intrants agricoles et à étendre son domaine cultivable. Cela lui permettra d’accroître sa production maraîchère et d’améliorer son niveau de revenus.
texts.en: Agriculteur maraîcher de profession, Mr M. Etey est né en 1969 à Kpomé dans le Zio. Il est père d’un (01) enfant et a à sa charge un autre enfant. Il cultive principalement des légumes notamment les tomates et les oignons. Le financement qu’il sollicite servira à acheter des intrants agricoles et à étendre son domaine cultivable. Cela lui permettra d’accroître sa production maraîchère et d’améliorer son niveau de revenus.

loans.use: acheter des intrants agricoles et à étendre son domaine cultivable.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en: Mrs. Saran U. and her husband, Mr. SU.-eng Bou, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1983 and have two sons — one employed full time and the other one in school. Saran and her husband have been raising pigs and producing rice wine since they were married. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase food for her pigs and rice for making rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase food for pigs and rice for making rice wine.

loans.name: Deolinda Tomas

texts.pt:
Deolinda Tomas F. nasceu na província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique é viúva e mãe de 6 filhos de idades entre 18 a 27 anos de idade. Fez a 4ª classe não continuou devido a casamento prematuro. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para cidade da Matola quando começaram a constituir seu lar com o marido. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 20 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 14.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria. (Barclays). 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma conversa com um cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.300.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria (panos, lencois, cortinas e produtos alimentares) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para melhorar as condições de habitação em sua casa oferecendo mais conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Deolinda Tomas F. was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and the mother of six children, who are between 18 and 27-years-old.  She finished through fourth grade but didn't continue because she got married early.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.

She left the city of Maputo for the city of Matola when she and her husband began to build their home.  She has had her own business selling basic goods for more than 20 years.  She doesn't have any employees and makes a monthly income of around 14,000 meticais.  She puts this towards living expenses and also saves some in her bank account at Barclays.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a conversation with another customer of the bank.  This is her first loan in the amount of 10,300 meticais, which she will use to buy merchandise (towels, bedding, curtains, and food) to increase her amount of merchandise.

She is confident that she will make her payments before their deadlines so she can ask for another loan to improve her home's living conditions and offer more comfort to her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (towels, bedding, curtains, and food).

loans.name: :   Edgar Alberto

texts.es:
EDGAR ALBERTO O. S., trabaja como Conductor en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán. Cecna  . el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcciom como: zinc , perlines, pintura y clavos para el techo de su casa de habitacion, es padre de familia de tres hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
ha trabajado ocho prestamo son ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edgar Alberto O. S. works as a driver for the Nicaragüense Alemán Professional Training Center.  He requests a loan to buy construction materials such as: corrugated metal roofing sheets, structural beams, paint and nails for the roof of his house. He is the father of 3 school-aged children.  

He has previously taken 8 loans with CEPRODEL, and he has used these loans to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: he will use the money from the loan to buy construction materials to replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña María, se dedica a la venta de Tortillas y ropa, tiene 51 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel,  ella es madre soltera de una hija de 28 años de edad que es la que siempre la acompaña, su negocio lleva ya 10 años de existir, y dio comienzo por iniciativa propia ya que ella tenía que ver la forma de contar con ingresos para poder subsistir con su hija. 
Hoy día solicita un préstamo para la compa de maíz, gas y también ropa, este le ayudara a tener a disponibilidad lo necesario para realizar sus ventas, con la ropa pues debe estar actualizada con la ropa de moda, con estilos y colores nuevos.
Ella sueña con tener su negocio por largo tiempo, prosperar económicamente a través de este y satisfacer sus necesidades cotidianas.
texts.en: Doña María, 51, sells corn and tortillas for a living.  She lives in San Miguel, in the the department of San Miguel and is a single mother of a twenty-eight year old daughter, her constant companion.  She has had this business for ten years and got it started on her own since she had to find a way she could count on to support her and her daughter.  Today she is taking out a loan to buy corn, gas, and also clothing.  This will help her have what she needs to make her sales.  Regarding the clothes, well, they should be up-to-date and in style -- with the new styles and colors.  She dreams of having her business for a long time, prospering economically from it, and satisfying her daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase corn, gas, and clothing.

loans.name: Enyel Bladimir

texts.es:
el joven Enyel Bradimir C. B. esta casado con la joven Candida Waleska Flores y viven en el barrio las Brisas de la ciudad Nacaome.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de calzado nuevo y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias. desea tener mas surtido de calzado ya que esta temporada de navidad es una epoca en donde el nivel de ventas se incrementa notablemente.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y tambien para salir adelante con su esposa.
Ellos son un matrimonio joven y tienen muchas ganas de superarse, comentan que ahorita que estan jovenes tienen todas las energias para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Enyel Bradimir C. B. is married to Candida Waleska Flores.  They live in the Brisas neighborhood in the city of Nacaome.

He will use the loan to buy new footwear.  That way he will be able to increase his sales and his income.  He wants to have more footwear stock because the Christmas season is when sales increase considerably.

He needs the income to cover the household expenses.  He also needs it so that he and his wife can get ahead.

They are a young couple, and they have a great desire to improve themselves.  He says that now, when they are young, they have the energy to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy footwear for women, men, and children

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es:
Angela Maritza de 41 años de edad  trabaja como Afanadora del Hospital Jacinto Hernández, desde hace 24 años, tiene 2 hijos: la mayor de 17 esta empezando sus estudios universitarios y el menor de 12 años estudia 1er año de Secundaria, su esposo trabaja como Auxiliar de Mantenimiento en el Hospital, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar, doña Angela es una mujer responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy humilde, vive en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, ella se siente agradecida con el apoyo de kiva ya que anteriormente pudo construir su Pantri y compró electrodomesticos gracias a este Financiador.

Por tanto ahora solicita credito  para ampliaciòn de cocina  pues la que tiene es muy pequeña y necesita mayor comodidad. 

Su sueño es tener una vivienda digna donde su familia se desarrollen en un ambiente sano y agradable.
texts.en:
Angela Maritza is 41 years old.  She has been working as a cleaner at the Jacinto Hernández Hospital for 24 years.  She has two children: the eldest is 17 and is beginning his university studies and the youngest is 12 and in the first year of his secondary education.  Her husband works as a maintenance assistant at the Hospital.  They both share the household expenses.

Angela is a responsible, honest, hard-working and very humble woman.  She lives in area # 2 of Nueva Guinea where the population is growing.  She feels grateful for the support of Kiva since she has been able to build her pantry and bought domestic electrical appliances thanks to her loans.

She is requesting this loan to extend her kitchen since the one she has is very small and she needs more comfort.

Her dream is to have a decent home where her family can live in a safe and pleasant atmosphere.

loans.use: To finish extending her kitchen

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical caracterizada por producir principalmente frutas como el mango,la maracuyá y el limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Rosa siempre trata de brindarle a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y un trato amable con lo cual se ha asegurado una clientela fidelizada durante el tiempo que lleva funcionando su negocio.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos, de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 35 year-old mother who lives together with her husband and three children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area with a semi-tropical climate which is noted for producing fruit such as mango, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Rosa has a small grocery stall in her home.  There she offers her neighbors and acquaintances different daily-use products, essentials and groceries.  Rosa always tries to provide her customers with good-quality products and good customer service.  This has ensured her a loyal customer base over the time that her business has been operating.

Rosa would like to expand her business, acquiring more products so that she can meet her customers' demands.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To expand her business by acquiring more products

loans.name: Licett

texts.es: Liccet, de 28 años, vive en una casa arrendada  en compañía de su madre; juntas buscan salir adelante en busca del progreso.Desde hace cuatro años vende libros que distribuye de casas editoriales de prestigio, vende principalmente a docentes, librerías  y también al público en general, es por eso que siempre esta en búsqueda de clientes.
