Muestra su catalogo de libros a sus clientes lo que le permite ofrecer con garantía y buen precio ofertas de cada libro, se siente contenta y satisfecha de desarrollar este negocio porque ve que aparte de resultarle  rentable en sus ganancias  es un negocio positivo que aporta a la cultura de su comunidad . Como es una mujer emprendedora para el fututo tiene planeado  incrementar su capital y obtener un  lugar estable de ventas.Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo ya que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Licett tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  libros de novedosas ediciones, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Liccet is 28 years old.  She lives in a rental house with her mother.  Together they look to get ahead in life, in search of progress.

For four years, Liccet has been selling books from prestigious publishing houses.  She mainly sells to teachers, bookstores, and also to the general public.  She is always looking for new customers.  She shows her book catalog to her customers which allows her to sell with a guarantee and to offer each book for a very good price.  She feels happy and satisfied to be in this business because she sees that, in addition to being profitable, it is also a positive business that brings culture to her community.  As Liccet is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to increase her capital and obtain a stable place from which she can make her sales.

This Is Liccet's second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she has always shown herself to be responsible in making her repayments.  She likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to the people who will make this loan possible since it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Liccet plans to invest the money she has requested in buying a larger quantity of new edition books.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of books to stock her business

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Concepción J. H. de 49 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Chalatenango, junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos quienes dependen por completo de del trabajo de su padre. Concepción posee una venta de hamacas con la cual cuenta desde hace varios años atrás, él es una persona muy agradecida con la vida, ya que goza de la bendición de poseer un negocio propio que le ha permitido brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia, la cual la es la principal razón por la que se esfuerza día con día. La venta de hamacas la realiza de forma ambulante en donde cada día muy temprano Concepción  carga sus hamacas desde su hogar hasta las calles de Chalatenango, ofreciéndosela a diferentes clientes,  con el deseo  de vender la mayor cantidad  de su producto, y con la ilusión de poder obtener muy buenas ganancias, que le permitan ofrecerle una mejor vida a su familia. Es por esto que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de hamacas.
texts.en:
Concepción J. H. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Chalatenango department.  They all depend on him for support.   Concepción has been selling hammocks for several years.  He is very grateful for life and is happy to be blessed with having his own business because it allows him to provide for his family’s needs.  This is the main reason for his daily effort.

He sells on foot and every day, early in the morning, Concepción carries his hammocks along the streets of Chalatenango, offering them to different customers, hoping to sell large numbers so that he can generate a good income with which to provide his family with a better life.  He is asking for this loan so that he can buy a large quantity of hammocks.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es: Ciro, tiene36 años de edad, natural del distrito de Quimbiri, es un hombre muy trabajador; esta casado con Alicia de 28 años y tienen 03 hijos; juntos viven en su propia casa, ubicada en la  comunidad de Roca anexo del Distrito Quimbiri. Ciro, es el sostén de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar  en la chacra, es campesino y viene trabajando 16 años en sus propias tierras, espacio en donde cultiva café y hojas de coca; que son plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de jornaleros, quienes rápidamente extraen los frutos y hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio que están situadas en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y sembrar plantas de cacao y plátano. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el crédito. Con los  1,500 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará jornaleros para realizar el desmonte de malezas, asimismo comprará semillas de café para sembrar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Ciro is 36 years old, from the Quimbiri district. He is a very hardworking man. He is married to Alicia, who is 28, and they have 3 children. They all live together in their own home, located in the Roca community, in Quimbiri. Ciro is the breadwinner for his family; since childhood his parents raised him to work on the farm. He is a farmer, and has worked his own lands for 16 years, growing coffee and coca leaf, which are plants native to the Apurimac River valley.

During the harvest season, help from day laborers is necessary, as they quickly pick the beans and coca leaves. What he enjoys most about his work is harvesting, as he feels the months of hard work are reflected in the quality of the fruits.  The most difficult part is transporting his goods from the farm to the collection centers, which are located in San Francisco. Here the best prices are offered for his products. In the future, he would like to purchase more land in order to increase cultivation and grow cacao and banana. 

This is his first loan with MFP. He believes this contribution will help him greatly with his business. He is grateful to the Institucion Prisma for extending this credit to him. With the money requested, he will contract day laborers for clearing weeds, and purchase coffee seeds for planting.

loans.use: Purchase coffee seeds, and contract workers to assist with weeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava leaves to sell

loans.name: Bellarina

texts.en:
Bellarina P. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old and married. To make a living, Bellarina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, snack foods, and beverages in the local community. Bellarina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Bellarina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bellarina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack food. This loan will be Bellarina's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improv and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alma Ileana

texts.es: Alma Ileana se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos para su negocio. Inicialmente empezó con medio de ingreso necesario para su hogar, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo como toda madre responsable busca el trabajo diariamente para ofrecer el pan de cada día. Tiene más de 9 años en su actividad, por lo que siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes solicitan. Este crédito es para la compra de camisas, faldas, pantalones, cosméticos, bolsos, calzado y perfumes. Sueña con establecer una tienda y mejorar su propiedad.
texts.en: Alma Ileana engages in selling general merchandise. This is not the first time she is requesting a loan for her activity. She started this activity to have an income to provide for her family, as she has 2 children in her care, and like every responsible mother she goes to work every day to provide them with the daily basic necessities. She has been running her activity for more than 9 years, and she is always keeps an eye on what her customers request. The loan she is requesting will be use to buy shirts, skirts, trousers, cosmetics, handbags, shoes and perfumes. She dreams of opening a shop and of improving her property.

loans.use: To buy shirts, skirts, trousers, cosmetics, handbags, shoes and perfumes.

loans.name: Ademar

texts.es: El Sr. Ademar Vive en la localidad de el torno, es de ocupación moto taxista, hace unos tres año que se dedica a esta actividad, hace un par de meses que esta viviendo con su pareja, ya que  esta formando su propio hogar, el destino del crédito es para la compra de una motocicleta y así poder incrementar sus ingresos, su pareja se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en el mercado de la localidad desde niña, ya que sus padres siempre vendieron en el mercado, el es nacido en el departamento de Chuquisaca, cuando era niño sus padres se vinieron a la ciudad de santa cruz en busca de nuevos horizontes, ya que la vida es difícil en el campo de Chuquisaca, El Sr. Ademar esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Ademar lives in the neighbourhood of El Torno. His job is driving a motorcycle taxi; he’s been doing this for three years. For the last two months he’s been living with his fiancee and making a home with her. With the loan Ademar plans to buy a motorcycle and thus earn more money. 

His fiancee has sold groceries in the local market since she was a young girl, a job her parents also did. 

Ademar was born in the department of Chuquisaca. When he was a boy, his parents moved to the town of Santa Cruz in search of a better future as life in Chuquisaca was difficult. He is grateful for the support that the institution of Emprender (Kiva partner) provides.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab is a wife and mother of four sons. Her husband is a taxi driver in the city of Rafah in the Gaza Strip. Rihab's husband needs to have his car fixed and maintained.

Rihab took out a loan from FATEN to help her husband--who appears in the picture here instead of her as she is a conservative woman--to pay for the maintenance and increase the car's working hours and thus profit.

loans.use: To pay to perform maintenance on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Bella Domingo's Group

texts.en: Bella is the leader of 11 members taking a group loan. Bella is married and 35 years old. She has a retailing business where she sells soap, shampoo, bread, soft drinks and other products required for daily use by her co-villagers. She has operated this business for almost five years. Bella is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase soft drinks, bread, canned goods and sugar to sell in her village. She usually earns about PHP 7,000 each month in this business. She hopes that her business will improve through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, canned goods, soft drinks and bread to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married and has nine children. She is 51 years old, has three children who are still in school, and works very hard at a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more food items to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sabougnima Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Il est composé de 06 femmes habitant le même quartier et partagent les même ambitions.

Madame Mariama qui est à droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée 38 ans. elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en charge un enfant confié par un parent.

Elle s'active dans la vente de lait. Activité qu'elle pratique depuis très longtemps.

Avec ce prêt elle compte augmenter sa marchandises afin de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle va gagner, elle participera à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité des enfants en charge.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was set up on October 19, 2001. It is composed of 6 women who live in the same neighborhood and share the same ambitions.

Mrs Mariama, standing at the right on the picture and raising her hand, is responsible for the group. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of four children. She cares also for the child of a parent of hers.

Mariama sells milk. She has been in this business for a very long time. She intends to use her loan to increase her inventory and better meet her customers' demand.

She will use her future profit to participate in school fees for the children in her care.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es:
El Sr. Hilarion tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ita, en la casa de sus padres, él se encuentra trabajando como inspector de la Empresa de Transporte San Buenaventura y también realiza recargas de celulares, es una persona soltera proveniente de una familia responsable y dedicada al trabajo.
Se considera a si mismo como una persona trabajadora,luchadora, proveniente de una familia humilde, cree en la dignificacion por el medio del trabajo. Cree que si es que tiene los medios mecesarios para poder tener un mejor futuro, no dudara en trabajar. 
Él solicita el crédito para la compra de saldos de celulares ya que le esta recibiendo mucha demanda por la zona, por el simple hecho de que las personas no quieren acudir hasta la compañía más cercana o por ende ir hasta el centro de la ciudad.
Su objetivo en la vida es de formar un hogar y de ver creciendo a sus hijos y formándose como persona.
texts.en:
Hilarion is 31 years old and lives in the city of Ita in his parents house. He works as an inspector for the Empresa de Transporte San Buenaventura and, also, recharges cellular phones with minutes. He is single and comes from a responsible family that is dedicated to work. Hilarion considers himself a hard-working, competitive person from a humble family, and he believes in advancement through work. He believes that if one has the necessary means to obtain a better future, one will surely work.

Hilarion is requesting a loan to buy minutes to install on cellular phones, since he is receiving much demand in his zone. The simple reason is that people don't want to travel to the nearest company or to the center of the city.

Hilarion's goal in life is to form a home and to see his children grow and become real people.

loans.use: buy minutes to recharge cellular phones.

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en:
Marie  is 48 years old and married with three children between 11 and 29 years old. She takes care of one child who is seven years old.  Her business is well organized. She sells cows and has seven years experience in this business. She currently employs three people to help her. Marie operates her business from 5 am to 6 pm every day.

Marie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company (S.a) to purchase more cows for resale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and hopes to renovate her own house.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Zhanylbubu

texts.en:
Zhanylbubu is 62 years old. She worked as a milkmaid at the local farm for 30 years and is known as a hard-working person. 

To find means of subsistence for her family, Zhanylbubu began her business in cattle breeding and land cultivating. Owing to her wide experience in these activities, she managed to develop her farm successfully. Currently, she grows barley and clover and has six sheep, four goats and cows on her farm. She sells milk to the local dairy farm. 

With the revenue from these activities, Zhanylbubu was able to provide her children with the essentials. Now Zhanylbubu plans to use this loan for 35,000 KGS to purchase one more milk cow to raise her sales of milk. With the revenue from this investment, she plans to make renovations on her house.
 
In the future, Zhanylbubu plans to maintain a big farm with a large number of cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Keub

texts.en: Mrs. Keub, age 54, is married to Thorn, age 45. She has eleven children, ten of whom are single and one is married and living in dependently. Three of whom are employed in different jobs. For the rest attends school. They always use their own farmland to grow some crop for both rainy season and dry season. Mrs. Keub and her husband can make an income of approximately $4USD each day to help cover the family’s expense. Mrs. Keub will be using a loan in a mount of $500 to buy fertilizes and seeds for planting during rainy season coming now.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizes and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Gleza

texts.en:
Gleza is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Gleza has a food shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue.

Gleza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gleza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making barbecue.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is 57 years old and married to Susan. They are blessed with four children who are 28, 25, 20 and 18 years old. He owns a farm in Saniak and raises livestock. He has been operating his farm for a period of five years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He has borrowed a loan from KADET LTD for KES 10,000. This is his second loan after servicing the previous one successfully. He plans to use this loan to purchase dairy feed. The anticipated profit will be used to purchase a dairy cow.

He hopes to educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells gari and maize, all in bags, at Krofofordo near Abura. She is divorced and has 2 children. Ekua has been selling bags of gari and maize for 10 years. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize and gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize and gari (ginger) to sell.

loans.name: Irenea Group

texts.en: Irenea is married with 3 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Mahayag.  She has been selling dried fish to earn a living for the past 3 years, and earns PHP 4,000 each month.  She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. She is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.  Irenea has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Yeium

texts.en:
Yeiun, 52 years old, is a farmer who earns about $1 per day. Her husband is selling coffee and earns approximately $8 per day. She has two children. One is studying and the other is working in the factory earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on school fees, and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $200 to dig a well near her house. She wants to support one of her children who is working in Phnom Penh to sell coffee because this career can make good income.

loans.use: To dig a well near her house.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y su esposo es chofer y también trabaja como mecánico. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como ser: refrescos, dulces y conservas para surtir su tienda de abarrotes. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Cotahuma de la Ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha sells groceries. Her husband is a chauffeur and also works as a mechanic. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as soft drinks, candy, and preserves so that she can restock her store. Martha lives at the home of her parents in the District of Cotahuma in the city of La Paz. She is married and has two children.

This is the first time she has requested a loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candy, and preserves.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de cinq enfants. Les trois sont des élèves. Elle exrece le commerce de tissus et de produits de mercerie qu'elle vend en détails après s'être approvisionnée dans les pays limitrophes ou les prix sont moins chers.Son activité lui rapporte des bénéfices très consistants qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et d'appuyer même son mari dans l'entretien de la famille.Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce en cette veille de fete ou la demande est très forte, elle sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des tissus de diverses qualités et des articles de mercerie.Son ambition est de s'engager un jour dans l'import- export.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman with five children.  Three of her children are in school.  Her business is selling fabrics and sewing supplies which she sells retail after stocking up in neighboring countries where the prices are lower.  Her business makes her very consistent profits which allow her to support herself and support her husband in providing for their family.  In order to increase her business on this holiday eve when demand is very high, she is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy different quality fabrics and sewing supplies.  Her ambition is to one day start working in import - export.

loans.use: to buy different quality fabrics and sewing supplies

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 25 years old and lives in Luyang, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with two children.

Geraldine is engaged in the selling of cosmetic products to her regular customers, and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 to purchase more cosmetics products.

Geraldine has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months. In the future, Geraldine hopes to expand her business and have saved deposits for her children`s future education.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 42 years old and lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. Gina has a shop that sells noodles, canned goods, biscuits, etc. She has had this business for a year. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, etc. Gina has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Gina hopes to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Kabende Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
John is a hardworking young man, married with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He owns a carpentry workshop that he has been operating for the last six years and faces the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation.  In spite of this, John has a dream of expanding his business into new markets and have a more permanent location. 

Targeting the Christmas season, he needs the loan to buy wood, mattresses and covers to use to make furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy wood, mattresses and covers to use to make furniture to sell.

loans.name: Adol

texts.en:
Adol is a 35 year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school.  She has had a business of selling charcoal in Langber Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Adol requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 44 years old and a single mother of one child who is 22 years old. She runs a food stall that has been in operation for 12 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 15,600.

This is Serah's second loan with KADET ltd and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the funds from this loan to buy food stocks such as rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil. Serah hopes to open a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to buy food stocks such as rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mamour

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire dont les deux parents sont décédés.Il vit avec ses frères et soeurs. Il commercant ambulant dans les différntes marchés de sa localité. Il s'approvisionne en vetements dans la capitale et à l'aide d'un sac en plastique transparent , transporte sa marchandise à travers la ville pour la proposer aux passants. Ce travail très difficile lui rapporte quelques bénéfices qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à certains besoins de ses frères ety soeurs.Auparavant, il a été successivement pecheur et conducteur de charette de tarnsport de marchandises.Afin d'augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un pret de 100 000f pour acheter des jeans, des tee - shirt et des tissus. Son plus grand reve est d'ouvrir une boutique au marché central et de se fixer définitivement.
texts.en: This lender is a young single man whose parents are both deceased. He lives with his brothers and sisters. He is a roving salesman in the different markets in his area. He purchases clothes for sale in the capital city, and transports the goods in a clear plastic bag throughout the town in order to offer them to passers-by. This difficult work generates a small income which allows him to cover his living expenses and to assist his brothers and sisters with theirs. In the past, he has been a fisherman and a delivery driver. In order to grow his income, he is seeking a loan of 100,000f to buy jeans, T-shirts and cloths. His biggest dream is to open a shop in the central market and to have a fixed location.

loans.use: to buy jeans, T-shirts and cloths

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel used his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more trousers. Since then, he has gained more profits from his business. Daniel is looking forward to expanding his business into wholesale within five years. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more trousers.

loans.use: to buy more trousers for resale.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 50 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Marka Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for her home improvements, She wants to improve the kitchen and maintenance of the bathroom. In the future she would like to buy a car and she hopes for her son's to continue their education.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Binh's Group

texts.en:
Binh was born in 1984. She has two children who are learning at kindergarten and primary school. Her husband is a welder and he gets 3,000,000 VND from his job. Binh sells ice-cream and ice for a living. She gains 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,500,000 VND per month. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell more ice-cream and ice in the market for raising her family’s income. Her dream is can let her children going to school till higher education.
Other members which are part of Binh's Group include the following:
 Nam is 30 years old. She has two children. She is a teacher. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to raise chickens for selling. 
 Ban is 30 years old. She has three children. She is a teacher. She wants to borrow 7,840,000 VND to raise chickens for selling.
 Toan is 32 years old. She has two children. She raises pigs for a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise more chickens for selling.
 Muon is 51 years old. She has four children. She raises chickens for a living. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to raise more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more ice-cream and ice for selling in the market.

loans.name: Sonagnon René

texts.fr: Sonagnon René est âgé de 40 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse nommée Alice. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Sonagnon René assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges familiales. Sonagnon René a très fréquenté l'école mais est dessinateur de profession, activité qu'il exerce de façon secondaire. Sonagnon René fais également l'élevage de lapin qu'il revend, activité qu'il exerce à son domicile de huit ans. Sonagnon René s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Sonagnon René sollicite pour une cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des lapins.

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pierrette est âgée de 26 ans et vit au Bénin. Pierrette est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Paul. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Pierrette vend depuis quinze ans des conserves et des condiments. Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pierrette ensemble avec les membres du  groupe la MAHOUGNON, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de  ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et des condiments.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Don Luis vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el posee un taller de carpinteria ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza los muebles, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina sells cosmetics and perfumes. She has been working in this type of activity for several years but needed to stop after having two you children. Two months ago she restarted her business by buying her products on 15 days credit. The problem with this is that she cannot afford to buy a large amount of products and she loses a significant amount of potential profit. She is seeking the loan in order to avoid this and buy in bulk.

Sabina is 40 years old and has 2 kids. Her husband is a construction worker and always contributes to the family. They are from rural Ecuador and have been able to fix up their home through hard work and savings.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She will buy perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Suifilifilia

texts.en:
Suifilifili operates a food stall three days a week in her local open air market.  She prepares and sells hot food items such as fried mutton flaps, turkey tails, and chop suey with taro or banana.  She is very popular because she provides a good product and gives good service.

Her sales are approximately 500 tala per day, which she uses to purchase food supplies, repay loans that she has received from SPBDF in the past, and to provide for the needs of her family.

She now wants to borrow an additional $1,200 to purchase food supplies and building materials to further expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase lamb crops, mutton flap, turkey tail. Soy sauce, plastic plates                   (HI)= cement, timber, nail

loans.name: Sabza Gul

texts.en:
Sabza Gul lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an old woman. She lives with her husband who has a retail shop. He has 20 years of experience in this business and he is faced with economic difficulty. To help him, his wife took her 4th cycle group loan and her husband completed his shop. Now his wife wants to take anther loan for her husband to buy powder, Pepsi Cola, milk and baskets to increase his business and make a good life for them.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the borrower. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to many people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy extra things like powder, Pepsi Cola, milk and baskets

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en: Tuong, the mother of this family (56 years old)  lives in the same house with her children and grandchildren. She sells charcoal, her daughter sells cakes and candies at their home, and her son-in-law goes out to work. Her two grandchildren are still young. Their average income is $13 per month per person. Tuong wants to borrow $ 50 to increase her capital for her charcoal-selling business. She feels sure they can repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: additional capital for her charcoal business

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: "LAPO has brought light to my family," says Mrs. Taiwo O.. She specializes in the sale of bags of pure water. She is from Edo State and is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four (4) children. She needs an additional loan of $800 to buy more bags of water. She has 6 years of business experience.

loans.use: To buy more bags of water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make improvement to his shop/home

loans.name: Musawa Women's Group

texts.en:
Harriet Hamubiru is the 38-year-old chairperson of the Musaua Women’s Group in Katwe. She is married with 4 children. For the past nine years, she has operated a health store which sells vitamins and health care items. Group Loan Disbursement meetings are always interesting. One has to have patience. We arrived in Katwe, a slum area on the outskirts of Kampala around 3:00PM. Most disbursements occur in the afternoon because the chairperson and treasury have to go to the bank, collect the money, and return to their village. Sometimes even lines at banks can be a couple of hours. Once they have returned to the village, someone is sent out to tell all the members that it is time to meet.

We arrived at the meeting place, a simple concrete home in Katwe. Most homes are adobe. Removing our shoes, we entered through the draped doorway. We took our seat on a comfortable but worn sofa and waited. Over the next two hours, people arrived and took a place on the floor. We waited for all to arrive. As people came through the draped doorway into the darkened room, they would greet us with “You are most welcome” and then take their place in the room. By the time all had arrived, there were 28 persons in a 12ft. by 12ft. room lit only by the light of the doorway. There is a peaceful calm in groups. Ugandans rarely raise their voices. In groups they are soft-spoken to the point of whispers, even when addressing the entire group.

Harriet’s portion of the group loan is $300US. With her loan, she plans on buying more health care items for her store. She dreams of one day being able to buy a plot of land and build some houses that she can rent.

loans.use: Harriet plans to use her loan to purchase more health care items for her drug store.

loans.name: Sartiah

texts.en: Sartiah is a 25-year-old woman. Before she joined MBK, her husband M. was the only one in their family who worked. But, since joining MBK, Sartiah has been able to start her own business - she now makes bamboo matting at her house, and typically earns US$20 per month. Sartiah needs IDR 1,000,000 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Kireka A3(I) Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Lukiya N..  She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to increase her stock.  Lukiya is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver.  She has 10 children ranging from age 15 to 30 and her children go to school.  Each week, Lukiya makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education.  Lukiya has previously taken a loan from BRAC Uganda in the amount of UGX 700,000 in order to invest in the charcoal business and the loan was paid back on time.  Lukiya is joined in her small group by Sauya N., Hasifah K., Margret N., and Teopista Natambi.  Sauya N. currently runs a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more items for the shop.  Hasifah K. also runs a canteen and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to increase her stock.  Margret N. currently runs a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to purchase more salon equipment. Teopista Natambi is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to start selling firewood.

loans.use: Expand charcoal business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 35 years old and is a single working woman.  She owns a small beauty salon and also sells clothes.  Amina started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 9am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $380 from her sales.  Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more  items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Florencia C. Q. is 57 years of age, and has attended school until the 5th grade. She has five children but only one still depends on her for support. She lives in the province of Otuzco in La Libertad area of Peru. The business involves buying and selling small animals such as pigs, "huachos", chickens and guinea pigs, which after "fattening up", she kills to sell the meat. She also sells wheat and barley, and purchases cheese curds to re-sell. She buys the cheese curds, in bulk, in the Tupac Amaru village, which is located a few hours away in Otuzco. Many of her neighbors know her, and look for her so they can place orders for her products.

Through a family member, she joined the community bank "Mujeres del Olivo", and this is how she obtained her first loan of S /. 300.00. Most of this money was spent buying cheeses and animals. This new loan of S /. 1200.00, which she plans to pay off in four months will be used to buy 4 pigs, 3 "huachos", chickens and cheese.

Her biggest dream is to own a sales post in the market of Otuzco, where she will be able to offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Florencia C. Q. tiene 57 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene cinco hijos en total pero solo uno aun depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. El negocio al que se dedica es la compra y venta de animales menores tales como: chanchos, huachos, gallinas y cuyes el cual después de engordarlos sacrifica para vender la carne. Así también vende grano de trigo y cebada, además compra cuajada y queso para volver a vender. Muchos de sus vecinos ya la conocen por eso siempre la buscan para hacerle algún pedido. El quesillo lo compra al por mayor en el caserío Tupac Amaru ubicado a unas cuantas horas de Otuzco. Por medio de un familiar pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 la mayor parte de este dinero lo invirtió comprando queso y quesillo y otra la invirtió comprando animales. Con el préstamo de S/. 1200.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprará 4 chanchos, 3 huachos, gallinas y quesos. Su mayor sueño es tener un puesto propio en el mercado de Otuzco, para allí ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: With this loan she will purchase more animals to sell through her business. (Con el prestamo comprara mas animales par a su venta)

loans.name: Juliana's Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Juliana is 37 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, aged 15, 10 and 7 years old. Juliana is a vegetable seller, which she started doing in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

In the past, Juliana has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania, to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Matilda, who has a business dealing in fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou C. is a 57 year old widow with 6 children and 3 other people in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 6 and a half years. She would like to strengthen her business by buying palm oil for resale. Her income will allow her to take charge of the feeding, education, and health of her family. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Aissatou C., 57 ans, veuve avec 06enfants et 03 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce en achetant de l’huile de palme pour revendre Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge l’alimentation, la scolarité et la santé de sa famille.Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell palm oil

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum T. is a subsistence farmer in Kandal Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, she also owns a small grocery store in the village.

Mrs. Prum T. is a 49 year old widow with five children, two of whom run a motorbike with cart to transport people or goods as a business. The three remaining children are attending the local school.

Mrs. Prum T.’s grocery store is too old so she wants to build a new one. Unfortunately, she has insufficient money to afford it. Therefore, Mrs. Prum T. asked for a loan to build a new, more attractive store in order to sell her products more easily.

loans.use: To build a new grocery store to replace the old one.

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Oghogho E. is 42 years old and married with 8 children. She sells bread and provisions. She has been in this business since 1998. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to make a kiosk for selling bread and provisions. Similarly, more bread and provisions will be purchased for sale. She says thank you to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use:
To make a kiosk for selling provisions  and drink and to buy more drinks                  
    and provisions for sale

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina is 24-years-old and lives with her husband and two children. She is a young mother, and she strives day after day to attend to her small children and to her difficult work in the fields, which she has done since she was 5 in an independent manner. Her parents taught her everything about agriculture since her childhood. She started working after leaving secondary school to capitalize on her own economic strength. Today her responsibility as a mother is larger. Therefore her daily tasks consist of reviewing the progress in her fields where she grows alfalfa and corn. She sells the corn at the local market and sells the alfalfa to neighbors who have farms. She also tends to rent out plots of land.

Melina works hard because she wants to see her children be better every day. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in her next planting. She would like to increase her production and grow cereal.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Melina tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Es una joven madre de familia, que día a día se esfuerza por atender a sus pequeños y también a las duras tareas del campo, lo viene haciendo desde hace 5 años, de manera independiente, ya que desde su niñez sus padres le enseñaron todo lo referente a la agricultura, ella comenzó, al salir de la educación secundaria, para capitalizar su propia fuerza económica, hoy su responsabilidad como madre es grande, por ello que sus tareas diarias consisten en revisar el progreso de sus campos de cultivo donde siembra alfalfa y maíz, el maíz lo comercializa en el mercado local y la alfalfa la vende a sus vecinos que tienen granjas, también suele a arrendar los surcos de sembrío.

Melina se esfuerza porque desea ver a sus hijos cada día mejor. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá invertir en su próxima siembra, pues en esta ocasión quiere agregar a su producción, el cultivo de cereales.

loans.use: Purchase of necessary supplies to prepare her land for sowing season

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo inició el negocio para tener un ingreso extra para poder solventar sus necesidades y la de sus hijos, ya que su sueldo en ocasiones era insuficiente y quería darles estudio. Comenzó en Marzo de 2005, con la elaboración y venta de comida cuando su esposa le sugirió participar en una “Tanda” de dinero para invertirlo en unas sillas y mesas en el patio de su casa el cual acondicionamos. Desde entonces les ha ido muy bien ya que les venden comida a compañeros de trabajo que también son choferes y en la actualidad tiene muchos clientes también gracias a sus hijos les ayudan mucho en la atención a los mismos. Gracias al anterior crédito que les proporcionó KIVA, pudieron capitalizarse y atender también algunas necesidades de mobiliario que tenían, así como volver a resurtir materia prima para seguir elaborando sus comidas.

El necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima que les permita seguir con su negocio de elaboración de comida. Con tu apoyo Eduardo seguirá con su negocio
texts.en:
Eduardo began his business in order to have extra income to meet his and his children’s needs, as his wages on occasion were insufficient and he wanted to give them an education. He began in March 2005 making and selling food when his wife suggested participating in a money “Tanda” to invest it in some chairs and tables on the patio of their home. (A “tanda” is when a group agrees that each member will contribute a quantity of money weekly, biweekly or monthly, and then that sum is distributed to a group member. Each group member will, in turn, receive the sum of money collected). Since then the business has gone very well for them as they sell food to their colleagues who work who are also drivers and today they have many customers thanks to their children who help them a lot by waiting on tables. Thanks to a previous loan through KIVA, they could invest and attend to some furniture needs that they had as well as restock ingredients to make their meals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make food
